3.description: Worst facial experience ever. I purchased a Youswoop for a 1-hour facial, I just returned home from the facial, recovering from my mental suffering, and in the process of requesting a refund from Youswoop. The "studio" is a tiny room located on the 9th floor of a building, which feels like a senior center to me. The owner, Ming, and her assistance did not leave the room while making me take off my clothes to lay under cover. The facial consisted of three different layers of cream, 25 minutes of me laying in the room by myself, and numerous insults on how bad my skin is. Ming was the most condescending person from whom I've ever gotten a facial from. I was flabbergasted at how rude she was and how bad the "facial" was. This is the first facial experience I've had that there's no steaming, no asking how sensitive my skin is, and no extraction.  In the end of the facial, I had to walk out of the room without saying a word, because I was trying so hard to control my anger. If you are looking for a facial place, I highly recommend you run away...

1.description: I've been going to M Studio for almost 5 years and my skin has never looked or felt better. Both Ming and Basha have a wonderful touch.

2.description: I try the Endermologie machine by LPG to slimming and toning my skin by my stomach. This really works. I had ten treatments and I was able to achieve my goal faster. You also have to exercise along with eating lite. LPG is a non evasive treatment at the M Studio. I feel and look better wearing something more  taper to the body. I  definitely recommend the M Studio.

5.description: I have been going to Ming for a couple of years and have been very pleased with how good my skin has reacted to treatments.  I am not one to invest in something that doesn't pay off.  I started with a facial now and then and was given good counsel on how to keep my skin as healthy as possible. I ventured into some microdermabrasion sessions and saw a major difference in the softness and reduction in fine lines on my face.  I find the sessions relaxing and feel pampered. The space is in a high rise residence but there is no issue with from my perspective as the treatment is as good as you'll get in a much more pricey spa setting. You simply head into the clean and fresh room and Ming works her magic. The prices are remarkably fair (I have investigated costs) and there is a variety of treatments.  I am now starting something called LPG, which is a great anti-aging treatment that is non-surgical.  I am not interested in cosmetic surgery at this point and the innovative ultrasonic treatments (google the treatment) are making a difference in tightening my skin (including my neck and jowel area) and further reducing fine lines (further than what the dermabrasion does).  I am a fan and will continue to go to Ming for my facial needs.

6.description: I happened to stumble upon The M Studio while I was looking for places online near my apartment for a facial. It was two weeks before my wedding when I saw Ming, the owner. She did my facial and promised me she would help me clear up my skin for my wedding.... I ended up having the best facial experience with Ming and I was so relaxed I fell asleep. While the skin was getting treated on my face I also received a wonderful hand and foot massage by one of her employees- it was to die for. You could tell the products were top notch because it smelled wonderful- and she explained every detail of her process and ways that I should practice this at home. My skin not only felt incredible right after, but I immediately started seeing results. I came back again a week later for another one. ON TOP OF THIS... she even put me on a whole new skin care regime which has completely cleared up my skin and I feel amazing! She was true to her word! I highly recommend and I will definitely be back.

7.description: I discovered M Studio when I purchased a Groupon for 3 - 60 minute facials but I got so much more.  Mae, the owner, personally did my facial while her assistant gave me a hot stone massage and foot massage.  My skin looked better after the first treatment and she gave me some solid skin care advice.  I'd gladly try out their other services.

0.description: I just got back from having my facial today and it was FABULOUS. Normally Ms. Ming does my facial, but today Basha (I hope I spelled her name correctly) did my facial instead, I must say it was great. I'm so relaxed. Every time I come here for my facials I leave satisfied, relaxed and my skin is glowing. Both Ms. Ming and Basha take the time to give you advice always on how to keep up with your face. They're really professional. Also they give facial massages while they're doing your facial. I was in heaven I didn't want to get up. I definitely recommend The M Studio to anyone who is looking to get a facial by people who actually know what they're doing and care. It's not just a job to them they actually really care. Thank you Ms. Ming and Basha I couldn't ask for more.

4.description: I've only ever had a facial once before so granted, I don't have much to compare it to, but I feel I had a really good experience here. Ming educated me as to why the way I was using facial scrubs was wrong, and told me what to do instead. She also explained why my skin didn't need the microabrasion with the crystals, which I also appreciated. Bummed I got no foot or hand massage as others have discussed but I wasn't expecting one so *shrug*.To the person who felt she was condescending, I can see why you might feel that way but IMO she was just very direct, which I appreciated.

3.description: I love Kitchfix and am so happy they opened in the neighborhood. Amazing customer service. Amy in particular is very knowledgeable about the food products and goes out of her way to answer questions. They keep it interesting by incorporating new meals and flavors into the rotation. This place is as good as quick clean food gets: delicious, fresh, and low-sodium content (unlike competitors like Snap Kitchen) Love the fast energy bar and granola options too. The paleo kale salad is my favorite.

1.description: I am a big fan of KitchenFix, and it is really great to have the healthy options they provide available in the Gold Coast! As a physician who focuses on preventive medicine, their philosophy and products are something Chicago needs more of! The entire team is very warm and welcoming. Amy in particular is incredible and always highlighting the new meals they have introduced. Glad to have this place in the neighborhood!

2.description: Kitchfix has great healthy options. Their menu is full of paleo and other healthy options. My favorite thing about them though is that they are always so accommodating and really personalize your orders.

5.description: I've been eating paleo for a few months now, and kitch fix has been a beam of sunshine withon this fairly restrictive diet. I had their matcha latte the last two mornings, and it has hit the spot the same way a Starbucks green tea latte would. Also tried their paleo muffin, and yum! Great staff too!

6.description: I've only been here once so far, but loved it!!! The woman helping me was really helpful explaining what they were all about and what products they offered. They gave me a free sample of hot chicken broth...who knew chicken broth by itself could be so good?! I ended up getting the Tropical Chia Pudding and Curry Chicken Salad. LOVED the chicken salad - I'll be back soon for more! Didn't love the chia pudding, but that's mostly because I'm not a huge fan of ginger, which it had a decent amount of. Over all, I think it's a great place and I'm excited to welcome them to the Gold Coast neighborhood!!

0.description: Calorie counting is so difficult for me. 1) I don't like to cook, but when I do, it's hard to factor in calorie count for every single ingredient.2) I'm always on the go, so I eat out a lot, this obviously is even more difficult counting calories than former issue.Kitchfix solves all these problems away. They cool for me, and labels tell you how much calories are prepackaged food! LOVE LOVE LOVE!

4.description: A new arrival on the healthy gluten free all natural scene.  I have used their green drinks and vegan menu items.  The carrot Paleo muffins make for a tasty snack. Their green drink is the only one I know of that has ginger in it. At other places, it is an add on and you're charged.  They have a dietitian on staff for special requests.

3.description: Came back here with my friend and he got great service with a return for his sunglasses that had some defect. Thank you to the new staff there!!

1.description: Located in the heart of the Viagra triangle, so you know there's no parking! Store had good service from Mario, and selection is decent, but you obviously have way more options to pick from searching online. And all online sunglass sites have free return policies if you don't like them.

2.description: Let's talk about customer service.  I'm in customer service, so I understand that dealing with the public can be a bit challenging at times....The staff at this location doesn't seem to have any concept of what customer service means. I went in to return a pair of sunglasses that was within their 90 day warranty. I had already verified all of the information that I would need over the phone with sunglass hut corporate customer service line and had an electronic copy of the receipt that was sent to me by the telephone customer service representative. I took the trouble to drive into downtown River North to complete an exchange at this location.  Needless to say I was very disappointed when the sales clerk refused to use the electronic receipt and insisted that he required a paper copy of the receipt in order to make an exchange. He even suggested that I go down the street and have a copy of it printed at the FedEx Kinko's. Seriously, are we in 1998? As the store clerk was unwilling/unable to help me, I had to call the corporate customer service line and the customer service line representative had to call the store directly.  The sales representative in the store was still not able to look up my information in the computer despite the fact that he was supposed to be able to access that information. Ultimately I left the store without having completed the exchange and with an apology from the telephone representative and a guarantee that someone would follow up with me.Since this store doesn't seem to be able to solve the problems on their own without involvement from their corporate office, I would recommend going to another sunglass hut location. Absolutely horrible experience.

0.description: Great service picking out sunglasses.They exchanged my expensive Mauie Jims that I purchased for new ones when my dog ate them because I was still within the 30 or 90 day exchange period. When I managed to bend the new glasses I was outside the exchange window, but they gave me a free box pre-addressed to the manufacturer and reprinted my receipt for me. After only $10 processing to MJ and no hassle, I have a new pair of sunglasses.Awesome.

12.description: My favorite pupuseria is back with extended hours! Hands down the best pupusas and Guatemalan food in Chicago.

7.description: Great experience!  Wonderful service - friendly and quick.  Excellent food and music, and we had a great time singing karaoke!

19.description: Food and price is great but owner's/waiter's attitude is grumpy! For the taste and price - it balances his attitude.

1.description: Las Delicias has good food and service, and i'd definitely return. Ever since El Tinajon closed i've been looking for a replacement, and their menu has all the Guatemalan specialities that El Tinajon had and more, namely Saladorean pupusas. Chips were fresh and warm, the green salsa was very tasty. Guacamole was ok, not much seasoning. For an entree, I tried the hilachas, which is a type of stewed beef in sauce. The sauce was tasty, but the beef was a little tough and stringy. I'd try something different next time, the menu is very extensive and I hesitate to review based on one visit. The dining room is modest but comfortable with bright decor and a mom & pop restaurant atmosphere. I'll definitely return for more specialty dishes.

2.description: I wandered into Las Delicias on New Years Day, looking for something different for dinner takeout.    The menu is loaded with traditional Central American foods (mainly Guatemalan and Salvadorian) that are quite intriguing, though there are also Mexican standards and even a kids breakfast menu.  The interior of the sizeable restaurant looks pleasant enough, and I may have to dine in next time.  There is a counter with some artisan trinkets on sale.  I ordered a vegetarian combo platter, as well as a tamal guatemalteco.  Most people are familiar with the Mexican-style tamales, but this Guatemalan-style corn tamale with pork is larger and has a more gelatinous density.  Now for the sprawling combo platter - starting with the pupusa, a cornmeal patty that is a Salvadorian standard I have enjoyed in other restaurants.  I chose the pupusa with loroco filling.  Loroco is a vine with edible flowers, though the generous amount of cheese filling makes it the dominant ingredient of the pupusa.  There is also a cup of slaw which is traditionally used as a topping for the pupusa.  The cheese chilaquil is sort of a quesadilla, with the tortilla smothered with a red salsa and paired with a generous plop of guacamole.  The massive platter also comes with sides of a very dense pile of refried beans, a scoop of rice sprinkled with carrots and peas, a cup of spicy green sauce, and fried sweet plantains.  The wedges of sweet plantains have a slightly charred exterior that created a delicious caramelized effect.  All in all, I was very satisfied with trying out a new (to me) restaurant on the first day of the New Year.

9.description: realy good service if you love pupuzas this is the best place to eat good music and really good service and the food keep it up guys

6.description: Not really sure if I would give the pupusas five stars as the other reviewers have. I didn't find them to be special. I've had much much better. The masa is kind of dry, almost tasted like cardboard, the cheese is very good, it's good quality. The cabbage slaw is great!The decor is not special either. Even though it's not an old restaurant it gives the appearance of being so by their outdated tables and chair, and "decorations". One side has unified tables and chairs, while the other side is completely mismatched. The service is nice, it's very homey. Perhaps I'll give it another try for other dishes, but I won't go out of my way to eat the pupusas that I was so looking forward to tasting after reading all of the reviews. The prices are good, very affordable, the service is fast, but then again I tried it on a slow night. The inside is definitely a place where you can relax, and not feel rushed about having to vacate your table quickly.

18.description: Great pupusas,  EXCELLENT curtido (a cabbage-y vinegary coleslaw to put on your pupusas), lovely spicy green sauce for the chips, lovely service and a nice setting for a meal. Also, it is BYOB but we didn't see a liquor store handy (gas station kitty corner?). They have virgin margaritas on the menu so bring your own tequila?

10.description: This place is a new favorite of mine. The pupusas are delicious. Service is prompt and friendly. My favorite was the sweet corn tamales. The building had an odd smell, but there's always take out! I will re-order from here.

13.description: My Mom fell in love with this place and she is finicky! Platanos con crema are to die for as a side order!. I got the lunch special: 2 Pupusas (filled with beans cheese chicken or pork grinds in a delicious home made corn tortilla) with rice and black beans and a cabbage salad for the Pupusas. The staff is always courteous, the atmosphere is nice, you can BOB, and it's a homemade meal.....

16.description: I finally got the chance to try this place out, and I am so glad I did! Las Delicias is the perfect name for this restaurant because the food is definitely delicious. My husband is Guatemalan and I am Salvadoran, By birth  we have pretty high expectations for all things pupusas and longaniza related. Las pupusas de loroco  y las de revuelta (had to bust out the Spanish here!) were perfect and not greasy at all.  Loroco is a Salvadoran flower bud that tastes kind of like spinach when cooked. Revuelta is a mixture of minced pork, beans and cheese- the trifecta of tastiness. As I said, both were excellent and reminded me a lot of how my grandma and aunts make them.In addition to the pupusas, we orderd yuca frita (fried yucca root) and sweet plantains. The yuca frita came with fried pork chunks that were killer! The only thing I would add is perhaps a side of mojo for dipping. Instead, I used the complimentary salsas and was perfectly happy. Not everyone likes to dip their yuca, I happen to be a dipper. The sweet plantains (platanos maduros) were just how I like them- lightly fried and not soaking in oil. You also get a healthy portion for the price. At the end of the night, my husband and I ate like kings and still had food left over to take home. This feast cost us the hefty price of.... $27. Yep, just $27 total for the BOTH of us for six pupusas, yuca frita, platanos, and soft drinks. You can't beat the price! Need I mention that this place is BYOB? Yes. Hell yes. So not only is the food tasty and cheap, but you can also bring your own booze which makes the deal even better. Looking over the menu I noticed they had virgin margaritas. Perhaps they will let you bring your own tequila? I know most BYOB places only allow beer and wine, but it couldn't hurt to ask next time! They also have michelada mixers- all you have to do is bring your own beer!In summary, this place is great. The food is tasty and on point with what Salvadoran and Guatemalan cuisine should be- delicious, inexpensive, soul satisfying  food.

17.description: By far, the best Guatemalan and Salvadoran food in Chicago.  I most definitely recommend the Pupusas, but everything on the menu is outstanding.  Great, very friendly service.  Family friendly.

15.description: It is very hard to find a great Place to eat Pupusas, Well Chicago stop looking.  Delicias is the best in the city.  I cannot speak for any of the other dishes but the pupusass are well worth the trip.

0.description: Really good. Our other Guatemalan restaurant closed down and we found this place by accident. My kids were so excited to see their favorite dishes on the menu they jumped up and down. We spend time in Guatemala each summer so I think we know good food and this place delights. The servers are also very sweet to my kids. It's a weekly stop for us.

5.description: Enjoying Guatemalan and Salvadorian food at this restaurant.  Have been friend with owners for years and they are really nice and supportive of community  organizations. Yummy food and cultural dishes.

11.description: Their food is great but ive gone three mondays in a row and theyve been closed. Even though the hours on their door say they're open Monday through Sunday at 10am. Sadly we have to find another spot to call a favorite for jibaritos.

8.description: I came here with a friend recently for papusas and the food was great. Multinational staff and food; best papusas I've had in Chicago. Very affordable as well.

3.description: I may be a bit biased as my co-worker's family owns the restaurant.  In any case, this place is great: good food, good ambiance, and great staff.  Guatemalan is a little different than Mexican food.  I can't really explain it, but if you like authentic Mexican, you will also like this place.  I didn't get the pupusas, but I will next time.  Also, get the Horchata, it is a little thicker and sweeter than the ones you get at a Mexican joint.  The refried beans might be the best I've ever had.

14.description: finally created a yelp acct and this is the first place i want to review. PAPUSAS HERE ARE MOUTH-WATERING.

4.description: This place is delicious and affordable.  I had a  loroco with cheese and beans with cheese pupusa; both great. The curtido is very authentic and chips are amazing as well.  This is a BYOB place, and has a nice ambiance to it, specially for dinner.

1.description: This place is even worse than Level and Enclave.- We came in here because we were cold. I also wanted to give my out of town friend a glimpse of the Viagra Triangle.- She has the French Press martini. It tasted like cheap champagne + high fructose corn syrup. Similar to cough medicine.- I had a Pear-tini. It was less sweet than the French Press, but it was still pretty bad. Both drinks came in a martini glass with a straw. Who the hell puts a straw in a martini glass?- Our server must have been 19. When we paid for the drinks, she actually explained to us how to fill out and sign the credit card form. It was kind of cute actually.- The people who hang out here are kind of scary. It's a mix of 21 year olds and 51 year old tourists ready to get down and do the electric slide.

9.description: Much to my chagrin, the bf's friends chose PS Chicago as the NYE destination bar.  I am not a fan of the whole Testosterone Triangle Rush/Division scene at ALL.  But ... in the spirit of playing nice & optimism in the 2-double0-7, I made due & put on a happy face.The bar was advertising $85 tickets for an 8-2 open bar.  Funny, because as we were looking at the website which clearly stated "$85," the guy on the phone charged us $125 per ticket.  Curious.It gets more curious as a friend was charged $312.50 for two tickets ($125 a ticket should come to $250 ... it's simple math, folks).Getting there a little after the start time of 8pm, there was a line out the door into the cold Chicago night.  A line that we stood in for nearly an hour.  Really, for jacking up the tickets $40 per, couldn't they have afforded a party planner who would foresee this dilemma?There was a complete bottleneck at the door.  There were two guys at one small table checking a list (really, about 4 lists) & credit card receipts.  Next to them, using the same table, was the coat check with one woman manning it.  Coat check was $5.Really people ... it's NYE in Chicago ... PLAN AHEAD.There were two guys checking IDs at the bottom of the stairs & some creepy looking guy standing at the top of the stairs, presumably clicking people off as they walked in.  More aptly put, he was checking out all the woman's cleave as they made their way up to the bar.The bar itself was basic & crowded, even by NYE standards.  Also along the lines of false advertising was the "Party Favors" & "Balloon Drop."  I have no idea what party favors were given because I didn't get any, but I did notice that you could only sit at a table if you PURCHASED THE RIGHT TO.  Every table.  In the entire bar.  There was stuff on the tables for those people.  So for the rest of us who thought the overpriced $125 was enough, we were forced to stand all night long with only the bar to place our drinks.  The balloon drop was a bust.  There was a tiny bag of balloons that had to be wrestled to the ground at about 12:10am.Along the lines of the whole "buy a table" crap, one patron attempted to start a fight with this other guy because he set his drink down on "his" table.  His table that no one was even sitting at during the time of the whole drink placement debacle.There were two problems with the finger food ... 1.  Meat on the sandwiches, meat on the heated food, shrimp cocktail, meat meat meat.  2.  In order to eat items off of the veggie tray (which was really all I could eat), you needed a plate.  In order to hold onto a plate & eat the veggies at the same time, you couldn't have a drink in your hand.  & if you didn't have a table to set your plate/drink/purse down on, you were screwed.  So my $125 did NOT go towards the "finger food."There were two saving graces: The first was our terrific bartender, Susan.  She was extremely polite & friendly in spite of all the drunks badgering her for more drinks & champagne.  The second was the lovely woman bathroom attendant (whose name I sadly forget right now).  She was splendid.PS:  I've heard stories of massive overcharging at this bar on regular nights as well if a tab is opened.  Be warned.

23.description: If your in the mood to dance to 80's music then this is your place! It's a blast and the music is always classic.  The people are often pretty random but if you don't care about that and just want to have some 80's fun your set.

12.description: I had friends in from Central Illinois this weekend and they wanted to dance.  I don't dance and I know they were not looking for a nightlife "scene" so I took them to PS Chicago.  I live in the neighborhood but mainly, the "no cover charge" was really what made the decision final.  When we arrived, I pretty much saw what I expected: lots of out of towners, poor decor & a cheesy water wall - yes, I was expecting a water wall.  I have to admit, I was impressed with the staff, of course I didn't think they'd be "the beautiful people" but they far exceeded my expectations.  The aging blonde behind the bar, probaby pushing or just over 40, was still totally hot.  The bald dude that poured me a shot was good looking, professional & he did his job well - and by that I mean, he sought me out of the crowd (all pouty) got me to do a shot and made me laugh.  But, here was my FAVORITE PART of the night....I walked through the club to check everything out and I saw four hillbillies sitting in the cocktail area around a cocktail table.   Not a single one of these women were under 160 lbs and the average "lady" was easily a whopping 180 lbs (normal height). One of these classy ladies had her shoes kicked off and put her feet on the cocktail table.  Two of the other fat pigs were literally passed out in their seats, I think they were snoring. They were so asleep, they didn't even notice the flash of my camera go off when I took their picture (I neede proof, my friends will never believe me).  The only one who was awake was chomping on her gum like a cow, wearing her best $5 string of pearls and is starring at the crowd like she was at a museum.  The DJ announces "are you - alls ready..... Welcome to Chicago!" and the fat sleeping hillbillies revive to get "low, low,low, low" with their apple bottom jeans on the dance floor.   Ladies and gentlemen. Welcome to RUSH street. PS Chicago could quite possibly be the ugly woman's mecca. The one place on earth where extremely overweight, unattractive, unwanted women of the world congregate for bad 80's music and $3 Lemon drop shots.

21.description: Wow, 80's music all the way! Group of people were older crowd 30 - 45.  It was fun to mix up and listen to 80's music but wouldn't go here very often.  Two large bars and impressive zen lounges near windows .If you feel like dancing, they have a small floor for you to shake your booty.

16.description: Jeff, the doorman at P.S., is such a sweetheart. He offered us free shots (found out they were pre-made!) if we came in to check this place out. All of the staff welcomed us and made us feel at home.  P.S. is as cheesy as it gets. I would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a parrtayy or good looking people. Sorry P.S., but we do appreciate your hospitality!!

17.description: This place is brutal!  A cheesy spot in the Viagra Triangle. Why do people go to places like these? There should be social ambassadors outside clubs warning them of the miserable time they are about to endure.  80s can be done so much better.

10.description: Whenever my mom is in town this is the place i take her.  It's perfect for a mother-daughter team who just wants to have fun and dance.  The dj plays good music and the dance floor is a good size.  The drinks are super expensive but the bartenders give out lots of free shots.  If you're looking to meet an older man/woman this place should definitely be on your list.  The staff is awesome and the place gets very crowded so go on the early side if you want a seat at the bar.

5.description: This is the BEST place to START your night. 5 dollar martini's all night every Friday/Saturday. You can get drunk for like 15 bucks  and the bartenders are always so nice. They always throw free drinks. I've become a regular here and my friends like going there to start off our nights before we hit the clubs. During the summer is even better time to go, and the door guys are hilarious.Cheesy? Abso-freaking-loutely. But honestly, I'm going out on a Friday/Saturday to drink- dance to groove is in the heart- make a fool of myself - and have a great time. After my 3rd Martini I'm not exactly trying to climb the social status ladder.Attire is generally business and club wear- not a jean/t-shirt place.The crowd is a mix gravatates to the older generation, but it is entertaining as hell to watch everyone.The bottles are cheap too.

11.description: My review might be jaded b/c i know the bartender here and we get hooked up. That being said, this bar is my guilty pleasure. The crowd is so old and most are tourists. The music doesn't get any newer than 1995. The drinks are probably on the expensive side, but no more so than all the other bars in this area. The decor is on the cheesy side.However, i love busing out my junior high dances and hearing songs i haven't heard in 10 years. Since the crowd is older, they usually leave you alone since they know they have no chance. So much better than the constant groping that goes on at the younger bars in the area. Plus it's open late!

22.description: Despite the fact that P.S. Chicago draws the Viagra Triangle Old folks, I don't take this place too seriously and enjoy rocking out to the 80's.  Definitely entertaining!

0.description: I'd go there again, only next time I won't drink so much..  or break out my California driver license and start yelling 'west coast' to everyone who walks by.  All in all, an entertaining place to go hang out, cheap drinks and an interesting mix of yuppies, nerds, and cougars.

20.description: I love the 80's, but P.S. Chicago is just a little too much for me. I've only been once and maybe it was just a very crowded night,  but I could hardly move.  I think it's just a little too clubby for my taste.

19.description: Wow, 80's music all the way! Group of people were older crowd 30 - 45.  It was fun to mix up and listen to 80's music but wouldn't go here very often.  Two large bars and impressive zen lounges near windows .If you feel like dancing, they have a small floor for you to shake your booty.

2.description: You've got to be kidding- was what was running through my mind as I entered this place last night.  Was I lost in a time warp?  Perhaps it is really 1982 and I had just entered the twilight zone.If you were around in the 80's, the original PS Chicago was located in the Rush Division area and was legendary for all the shenanigans that took place there. How do I know this?  I think some of the guys that were at the original club are still hanging out here at it's offspring 25 years later!My first clue about this place should have been the bouncers who were out on the street soliciting women to come into the club.  We were celebrating a friend's birthday and since she was choosing where to go and she wanted to dance, we walked into the place and I was instantly transported back 20 years. As we made our way to the dance floor in the back, I kept having flashbacks to the bar scene of the 80's- men in tight shirts dancing to 80's music blaring from the speakers.  Oh wait- that's not a flashback- that is a man in a tight shirt spinning and dropping on the floor in front of me as Prince blares from the speakers!  I quickly backed away in horror looking around for some way out of my nightmare!And if that visual isn't enough- how about a dark wood bar with chrome accents (what says the 80's more than chrome?) and the fake waterfall? More men in tight shirts and pants were coming up to offer us drinks (and more?) and at that point, I didn't care if we were there for a friend's birthday or not.  My mind was reeling as I continued to look for a way to get out of the twilight zone and back to reality. Just then, I saw a light that wasn't flashing or strobing.  I started towards it and then started running down the hallway. Escape was only a few steps away.  I burst onto State St and bumped into the bouncer that had got us there in the first place.   And he started again with his pitch "Laaaadies.  Very, very nice club.  You must see".  Been there. Done that.

18.description: Wow, I forgot that I even stepped foot into this place.  I gave it two stars primarily because I love the 80's and that's what they do best here.  Unfortunately, most of the people that frequent this place were about 40 in the 80's--you do the math...  The crowd is a little old for my taste, and the drinks are super expensive.

13.description: I've been here twice, and I'm not even sure why I made it here twice except that the first time a promoter enticed my gfs and me with free shots that tasted like watered down punch, and the second time I came here was for a friend's b-day.  He had the back section roped off for his group.  Somewhat spacious area in a U-shape around the bar, but you can't see across the bar so it really limits your view if you're trying to scope out the room.  I've never seen it crowded in here because the music sucks ('80s and non-danceable).  It's not the place to be if you want to see and be seen.  The majority of the crowd is older (35+), and those who are younger look like they didn't know where else to go.  There's a dancefloor, but it is seldom used.  It's a sad place.

4.description: I've never been here on a night when it was packed. The location is excellent but not much else. Ladies...there is a dance floor. P.S. is a Bar/Club hybrid. It lacks that "ah hah" so there is nothing really special about it. The best night we went there was when Ice-Cube was there. REALLY nice guy. The place was still pretty mellow but it was a Sunday.

6.description: First of all, I cannot believe I went to P.S. Chicago last night.Second of all, I cannot believe I'm admitting it to all the world by writing a review of it.Third of all, I am surprised that I didn't hate it.(We did not start off the night with the intention of going to P.S. Chicago, let me just get that out in the open.  Let me also say that the only reason I'm ever in the Viagra Triangle is b/c my friend LOVES the Big Chocolate Cake at Tavern on Rush and so we go there just about every other week.)  Last night we tried getting a table at Tavern on Rush but it was packed.   Mostly dudes, surprise surprise.  All kinds.  Young, old, you name it.  Some were wearing more jewelry than me; some looked like they just walked out of a tanning booth; some had more product in their hair than me; some were important-looking business men chomping on cigars; some of them were with their lady friends with their short skirts and high heels and long manicured nails and bling on 6 fingers and tanning booth tans and lots of makeup.  But I digress.  So we high-tailed it out of there (but not before ordering a slice of cake to go! Duh!), only to find that it was the same at every other restaurant in that area!!  Aaarrrggghhh!As we headed back to our car, deflated, frustrated, we had to walk past P.S. Chicago,  where the doorman-dude did the obligatory "Hey why don't you ladies come on in here?"  I rolled my eyes to my friend, but we stopped anyway, only to ask him where we could go to eat that wouldn't be so damn jam-packed.  He made a few suggestions, and we kind of shrugged them off, but then he made us an offer we couldn't refuse.  He told us to come inside, order drinks, while he went and got takeout menus from Frog Bar, Gibson's, Tavern, and Luxbar.  THEN he called our orders in for us.  THEN he went and picked up our orders for us!  Is it just me, or is that going way above and beyond the duties of a doorman?  His name is Sean, and he was great.  He wouldn't even let us tip him.  And trust me, we tried.The service from our cocktail waitress was also top notch.  She checked up on us frequently but not to the point of being over-bearing.  We never had to crane our necks to find her for refills, she was always nearby and our drinks came with a quickness.  So because of her and Sean, this place gets 5 stars for service.It also gets points for the 80's music.  I'm a child of the 80's.  Every now and then you just have to give in to the 80's music.  Crowd was not terrible either.  Yeah, I'm just as surprised as you are.  So I'm actually giving this place 3.5 stars (but  Yelp doesn't do halves, what's up with that?!?);  I can't give it more b/c, come on, it's P.S. Chicago.Not a place I'd make actual plans to go to intentionally, but maybe, just maaaaaaaybe, we'll stop in on a weeknight again to say Hi to Sean and have a drink after some cake at Tavern.

15.description: I gave this place 4 stars because I mean the service itself is worthy. My guy and I went here on a whim on a Sunday, no cover was right up our alley. However, be warned that the drinks are kind of expensive....scratch that they are; we ordered our usual him a straight Grey Goose hold the rocks and me a Jack and Coke.....we gave him twenty dollars expecting atleast 4 dollars back, lol we got no change for a tip or anything. The bartender Matt was awesome, he made the strong strong and that gets brownie points ;) he was very personable and friendly. Which to me most Chicago bartenders aren't very nice to the customers or have time to say hi or make a decent drink. I would recommend if you want above average kind service and a lot of arm room you go here atleast to begin you pre partying drinking binge, lol before venturing to the hustle and bustle of the club or wherever you fancy. Yes it was approx. 9 ppl outside of the workers at P.S. Chicago but I felt appreciated nonetheless

7.description: I wish I could give half a star... The only good thing about this place was a) the bathroom attendant was VERY sweet (even though she let a drunken hoochie cut me in line - I wasn't about to throw down with a girl in a horrendous white halter top with the neckline down to her waist so I just let that be) and b) the music was actually very decent. That being said, I absolutely have to agree with everything that Carol K. had to say about this place. She is spot on! Yes - it might be in a pretty decent location, no - it doesn't have a cover, yes - it's pretty large but WOW - it is a nightmare! If you're into much, much older men (we're talking friends of your father or grandfather) or REALLY aggressive Cougar's (you should have seen them circle around their unsuspecting prey), this is definitely the place for you. If not, stay away. There is nothing there but a hilariously bad time (but therefore an incredibly amusing experience).

8.description: I enjoyed P.S. Chicago.  Maybe the more appropriate thing to say is that I don't remember a thing and that I woke up the next morning ringing but with a lazy smile on my face.This is about as fun as Chicago can get on a Sunday night when you're restless and have relapsed into an "I need to hear Cyndi Lauper" kind of a mood.I don't remember much other than there are two young models at the entrance guarding this place like lionesses (I wouldn't have mind being bounced by them).  Hmmm, hot female bouncers, now that's a concept.The interior is dark and the atmosphere is fun.  The dance floor was about 20% occupied which is better than most wedding receptions and quite good for a Sunday at Midnight.  If you are hard of hearing, like me, just smile and laugh a lot and people will seem to think the conversation's a highly intellectual one.

3.description: I LOVE PS Chicago! Cheezy? Yeah. But that's ok. Who doesn't love cheezy?!The old DJ, Jose, was AWESOME, but alas, he is gone. The music is still pretty great for dance party action. They take requests! It's a great place to hit for an hour or so, nothing more. The bar and service is fantastic - you won't be disappointed with your order. Actually, everyone who works there is pretty awesome.

14.description: This is a difficult review becuase the place actually wasn't that good, but the serivce was TOP NOTCH.The usher begged us to go in and get a free shot, and after that it was free shots all night, this place was so empty and lame that the owners were getting pretty desperate, the music was ok.I only went there because my friend brought me there, and I was being polite and optimistic.And it turned out to be a fun night, they even let us smoke inside, the place eventually got crowded with older people and people that didn't know where else to go! But overall it was a blast, we got a bottle and a table for really cheap and we concentrated on just getting drunk and having fun.So 4 stars to the poor owners that would do anything to get this place going!

58.description: Great French food for a great price! Pleasant experience. Even the small plates were plenty to eat. The food is reasonably priced but the wine is all on the high side. It would be nice if they had some other affordable wines.

56.description: Overall, I'd probably say 2.5 stars. Our server was a bit in your face. Pointed at the specials, grunted..he was inattentive at best, forgot wine order, kinda aloof.  The food was average. The highlight was probably the french onion soup. I had the chicken with fingerling potatoes and my wife had the parmesan pepper crusted steak. Both were mediocre. I noticed someone else mentioned the wine..I have no issue paying $12-$16 for a glass of wine provided its quality. The french pinot noir was decent enough, but the rest was average.

29.description: Cute Decor. Oily Food. Service: we had a bald Italian accent waiter who was very rude (like he was too good for his job), extremely inattentive (had to ask other staff any time we needed anything), caught him in a lie, denied it, even with proof. Next time, if I go back, ask for the fat tall gay guy. He served us more than our actual waiter. What a sweet guy. I would've given this place less stars if he haddn't stepped in. Food: Good, but everything is very butter. Ask for thing to be "dry."Salmon was bland and tasted mostly like it was flash fried. Flank was delicious, but tons of oil as well.Mostly grey hairs (older people).

42.description: My first time here was for Sunday brunch.  Everyone I was with left saying what a lovely French bistro Bistro Zinc was and it really is.  Since then, I have been back several times and have loved it every time.  The Vegetable Chickpea and Tomato Stew is a favorite of mine as well as the Mussels.  A friendly waitstaff is extremely attentive.  The atmosphere is nice - just what you think of for a traditional French bistro - red and yellow color motif.  Tables are packed together but it lends to the cozy, warm inviting atmosphere.  I highly recommend checking this place out!

23.description: Just dined here tonight. Love the quaint atmosphere, if only they would play french music instead of American pop, the ambience would be complete. Although, our waiter left much to be desired in terms of service. Very slow and neglectful, and the place was only 25% occupied.Unfortunately I didn't try some of the more popular dishes - regretting that. We started with the duck pate and ratatouille. The pate was fine, ratatouille was extremely overcooked and tasted like it had been reheated a dozen times. Then I had the Poulet Grand-Mere, terrible mistake, not good at all. Taste-less boiled chicken, thrown in the oven to crisp the skin, over a bed of gravy with pearl onions, baby potatoes, and bacon. Flavors didn't mesh well at all, I ended up picking out the pieces of bacon and potatoes instead. My companion had the onion soup, very nice and flavorful. We ended with the almond butter cake and it was pretty good. A little dry, could've used a butter sauce over it, but the flavor was good. All in all, I'd go back, but definitely try other dishes.

47.description: I can't say enough about the excellent service, the atmosphere ripped straight from Paris and the marvelous food.  The cocktails were quite good.  I enjoyed their French onion soup, and the vol-au-vent.  My date had the salmon and lentils.  Both were perfect.  Take the time to stop in.

8.description: Great French atmosphere inside. Busy and bustling staff pacing back and forth to satisfy customers needs. Elegant menu with just the correct amount of food offerings to satisfy even those that are not too familiar with French cuisine. Nice looking rustic bar area and beautify appointed art work and Parisian decor throughout the restaurant creating a very comfortable elegance. Ordered the French onion soup, mussels and quiche. Great descriptions of each item on the menu really romances your desire to try everything!

31.description: This bistro was very patient with me when I tried to perform a magic trick, yanked the table cloth, and sent all of the glassware crashing to the floor.   The milk here is good. I like the French fries.

34.description: Now we will start with the positives: super cute decor and solid menu. The rating comes from the service aspect of my experience. We sat there at our table for a solid 10 minutes waiting to be greeted. The place didn't look particularly busy but who knows what the servers actual situation was, but some acknowledgement of that is always nice because then I'm not assuming the worst. He was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and took our order right away. Never saw him again until we almost finished our meals. Typically if my meal comes out correctly or I don't need anything I don't really mind but my burger was cooked medium well instead of medium rare and I would've loved some Dijon. I don't blame the server for burger being overcooked, I do fault him for not checking on our meals to make sure they were correct. Overall it was a nice place and I live right there so I'll give it another shot and hopefully the service aspect was a fluke.

16.description: Expensive garbage. The wine is massively over priced and low quality. The drinks I had lacked alcohol. Every single drink I ordered was either sugar water or water. My whiskey sour came watered down with club soda in a tall glass. My sidecar came without cognac (brandy is what I think they used). My duck dish was undercooked and inadequately seasoned. Making it a boring $27 dish. The deserts were meh and not at all inspiring. Take your friends to Lou malnatis across the street. It's much better.

13.description: This is seriously the best french restaurant in all of chicago. We had the french onion soup, mussles, and some other thing I forgot the name of but was amazing. Especailly nice if it's a warm day and they have the windows open.

11.description: If you like French food, this place is a must.  Very elegant decor.  Good wine menu.  This visit we shared some Pate' and Steak Tartare, both of which were very good.  For dinner, I had the Bouillabaisse, which was excellent.  My wife had the Pan Seared Duck Breast which was good but a little over cooked.  She ordered medium rare and it was medium to medium well.  For dessert, I highly recommend the Profiterolies.  The Almond butter cake with macerated berries is also very good.  Great place for a quiet romantic dinner.

39.description: First of all stroller friendly if your little one is with you! My crew (6 couples) had a great brunch there. They organized everything for us. We made a reservation a week ago. Food was delicious. Everyone was happy.

37.description: My wife and I have been here a number of times considering its close proximity to our old apartment.  My thoughts:-Very great atmosphere, traditional French decor, quiet and classy-There's no TV at the bar so the bartender talks to you which is awesome-It's super easy to walk in any weeknight and just sit down which is great-The wait staff is really on top of it, very attentive and helpful-It is quite accessible, 22/36/Red Line all drop off right near it-The two food highlights from my side are:--The mussels are an easy 5/5 for me, ask for extra bread to dip!!--The Croque Monsiuer is a 4/5, I like the bread crispier--All other food has been tasty, these are just the most memorableI will definitely be back again in the future.

0.description: When I walked in with my date, the hostess got us seated right away with the menu. We went on a Sunday around 3pm. There were two other couples and we were all seated by the windows. The atmosphere was nice. Our waitress came to greet us within 3 mins and introduced us the specials of the day. French music was played in the background. We ordered french union soup and the royale hamburger. The food was okay. I liked the burger but it wasn't the best burger I ever had. I know it's weird to go to a French restaurant and ordered a burger. I was just curious about a French restaurant hamburger.The waitress was super nice and always filled out glasses with water. The service was great as our food came within 10 mins after we finished the bread. I'll try something else next time I go there. It is a bit pricey though. If you want to spend less than $12...you'll end up getting soup or salad. Perfect for a lunch date though.Also, we went in exactly at 3pm. On Yelp, it said the restaurant was from 3pm to 5pm. Not sure if we went in when they were in break. Either way, we had a great time and I enjoyed the service and the music.

38.description: We have been to Bistrot Zinc many times.  It has provided a touch of Paris for us when we are not in Paris.  We always liked the laid back atmosphere and good food.  Maybe things were not so good because it was valentines day but overall we were disappointed.  The bar was great as usual and the bartender was fantastic.  Our table experience was something else.  Jose, our server, was not friendly or attentive.  We felt very rushed.  The food appeared within ten minutes and looked as though it was pre-prepared and sitting under a heat lamp.  The dessert, pot au creme, was definitely prepared well in advance with a skim surface on top indicating it's age.  We know they are better than this.

51.description: Every time I visit Chicago, I make a lunch or brunch date at Bistrot Zinc.  The food is delicious, authentic and fairly priced.  The atmosphere is comfortable, like a great Paris bistrot.  On my most recent visit, I made a mistake and ordered the wrong salad.  The owner, without me asking but overhearing my conversation with the server, promptly took the dish away and made me the salad I anticipated.   The server apologized for delay in bringing the dish, even though it was my fault that a new one was being prepared. The exceptional customer service went beyond what would be expected at any restaurant.  On leaving, we asked the owner about other dining spots in Chicago and she was generous with suggestions.  My second trip to Bistrot Zinc was due to having one of the best burgers I had ever had, regardless of type of restaurant.  Subsequent visits were due to the combination of good food, great atmosphere and attentive service.  From this point on, trips to Bistrot Zinc will be due to how special the staff made me and my friends feel when having lunch there.

27.description: Nothing is better than a french breakfast on a Sunday morning.  That's why it was so great to find one that was so outstanding during our trip to Chicago.  Bistro Zinc was open, easy, and had that french casual atmosphere that makes for a perfect Sunday morning.  We each had a cappuccino, which was phenomenal, and shared the eggs benedict and quiche of the day.  I can honestly say, that the quiche was one of the best I have ever had.  It was a goat cheese mushroom quiche, that was light, cheesy and bright all at the same time.  It came with a fresh green salad, and trust me....our plate was practically licked clean.Also, our service was absolutely phenomenal!  Our waiter, Chris, was really personal and gave us some city tips for the rest of our stay.  He even stayed up on our water intake, which we've learned that being from AZ, is much higher than the average Chicago-an, lol.Definitely looking forward to going back for another classic french brunch next time we are in Chicago!

32.description: Superb, simply superb.  I've been dining there for years, and Bistrot Zinc is remarkably consistent.  Friendly, knowledgeable waiters, many of whom having been there for years.  Highly recommended.

54.description: I love the classic French bistro flare of this place.  The atmosphere is cozy but still busy and bustling.  The wine list is quite approachable as well.  You have to ask for butter with the bread but the bread is yummy.  Our server was Ian and he was just excellent as well.  One criticism is that the menu does not say what the dishes come with.  They are actually huge portions.  I did not realize mine would come with a large portion of mashed potatoes as well as the main so that could be described a little better.  But overall the experience was great and I'll definitely be back.We started with some venison terrine and escargot.  I feel that for escargot it really matters about the texture and if you get some sea flavor from the snail as anything in a bunch of garlic and butter will be awesome.  So I usually am underwhelmed.  These were actually really good.  Not quite Maudes, but my second favorite I've had.  They had a perfect crunchy crust on the top and the snail flavor actually came through.  The venison was just okay.  There were very large pieces of pistachio in there that made it a bit difficult to eat.  I also am a huge fan of venison and I didn't get that much true flavor.  The cherry stuff they served with it was awesome though.  I got the skate wing, which was prepared phenomenally.  Skate is so easy to mess up and many times when you order it, it comes mushy and lacks the delicacy that makes it so succulent.  This was the perfect balance of tender meat with the light, crispy skin.  It came with mashed potatoes that were dynamite as well.  My husband got the special stew, which was a chicken and tomato stew that he said was awesome.  I was so stuffed I couldn't try it.  Yet I tied the profiterole, which was very tasty, despite me not being a dessert person.  So nothing was bad foodwise but some things were stand outs.  I look forward to trying some other things next time and being aware of portion sizes for my next visit.

48.description: Because they have a limited and standard French menu, this restaurant has been able to concentrate on perfecting their recipes.  I've always enjoyed the Poulet Grand Mere, the trout, and the salmon.  I tried the steak frites as well, but found it too salty, which is why I took it down a star.  The wine list is very god, but desserts are a bit pricey, so opt in favor of something more traditional than profiteroles or chocolate mousse.  Delicious and reasonable with excellent service.  A footnote:  expensive valet parking ($14 plus tip) comes along with being in the Rush Street area.

44.description: Came for lunch before heading to the airport. This was recommended by our concierge at the Peninsula. The onion soup and escargots were delicious. They were served piping hot which is a real plus for me. It seems too many restaurants are serving their food lukewarm which is real turnoff. My companion had a burger with steak frites. The burger was cooked to perfection and the frites were nice and crispy. With the onion soup I had a half a sandwich which is a special. The place would have received five stars except the bread on the Croque Monsieur was massive. It was similar to Texas Toast and was very soggy. You can find some values on the wine list if you stick to the French ones. I had the Cotes du Rhone by Guigal.Although the place reminds me of bistros in France, the servers are attentive, friendly, and helpful. I would recommend the Bistrot Zinc.

24.description: Service was rough, neither professional nor pleasant.  My onion soup wasn't all that great.  I've definitely had better.  I can see why they weren't packed when all other restaurants nearby were filled to the max.

7.description: Tried Bistrot Zinc for lunch. Although the food was high quality and unique and the prices were in the 15-25 range, I thought it was not palatable enough for me to give a 5 star. I had the chicken.Also, the service was a bit slow. It was a slow day, but it took a few extra minutes for the waiter to serve us.

49.description: Went here over the weekend with my boyfriend and his dad. Selected the place based off Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. To start, we had the mussels which were in a tasty cream sauce that was great to dip bread into. For my main, I had the L'onglet Steak, which was cooked perfectly and very tasty. It came with green beans that were crunchy, adding some freshness to the plate, and cauliflower gratin that was cheesy and delicious. Boyfriend had the grandmother's chicken, which was really good, and his dad was also pleased with the meal he ordered. The wine we selected with the help of the knowledgeable wait staff went great with the food, and was reasonably priced. For dessert, we had the profiteroles a la glace. the chocolate sauce was the best part of the dessert, for sure! The atmosphere is cozy, and would be perfect for a date, outing with close friends or family. Would highly recommend!

40.description: We ordered the french onion soup and a croque monsier sandwich. The soup tasted like a french onion soup should which was good. The croque monsier was pretty average, not too much flavor but a little bit on the salty side. The pommes frites that came with it were good but nothing special.

53.description: So I came for dinner, semi-early on a Friday night.  The place wasn't very busy, but by the time we left it was fairly packed.  While their menu isn't particularly extensive they do have very good options for dinner.This is my first foray into a restaurant that primarily identifies itself as "French" and I ordered the Poulet Grand Mère, which is basically roasted chicken over a stew of bacon, mushrooms, garlic, and pearl onions.  It was a little different than I had anticipated.  The jus was a little sweet, but I did like how they had nice soft whole cloves of garlic in the stew (I like garlic).Overall the food was decent, some of us enjoyed our meals better than others, but at their price point I would expect everything to be delicious.  It got pretty dark inside while we were there, there were a number of couples there, it is definitely more of a date night place in the evenings.  I do like the decor, very French-y.  Service was good, while we had one waiter there were a number of people attending to our table of 5.Since others enjoyed their food much more than I did, I would definitely come back to try something else, but I probably wouldn't get my dish again...

30.description: My partner and I have a tradition:  we come here for lunch on the last day of our annual visit to Chicago.  Consequently, I have bittersweet memories of Bistrot Zinc as we always hate to leave.  For our next visit I am determined to have dinner here on the day of our arrival.  It only seems fitting to do that which one loves as soon as possible, and we love Bistrot Zinc.  Come for the martinis (always perfect) and stay for the food (always fabulous)!

46.description: Expensive garbage. The wine is massively over priced and low quality. The drinks I had lacked alcohol. Every single drink I ordered was either sugar water or water. My whiskey sour came watered down with club soda in a tall glass. My sidecar came without cognac (brandy is what I think they used). My duck dish was undercooked and inadequately seasoned. Making it a boring $27 dish. The deserts were meh and not at all inspiring. Take your friends to Lou malnatis across the street. It's much better.

1.description: Sorry all you bistro zinc lovers... Maybe I went at the wrong time of day, or ordered the wrong thing, or just have different tastes than you...I will say the liver pate itself was quite good. While the red wine mustard was unique, it was equally strange, and the toast served with the pate was too hard.  Again, though, the pate was probably my favorite part about our lunch.My husband ordered the eggs benedict and said they were OK.I had the Croque Monsieur with a side of French onion soup (cheesy - I know!).  While the French onion soup could pretty much hold its own with the hundreds I've had before (lots of onions in there, but there's nothing wrong with that!), the croque monsieur was so depressingly bad and boring.  It fell apart after a couple bites, and the ingredients seemed "less than."I've had croque monsieurs several times, and was honestly shocked at how disappointing it was at what is clearly an old school 'French Bistro.'Well, it was on my list of places to try for a while... and that's done.And aside from saying that our waitress was good, that's about all I can add.

55.description: Absolute favorite French restaurant in Chicago. Every time we go, it gets better. The wait staff is very knowledgeable about the menu, the service is excellent, and the food is divine. It's just delicious French comfort food and so authentic. My highest compliments.

9.description: Nothing is better than a french breakfast on a Sunday morning.  That's why it was so great to find one that was so outstanding during our trip to Chicago.  Bistro Zinc was open, easy, and had that french casual atmosphere that makes for a perfect Sunday morning.  We each had a cappuccino, which was phenomenal, and shared the eggs benedict and quiche of the day.  I can honestly say, that the quiche was one of the best I have ever had.  It was a goat cheese mushroom quiche, that was light, cheesy and bright all at the same time.  It came with a fresh green salad, and trust me....our plate was practically licked clean.Also, our service was absolutely phenomenal!  Our waiter, Chris, was really personal and gave us some city tips for the rest of our stay.  He even stayed up on our water intake, which we've learned that being from AZ, is much higher than the average Chicago-an, lol.Definitely looking forward to going back for another classic french brunch next time we are in Chicago!

26.description: Lovely dinner! Fab service. Poulet grand mere is worth the trip--chicken in wine sauce perfectly seasoned. Vol au vent equally flavorful. Wolf fish mmmm. Great bread--wonderful endive salad. Plain old burger excellent. Neat menu variety.

25.description: Ian was a fabulous server. The ambiance was smooth music with dim lighting. Perfect for intimate dining

12.description: Cute little french bistro in the vibrant streeterville area. Crab salad was divine and the steak fritite melted in my mouth. The pork and apple stew stole the show.

59.description: Food is very average. Steak frites is banal and chewy. Salmon crepe has 3 slivers of smoked salmon (and only $14!)--thanks so much! Everything is just very very lazy. And SORRY, no specials available for lunch! Why? Well, as the very kind bartender told me a couple of years ago, before this place became garbage, "basically just laziness." Yes, the lunch crew has all the ingredients and knowledge to prepare specials for lunch, but no you can't have any. The old bartender used to go against policy and get me specials for lunch anyway by basically telling the cooks to simply do their job, and yes, back then, the food was good. Now, it's terribly average.Moreover, it's impossible to order take out from this place! I called on Thursday, a bit after 5 pm, and I was told "We don't do takeout after 5pm." Odd, but okay. Perhaps fanciful elves wander into the kitchen just before dinner and steal all the to-go cartons. Yes, that must be it. Then I called on Sunday, at 4:38, and asked for take out. What was I told? "Sorry, we don't do take-out orders after fiv... 4:30." Ya, eff you too. Idiots.Done with this place. May your business follow where your food and staff have gone, down the toilet, forever and ever.P.S. Thanks for doing your little part in making the Gold Coast horrible.

21.description: If you like French food, this place is a must.  Very elegant decor.  Good wine menu.  This visit we shared some Pate' and Steak Tartare, both of which were very good.  For dinner, I had the Bouillabaisse, which was excellent.  My wife had the Pan Seared Duck Breast which was good but a little over cooked.  She ordered medium rare and it was medium to medium well.  For dessert, I highly recommend the Profiterolies.  The Almond butter cake with macerated berries is also very good.  Great place for a quiet romantic dinner.

17.description: Really excellent. A group of six celebrating a birthday.   The voul a vent special as fine as any offered in Paris.Gracious, attentive service, from the host to the bartender, server to the busboy.Delicious and fun!A great combination.

10.description: First off let me apologize for not uploading any pics.   I was too busy having a food orgasmic experience.  You MUST order the escargot.  Meaty and bathed in a delicious broth.  Then it was on to the mussels which were steamed in a white wine; shallots parsley and cream bath...ask for bread so you can dip pieces of the bread in the broth because you do not want to waste that broth.  I decided to go with one of the specials which was a savory apple tart.  The crust was Flaky and the tart was savory due to the sweet onions; apples and gruyere  cheese. Must like onions!

5.description: Dropped in for a late lunch this weekend, drawn in by the promise of good French onion soup on a cold day... Doh, hopes dashed once again... The soup was fine, but the broth lacked depth of flavor that I was craving and also light on the broth to onion/bread/cheese ratio.  Had the sandwich combo with the truffled egg salad sandwich which was very good- rich yet light, well  seasoned.  For dessert had he chocolate mousse which was a bit lackluster and the cream anglaise was overly sweet.

3.description: I like this place because the food makes you feel full and satisfied, but not sluggish. Interior decor/ambiance is great, as is service. The food is well-made and not drenched in grease or saturated with sugar, which I really appreciate. However, because of this, the food doesn't particularly stand out to me in any way. It was definitely good, but not spectacular.I came around on a Saturday morning and there was no wait whatsoever, making this a great place for a quick, casual brunch if you want to avoid crowds

35.description: I went there for a date, the atmosphere was amazing and the service was impeccable. I had the escargot and calfs liver. I have never had both but this was one of the best meals I've had in a long time. I definitely will recommend this place to everyone I know.

19.description: Cute Decor. Oily Food. Service: we had a bald Italian accent waiter who was very rude (like he was too good for his job), extremely inattentive (had to ask other staff any time we needed anything), caught him in a lie, denied it, even with proof. Next time, if I go back, ask for the fat tall gay guy. He served us more than our actual waiter. What a sweet guy. I would've given this place less stars if he haddn't stepped in. Food: Good, but everything is very butter. Ask for thing to be "dry."Salmon was bland and tasted mostly like it was flash fried. Flank was delicious, but tons of oil as well.Mostly grey hairs (older people).

28.description: Great place for fun French food with a pleasant atmosphere. Arugula with dates/bacon/Parmesan and lemon vinaigrette was a light and unique appetizer. Salmon over roasted fennel with smoked tomatoes was amazing. Fennel melted in your mouth and tomatoes were sweet but smoky. Dessert was fabulous mascarpone with berries and mint tea. Felt satiated but not stuffed. $80 for two not including tip.

45.description: This is a must for anyone visiting the Gold Coast of Chicago. The feel, look, food and wine are all French. The waiter was attentive and knowledgeable.  Not hovering but always available. Portions are reasonable. Presentation is excellent. Wine list is one page and covers several regions, tastes and price ranges. An excellent Brut Rosé Cremant de Limoux by the glass. I had the duck with spaetzle and I recommend it.

33.description: This was my second time at this place. I love the service and the atmosphere. The food is great and it's perfect for a special occasion. I wound recommend this place.

43.description: Excellent french bistro.  Well prepared steak frites, excellent red wine.  My friend and I shared the banana and nutella crepe which was mind blowingly yummy.  A good spot for a nice low key dinner on a Saturday night.

2.description: I came on a Sunday for brunch. The service is amazing. The servers were very prompt and knowledgeable. My French toast was superb. I didn't even need more maple syrup. The atmosphere inside The atmosphere is traditional French. No Tvs inside so you have to pay attention to your guest and listen to classical music. Oh the horror. I will definitely come here for dinner next time I'm in town.

18.description: Very lively restaurant.    Nice wine list, great mussels and the best French onion soup in the city.  Perfect gem in the Gold Coast

41.description: Great French atmosphere inside. Busy and bustling staff pacing back and forth to satisfy customers needs. Elegant menu with just the correct amount of food offerings to satisfy even those that are not too familiar with French cuisine. Nice looking rustic bar area and beautify appointed art work and Parisian decor throughout the restaurant creating a very comfortable elegance. Ordered the French onion soup, mussels and quiche. Great descriptions of each item on the menu really romances your desire to try everything!

52.description: Food was really good!  I was pleasantly surprised given that my experiences at any French restaurant is typically met with a bit of disappointment.  Went there with some friends for brunch and got the french onion soup and lamb sandwich with grilled onion, watercress, and rosemary aioli which were both delicious.  It was quite filling as well.  The ambiance was nice for a Saturday morning.  There were not a whole lot of people which is a nice change from most other brunch places where it can be loud and difficult to hear people at your own table due to all the noise.  The overall staff was quite nice.  Our server was okay.  To be honest, not as great as I would have expected from such an establishment.

50.description: My husband and I had a delightful birthday dinner here.  The atmosphere was lovely, it was very French bistro in feel, with an old-fashioned touch, beautiful wood and brass trim, lots of mirrors, walls painted a gently warm cream color, and vintage posters and prints in frames.  Food was really delicious, from the French Onion Soup to the trout to the dessert.  loved everything.  Service was warm and attentive

4.description: I moved to Chicago three years ago and have wanted to try this place since. I walked by it on my way to school every day and the open window/air dining was so enticing. But it seemed that every time I wanted to go, I always seemed to be rushing off to somewhere.But I finally got a chance to go! And I was excited.I walked in the door, and the host saw me and my dining partner walk in, turned around, and started fixing something on a table? ..umm...So we waited for a few seconds and he came back and sighed and said "Two?"..."yes please?"The waiter started us off with bread. And it was far from good. Just really bland, cheap bread with butter. But it was free, and who am I to complain?My dining partner ordered a chicken and mushroom crepe that was really quite good!On the other hand, i ordered a shrimp pasta of sorts that was the fishiest thing I have ever eaten. My dining partner was convinced it was just from really old shrimp that had gone bad and forbade me to eat any more.So bottom line? I'm really torn. It was just such a let down. I was expecting much more and got so much less than I expected.

6.description: My wife and I have been here a number of times considering its close proximity to our old apartment.  My thoughts:-Very great atmosphere, traditional French decor, quiet and classy-There's no TV at the bar so the bartender talks to you which is awesome-It's super easy to walk in any weeknight and just sit down which is great-The wait staff is really on top of it, very attentive and helpful-It is quite accessible, 22/36/Red Line all drop off right near it-The two food highlights from my side are:--The mussels are an easy 5/5 for me, ask for extra bread to dip!!--The Croque Monsiuer is a 4/5, I like the bread crispier--All other food has been tasty, these are just the most memorableI will definitely be back again in the future.

22.description: Honestly the place is awesome. My gripe is that the food is expensive, but you do not get that much of it. I guess it's a French thing, but I didn't feel I got my money's worth.

15.description: Eh nothing special. The French onion soup was overloaded with cheese and had barely and onion taste. The croque Monsieur was not warm at all when it came out and it was relatively bland. The steak from the steak frites entree was cooked well but such a small piece of steak + fries was not worth the $27 price tag. Overall nothing memorable and below average.

57.description: I like this place but I'm not blown away either. It's a little overpriced but it's still has a nice ambiance. I went the other night with a friend and we ordered the scallops as an appetizer. The appetizer cost $13 and we got TWO scallops. So basically each scallop was $7.50. I figured we'd get more than two for that price but we didn't...I ordered the pork milanese which was very good. It came with a small tomato heirloom salad but overall it was one big piece of pounded meat. Good food, a little overpriced, romantic ambiance.

20.description: I moved to Chicago three years ago and have wanted to try this place since. I walked by it on my way to school every day and the open window/air dining was so enticing. But it seemed that every time I wanted to go, I always seemed to be rushing off to somewhere.But I finally got a chance to go! And I was excited.I walked in the door, and the host saw me and my dining partner walk in, turned around, and started fixing something on a table? ..umm...So we waited for a few seconds and he came back and sighed and said "Two?"..."yes please?"The waiter started us off with bread. And it was far from good. Just really bland, cheap bread with butter. But it was free, and who am I to complain?My dining partner ordered a chicken and mushroom crepe that was really quite good!On the other hand, i ordered a shrimp pasta of sorts that was the fishiest thing I have ever eaten. My dining partner was convinced it was just from really old shrimp that had gone bad and forbade me to eat any more.So bottom line? I'm really torn. It was just such a let down. I was expecting much more and got so much less than I expected.

36.description: I think the reviews here are a bit critical; loved this bistro and food was great. We came for a late lunch and split the escargot, frisée salad and croque Monsieur. All were very good and our waitress knew well enough to space out the order so that my husband and I could enjoy each one. Each was perfectly cooked and came out piping hot. Wine was delicious and reasonably priced (for all the reviewers out there - a decent glass of wine will be between $8-$14 in Chicago...)Great food, great service, cute ambiance - will be back!

14.description: Just dined here tonight. Love the quaint atmosphere, if only they would play french music instead of American pop, the ambience would be complete. Although, our waiter left much to be desired in terms of service. Very slow and neglectful, and the place was only 25% occupied.Unfortunately I didn't try some of the more popular dishes - regretting that. We started with the duck pate and ratatouille. The pate was fine, ratatouille was extremely overcooked and tasted like it had been reheated a dozen times. Then I had the Poulet Grand-Mere, terrible mistake, not good at all. Taste-less boiled chicken, thrown in the oven to crisp the skin, over a bed of gravy with pearl onions, baby potatoes, and bacon. Flavors didn't mesh well at all, I ended up picking out the pieces of bacon and potatoes instead. My companion had the onion soup, very nice and flavorful. We ended with the almond butter cake and it was pretty good. A little dry, could've used a butter sauce over it, but the flavor was good. All in all, I'd go back, but definitely try other dishes.

58.description: I came here on a Saturday morning and as was expected there was a pretty long line. Luckily, the line moved pretty quickly and I was seated after waiting about 10 minutes. The hostess was very polite. The sitting area was kind of tight, but not a huge deal unless maybe you're in a big group. I got the steak skillet which was a nice mix of steak, eggs, onions and peppers. It also came with a small side of pancakes. The meal was delicious, I wouldn't say over the top, but I was very impressed with how nice all the staff were. I'd definitely recommend a visit when in Chi-town.

56.description: We had Breakfast here two days into our stay in Chicago. Good typical Breakfast Fare , Service was reasonably prompt. Food was delicious. Prices were about what we expected for that area of Chicago.

29.description: Boom this place is a win. Don't be detered by the line not quite sure how they do it but somehow our group of 8 only waited 15 min to sit on a Saturday am at 10!? What!? Then, it only continued to improve. Food was amazing and I think my favorite is that you can get a side of pancakes with everything!! Just what I needed. Service was fantastic. And the atmosphere is adorable. So classic. You gotta stop here if you're in town.

42.description: I'm a breakfast lover, and this is one of my all-time favorite spots to eat it. I come here at least once every time I'm in Chicago. Still not sure whether this location is local or part of the chain but guess it doesn't really matter. The seasonal pancakes (the pumpkin ones they have in the fall are the best) are always part of my order. Tip: if you get an egg dish you can get two pancakes as a side and for $2 extra can substitute the seasonal ones. The last time I was here it was cash only but not sure whether that's changed now. Total is usually $10-$15 per person if you get coffee or a juice. Which reminds me, the grapefruit juice is fresh squeezed and delicious!

23.description: There is a reason there is a line out the door. It is definitely worth the wait. Menu selection is overwhelming. Presentation was phenomenal. Everything tastes as good as it looks. Do not plan on eating lunch after this breakfast.

47.description: I'm originally from Madison, Wisconsin so I'm very familiar with the Original Pancake House. All locations are different, for example, the one back home gives you a "number" and puts you on a waiting list, this location does not, similar to first come, first serve with lower waiting times for smaller parties. I have been to this locations dozens of times since moving to Chicago and every time is great. Always get the same thing 49er Flapjacks and a coffee, never been a disappointment. Love this place!
