So I'm giving them 4 stars now because I haven't found a better place to eat Salvadorean.

23.description: I'll echo Millie R. here.  The service is very good and the food is cheap and tasty.  The only knock being it is a bit of a hole in the wall.  Very small knock,  though.  We dug into the pupusa's and found ourselves piling on the tasty slaw.  My wife liked the horchata as well.  This worked perfect for weekend afternoon snack.

5.description: Pupuseria Restaurant "El Cuscatleco" is an unassuming Salvadorean spot located on Lawrence a bit east of Kedzie.  My buddy and I were the only gringos eating here, so that might be a good sign.  Since this is a pupuseria, I just had to order some pupusas, a specialty of El Salvador.  I had three different pupusas and they were good, though I could not really tell the three of them apart taste wise.  They come with some slaw and some hot sauces, and I gladly piled slaw atop the pupusas.  I also ate a "hen" tamale, and it tasted like a chicken tamale.  My friend was not feelin' the pupusas so he ordered a taco dinner, which looked like tacos you could get at any little Mexican restaurant.  I drank a sugary pop called Kolashanpan, and it is supposedly the genuine pop of choice for true Salvadoreans, though I'd say the flavor is more of a cream soda or tutti-frutti rather than "champagne".  For dessert we ordered a plate of these fried sweet plantain dumpling dessert balls, and they were delicious.  The service seems a bit pokey, so come hungry but not in a super hurry.

25.description: I hit this place up after looking for some Salvadoran places on Yelp. Nice place and good food. The horchata was great, not the rice based kind, but the real Salvadoran drink.  I ordered some huevos rancheros and the dish came out good. The people working there are cool, and the prices are very reasonable. Finding Salvadoran food in the middle of the country should be a bit more, but it wasn't.

12.description: I went here last week but unfortunately I was in and out.  Nevertheless, I wanted to give them a review since I felt the service was great and the food was worth mentioning.  I had a pupusa de loroco and It was pretty tasty.  I've had pupusas de pollo and beef before but this is my first time trying loroco and it caught my eye since they are very popular in El Salvador. I do intend on going back so that I can try more of the items.  Once I do, I will update this review.

21.description: Pupusas here are good but~ their "Tamal de elotes"? to die for!!!!I'm not much of a tamales person but Tamal de elotes, originally from Salvador/Guatemala are so much better than tamales you see at most Mexican restaurants.The service here sucks. You will wait very, very long for your pupusas but my friend told me that this is the norm. So call ahead and place your order way, way ahead of time. Why the three stars? 4 stars for the food, 2 for the service and the wait. So 3 to average the two.

16.description: I went to the pupuseria last night for the first time and i must say that I was very impressed by most of the food.  We had a burrito, pasteles de carne, pupusas de loroco, queso, and chicharon, as well as a guatemalan style tamale. The pupusas were fantastic, as was the burrito...the pasteles were a bit more greasy that i would've liked but the flavor was great. The tamale was the low point of the meal, the masa was pretty flavorless and mushy (waterlogged) and the pork within was equally bland. That being said in the land of averages this place really impressed me, and the staff were very friendly which is always a bonus to good food, i will be sure to come back. Finally the bill was only $22 for all that food, filled 2 of us up completely.

17.description: Pupusas here are good but~ their "Tamal de elotes"? to die for!!!!I'm not much of a tamales person but Tamal de elotes, originally from Salvador/Guatemala are so much better than tamales you see at most Mexican restaurants.The service here sucks. You will wait very, very long for your pupusas but my friend told me that this is the norm. So call ahead and place your order way, way ahead of time. Why the three stars? 4 stars for the food, 2 for the service and the wait. So 3 to average the two.

10.description: I am far from a snob, and pride myself in regularly frequenting shady-looking establishments. But this place was dingy, had unfriendly service, and unfriendlier pupusas. The girl taking my order had an attitude, as well as the cook behind her. They charge extra if you want salsa for your food ($1 for a tiny portion), I purchased 7 of them--just to make a point. I was not impressed at all by the food or the ambiance. I ordered carryout because there was no way that I would eat inside this place. If you enjoyed the marvelous pupusas at nearby Delicias Brianna (RIP), this place doesn't even come close. Not even the rice was good, and I love flavored rices--especially the Central American varieties. I will not be back. Gross.

11.description: Best pupusas and pan de quesadilla in the city! Salsa is homemade and deliciously spicy.  Very casual dining, but sooo yummy!

26.description: The family that runs the place was super duper friendly, but the food was a little flavorless. Maybe it was an off-day.

27.description: This place is definitely a hole in the wall but their pupusas are delicious. The pupusas filled with cheese / pork rind and cheese and beans were fresh and made to perfection.The slaw and hot sauce used to put on the pupusa were great. The service is good and the food is cheap. I highly recommend this place!

0.description: This place makes great Salvadorian pupusas! I think it is better to grab some takeout rather eat there. The waitstaff are really friendly but the layout of the restaurant is terrible. The tables are too close and the decorations are kind of tacky!

20.description: I came here not expecting to eat (I needed something from them) but they, the husband and wife that own the place, treated me so well and with so much warmth that I tried the pupusas. I had no idea what they would be like, but I am very partial to "corn pancakes" so I knew that I would at least enjoy that. I was not wrong, I was not disappointed. I cannot compare this food to any other Salvadoran food, but I had a great experience. The wife, Rina, is super friendly. The music is good, at a good volume (not too loud). The food is good (and I like that you have to wait - there is really something wrong with food that is ready in two minutes). As I waited, I chatted with Rina and enjoyed the sound of the pancakes being formed. I really don't understand the comments about it being a hole in the wall...it's Albany Park! And, what do people expect? I am puzzled by that, really. It's clean and friendly, easy to get to, and managed by people who know their food!

19.description: I love pupusas, and I'm so happy that Cuscatleco is within 10 minutes of my apartment. I've been there twice now and both times I've loved the pupusas (beans and cheese, loroco with cheese and ayote with cheese). They also give you a very generous amount of curtido and salsa, I love to pile it on. My boyfriend loves the pasteles, steak tortas and tamal del gallina. The family that owns the business is also very nice, welcoming and funny. We love this place, we're recent Southside transplants and have had a hard time finding nearby ($) restaurants that we really like (Ravenswood area). The majority of our favorite Northside places have been in Albany Park. The first time we went, it did take some time to get our food, but the second time was much faster. I think it depends on what you order, the pupusas and pasteles are made fresh to order, so you know that nothing has been sitting out.

2.description: My first time trying this cuisine... I was so happy that  I loved it so much. Place is no frills and waiter was also.. Got one of each flavor and got a heaping cabbage salad to go on top. Salsas are good and not too spicy... Can't wait to try them for the 2nd time

18.description: I was in the hood recently and decided to call my order in so I could pick up the pupusas.  Their pupusas are consistently good.  I love that.  I wish I could adopt the chef as my mother.  They gave me a 30 minute pick up time and they had just started cooking the pupusas when I got there 30 minutes later.  It's okay to wait if you have time.

13.description: I've been coming here for a few years. It's a basic family diner, sometimes with loud news blasting (yesterday when I went there were violent images, as that's what's on the news in Central America unfortunately.) But the food is really pretty good. It's as good as the stuff I used to have in Central America, where pupusas are being made on the street corners.Try the pupusa mixta with a big helping of cabbage and tomato sauce. BTW, Central American food isn't spicy, so the salsas are mild.To explore another flavor, try the pupusa de loroco,  (loroco is a vine flower bud from Central America.) Also, the plantains with beans and crema are delicious.  (The refried beans are so tasty, thicker and more flavorful than Mexican style... just like I tried abroad...)   There's also a very light and refreshing Guatemalan tostada with minced beef, minced radish, and mint. It was unique. I'd stay away from the Mexican items, just because...Well, its Central American - so you'd probably get the best Mexican in a Mexican place. Basic service has always been fine for me. The place is small, so if you need attention you can get it. They need the business. Please go here.

4.description: This place is so worth the try... I live in the suburbs, but when I drive to  Chicago, I make sure I stop by here!!! The place is small, but food is  delicious... You must try their pupusas. The cheese and salsa give their dishes a remarkable taste!!!

24.description: Nice guy runs this place, but it's a big letdown after Cuscatleco 2 (See PUPUSERIA LOS PLANES), which is way, way up on Clark.  The pupusas were OK, the soup was OK, they didn't have that super-freshness of the food up at Cuscatleco 2. To be honest, I've never had a bad pupusa, but these were the lamest pupusas I ever had. The salad or cole saw or whatever that they put on the pupusas was limp and not fresh.  The worst thing was: The most tasteless red sauce I have EVER come across.

6.description: I really like their food, in particular their soups which are meals in and of themselves.  Last week during the snow storm they had the beef knuckle soup with corn, yucca and other vegetables.  It was scrumptious and just right for stormy weather.

22.description: For months I've been wondering where I could hear the "slap-slap" sound of freshly made pupusas in Chicago.  After a bit of research I decided to have my first pupusa experience at Pupuseria Restaurant Cuscatleco.  After placing my take-out order with the friendly gentleman behind the counter, I sat down and quietly observed the families who were dining in, as well as the one dude who walked in selling bootleg DVDs.  I knew this was a nondescript, neighborhood type of place so the only "wow" factor I was looking for was from the food.  Unfortunately my friends, this is where the story heads south.  I ordered three pupusas (the Frijol Con Queso, the Chicharron, and the Loroco), and really wasn't impressed by any of them.  The Loroco definitely had the most promise at first, but after a few bites they all started to taste the same, even with the accompanying salsas.  Maybe these bad boys are best eaten fresh, so I can't really say if my 10 minute car ride home had that much of an effect since I'm a novice when it comes to the pupusa.  In addition, the side salad (best described as a vinegar slaw I suppose), was pretty much past its prime - the smell alone gave away that it wasn't very fresh.  Keep in mind, I came late on a Tuesday night so maybe it just wasn't the right time of week to go.  If there is one saving grace, prices are dirt cheap and the food is filling.  I haven't given up on you yet pupusa.  Next stop is Rogers Park...

15.description: This unassuming Salvadorian restaurant is just what every neighbourhood needs. They have no lofty goals for culinary dominion and yet the food they turn out satisfies every time.I usually go here for a quick snack of pupusas, which are like hollow flatbreads made from corn/rice flour and filled with cheese, meat or vegetables. Cuscatleco offers only a few varieties of pupusas: combinations or cheese, beans, chicharron and loroco (flowers from an edible herb). My favourites are the cornmeal pupusas filled with cheese and loroco, or cheese and chicharron. I find the rice flour pupusas a little dense, and the cornmeal ones have a wonderful warm, buttery aroma. The meal comes with a bowl of pleasantly vinegary cabbage slaw, mildly tinged with Mexican oregano. You will also get little containers each of a green cilantro sauce and a red chilli sauce. I'm partial to the green!The menu also includes other items from El Salvador and Mexico. The tacos and tortas are tasty and wholesome, but so far the pupusas are my favourites. I would recommend coming here for a snack, especially as an alternative to chain fast food. The people are also nicer!

7.description: The Bay Area's large Salvadorean community will spoil you on good pupusas, but this place was pretty decent overall.I got a huuuuge take out order para la familia cuando estaba en Chicago last year. Everything was really good. The nice hombre me dio un free soda because he misunderstood my order and I had to wait a few extra minutes.The fam was contento con todo as well.

8.description: Had new friends in town and before the headed home to Ohio they craved Salvadoran food.  This quaint, northside establishment appealed to their appetites as well as our wallets.  The friendly staff made sure we were comfortable and taken care of.  Parking? It's the northside so it's first-come-first-serve.  It hit the spot and we were all happy about it.

30.description: This unassuming Salvadorian restaurant is just what every neighbourhood needs. They have no lofty goals for culinary dominion and yet the food they turn out satisfies every time.I usually go here for a quick snack of pupusas, which are like hollow flatbreads made from corn/rice flour and filled with cheese, meat or vegetables. Cuscatleco offers only a few varieties of pupusas: combinations or cheese, beans, chicharron and loroco (flowers from an edible herb). My favourites are the cornmeal pupusas filled with cheese and loroco, or cheese and chicharron. I find the rice flour pupusas a little dense, and the cornmeal ones have a wonderful warm, buttery aroma. The meal comes with a bowl of pleasantly vinegary cabbage slaw, mildly tinged with Mexican oregano. You will also get little containers each of a green cilantro sauce and a red chilli sauce. I'm partial to the green!The menu also includes other items from El Salvador and Mexico. The tacos and tortas are tasty and wholesome, but so far the pupusas are my favourites. I would recommend coming here for a snack, especially as an alternative to chain fast food. The people are also nicer!

3.description: Eat the pupusas hot off the grill. The cheese  and loroco pupusa was my favorite by far. Just the recollection of it is mouth watering. The other mixed ones were also quite tasty. The chicken tamal was a bit watery. Perhaps they added water to keep it from tasting dried out, I'm not sure, but the flavor was good despite being watery. Focus on the pupusas. And maybe plantains too.

14.description: Where's the flavor? Steak meal wasn't all that. The pasteles aren't pasteles at all instead their Empanadas. Don't be mistaken like me. They call empanadas pastales. So if you want their Puerto Rican looking pastele you have to say TAMALES POR FAVOR! I'd hate to ask for an empanda there I'd probably get a cheeseburger. The crunch was cool but the flavor lacked. I've had way better Salvadorian food before.  Your left wanting to smack the chef for not adding flavor to anything. The papusas were okay but didn't amaze me.

3.description: The food is delicious and they have a wonderful selection... BUT these people move so incredibly slow they're practically moving backwards. If you're willing to stand and wait around for 15 minutes while somebody makes you a simple wrap - this is your spot!

1.description: So I 100% agree with every poster who said something about the service.  About a month ago I went into the shop for a sandwich and received the absolute WORST customer service ever.  I tried to reach out via email privately but never heard back... Below is what happened and the email that was sent. "I don't usually do this but I just received the absolute worst service at your State Street location and really want to address it because I don't know if I will ever return.  My coworker and I stopped in to pick up some sandwiches to go around 12:15pm today.  We were not greeted, we were not even acknowledged until we had been there for about 5 minutes.  We went to the "order here" sign and only when the woman began taking orders at the register were we acknowledged (after several people who had gotten there after us ordered before us).  In order to save time I ordered both of our sandwiches together which I didn't think would be a problem... until we went to pay for them.  The woman at the register insisted that since I had ordered them together that they needed to be paid for together.  We asked if there was any way to split it between two credit cards, and a few other options and she told us no with attitude each time.  I finally asked if it was possible to just cancel the previous order and re-enter it into the system as two separate ones which she VERY grudgingly did.  The food was absolutely delicious but the service we received was very disappointing."

2.description: They are friendly but really slow !! Really slow !!This place is a great spot to grab  a sandwich or salad. It is small inside but they have everything you really need!   They have a few already propertied items... I have seen meatloaf, quesidalls, chicken, meatballs and pasta to name a few. I really like the chicken club sandwich with avocado, chicken, bacon, lettuce and tomato.   I went with my coworkers and we all got different sandwiches and each enjoyed ours. They also have some great breakfast options, from sandwiches to scones and muffins.  I have had the blueberry lemon muffin, a scone (I do not remember what kind) and a blackberry muffin.  They were all good and I would order them again! Sometimes I leave feeling it was a little over priced but overall, I have always enjoyed the food.

5.description: So slow and cluelessly run it made me wanna cry. If you can wait forever for overpriced food then this is the place for you. I only came to pick up an order that a friend had called in and was easily there for 20 minutes before I got out. And it wasn't even prime time. God help you if you get behind anyone who wants more than one thing.

6.description: I just found this place this morning. I had a plain bagel with lox, it was surprisingly good!  I usually reserve bagels for trips to NYC, but the ones here are worth indulging in. This place is great for grabbing a quick bite to eat.

7.description: The food is reasonably good but the staff here seem routinely overwhelmed - making the waits unnecessarily long and the order frequently wrong. I've been here a few times and it's the same issue with others in line or ordering. They definitely need to take customer service up a few notches

8.description: Overall - good place, yummy choices of healthy salads for take away that are weighed. I like the quinoa salad, the kale one, and the shrimp and orzo salad. The rainbow cake is the best thing there. One disappointment - the goddess and grocer website says they serve breakfast until 3pm daily, but I went to this location at 12:30 and asked for a breakfast burrito and they told me they stop serving breakfast at 12 on weekends and 11 during the week. So I ended up just buying a coffee and going somewhere else to get my breakfast fix. I think they should be serving breakfast all day or at least until 3 pm like their website says, especially since they have things like bagels and lox or bagels and veggies on the breakfast menu and people could want that for lunch...

9.description: Lots of choices they even have avocado, quonia and kale. They have a large salad bar, 5 soup choices as well as hot and cold choices, snacks, Gelato and other desserts and coffee. For the area the prices  are reasonable. The place seems clean as well. The only issue is that the employees do NOT know their products well enough. They could not tell me if their products were organic and their fish wild. All they knew was that the product was local. Under that assimilation they are likely not organic that that is a shame. At least some of their product ought to be even if it cost more. I'd be willing to pay more. Lastly, glad it closes at 9.

0.description: Goddess is my go to place when I need a quick bite or if I have friends or family in town and we want a quick breakfast. The people at Goddess are always friendly and patient. The sandwiches are yummy and the salad bar is awesome for a quick meal. I would recommend goddess to anyone!

4.description: I was so happy when they opened this location after closing the one on Delaware St. I came the first time to get a slice of their rainbow cake for my friend...but I had a little and I was disappointed with the taste not the way the cake looked. However, I also tried their panko chicken tenders, their fried shrimp, and the goddess chicken and I loved all of them. I also buy my paleo diet granola here. The items here are a little pricey but good for an occasional treat. The staff is also super nice despite some of the clientele being too stuffy.

58.description: I ordered a personal Malnatis classic pizza with the spinach basil mix and pepperoni. It is a perfect size for one personal. It does take about half an hour so getting an appetizer or salad is recommended. The pizza is good but has too much cheese and not enough sauce. Although it is good it isn't amazing, it is a bit talked up in my opinion

56.description: It was quite busy there, it means they have good food. It is true, their pizza was delicious. Our waitress was phenomenal. I took one star away because the cooks missed our order. We asked for small half Lou half Classic, but they made one small Lou. The good thing they made up by giving us one whole small Classic pizza. Obviously, we could not finish both, so we gave the other one to a homeless guy outside. He was so happy when he got that pizza (I am just a tourist here for couple of days). Good pizza, good service, good people! I definitely recommend it.

29.description: Hands down the best Chicago deep dish I've ever had. Ordered a small size of The Lou to share with my mom and the portions were huge that we were both full and so satisfied at the end. You have to wait a little after you order but it's definitely worth it. Great ambiance, friendly staff and excellent service. I can't wait to go again!

42.description: Really cool location with the converted fire house! Great visual interest with old fire station artifacts and exposed brick. The lighting gives it a warm feel too!We came here for deep dish pizza, and while the cheese, sauce and spinach were delicious, I CANNOT get into their crust. It's dense and tastes like watery cardboard to me. Not that I eat cardboard, but it's just not my thang. Service was friendly, and the Lou's Lemon Martini I ordered went down easy.

23.description: Holy shit. I get that I have to say more than that in order to leave a review, but holy shit is about all that comes to mind. The pizza is fantastic, beyond fantastic. Goodness.

47.description: Best deep dish chain in Chicago hands down. I live for their Malnati salad - romaine, gorgonzola, crunchy salami bits, tomatoes, mushrooms, and a sweet Italian vinaigrette that I could eat every single day of my life. Their butter crust is what makes their deep dish the best. The pepperoni or classic with sausage are both delicious. The atmosphere is very cool at this location as well. Whether you live in Chicago or are just visiting, this is the place to go.

8.description: My very first deep dish pizza experience. And it was pretty good!(that is until I tried Giordano's and Gino's East but that's whole other story and Yelp review)My boyfriend and I had just arrived in Chicago on a Monday and of course, our first order of business was pizza. Since Lou Malnati's was on my list of places to try, and it was about a 10 minute walk from where we were staying, we decided to drop in at around 8:30. There was no wait for a table, but we were told it would take about 45 minutes to an hour for the pizzas to come out (understandably so). So we ordered half of the Lou and half of the Malnati Chicago Classic (small, which serves 2), with garlic, got a few beers and waited for the masterpiece to come out. When it finally did, it looked small. But don't let that fool you. It was actually really filling because of all the toppings. It was good, but my mind wasn't really blown, like I was expecting it to be.Lou's pizzas are about half the size of its competitors. It's also about half the price. Supposedly, they have the best crust. I'm not a crust person in general so I can't really speak on that - but it did taste buttery.If I had Lou's and only Lou's, I would probably come back. But now that I've also tried their competitors, there are definitely better options in my opinion. It's just a matter of what you're looking for in a deep dish pizza.

31.description: A Chicago visit MUST. I've been to some other Chicago style pizza places, but Lou's is the best. The two signature pies, one with lots of meat and the other with good veggies, are awesome. They also have a giant cookie skillet which is great to split with a big group. The pizza takes a while to bake, so do t go here if you're in a super time crunch. This location is also near lots of shopping and bars etc. so you can have a relaxing dinner after hitting the shops.

34.description: So I've been to Lou's many times and it always great!I brought my brother, his wife, and kids there this weekend.  He was in town visiting and wanted to try a Chicago Style Pizza, so took him to Lou's.  It was super crowded and they don't take reservations.  You have to come in put your name down and they'll text you when your tables ready.  This is fine when I come with friends, we can go have drinks at the bar, but after a long day at the zoo lights two young kids were tired.  The staff made them cheese bread and sauce for them to munch on while they wait.  The girls at the counter were so nice to them.When you put your name down, you can also place your order.  Chicago style pizza's take about 45 minutes to cook, so I highly suggest putting in your order with the name.  After about an hour of waiting, we were seated, ordered some apps, and about 15 minutes later our pizza came out.  We ordered the Malnati salad and the wings as apps and a large Malnati Chicago Classic deep dish pizza.  The Classic comes with the butter crust, but if you order any other type of pizza make sure to get the butter crust.  It's delicious!  It was the perfect amount of food for four adults and two young kids.  The kids are young and split a slice.I would recommend Lou's for anyone wanting a true Chicago pizza.

16.description: #20Last time I was in Chicago (I think about 2 moths ago) we ventured to the N Wells St. location of Lou Malnati's and had an amazing time.  I left almost needing to be carried out, buttons busting off my blouse, happy and full.  I am in the city with a few different people and some of the last crowd and we all thought a trip to Lou's would be the right thing to do.I talked this place up to my group on the plane so much so that I thought Nick was going to throw something at me--but now that we are off the plane and here in the restaurant, Nick is singing a different tune... Something like, "Thank you Steph for the best pizza in Chi-town."We had the famous Chicago deep dish pizza with tons of cheese, sauce, veggies, etc.  It is the kind of pizza that tastes so good you want to have a few pieces but you just cannot, at lest not in good conscience.  There is something about Chicago style deep dish that makes me smile.  It not only reminds me of my teenage years here, but it also reminds my of one thing Cali is sorely missing--perfect pizza.The service was impeccable, the pizza was something that even the Greek gods would have loved, and the drinks were on point.  I am glad that I was able to talk my group into staying awake and venturing out into the cold, Chicago weather to enjoy this slice of paradise.Stephani Smiles for Lou Malnati's Pizza ;)#deepestdeepdishchicagohasforyourtummy

13.description: Everyone says that this is a must try spot for pizza when in Chicago. I ordered some calamari which was surprisingly crisp and tasty, it would have been nice of the tomato sauce that came with it was warm though. I also ordered the Chicago Classic which is a deep dish that has a layer of sausage below the sauce and cheese. It was good but I didn't find their crust to be all that "buttery" as they described. I thought it was kind of dry actually. All in all it is pretty good pizza but I wouldn't consider this a must try restaurant if you are in town for a short amount of time. Our waiter was great and the food is reasonably priced.

11.description: Waitresses are super friendly! Second night coming here in a row. I suggest the Italian Margarita and a deep dish pizza of some kind. I will definitely be back in the future. A+

39.description: This was our first stop on the Gold Coast & Old Town Food Tour so I got to try the famous Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. Since this was a part of the food tour, I did not get to really experience the dine-in or service experience, so this review is strictly on the food. We were first served a small Malnati salad, which was a mix of romaine lettuce, some small tomatoes, olives, and mushrooms. There was also a choice of salami bits and cheese that can be sprinkled over the salad. The salad was mixed with some balsamic vinaigrette dressing. It was actually really good. Then, we were served a slice of sausage deep dish pizza. Let's just say that their pizza... is absolutely amazing!! After eating here, I now understand why Chicago is known for their deep dish. Maybe not all Chicago deep dish, but definitely the deep dish here at Lou Malnati's! Their cheese is so good and the combination between the amount of cheese and sauce was literally the perfect ratio. Unlike other pizza, you really do get your meat in every bite. There was a layer of sausage beneath the cheese so that was just super delicious. Overall, I definitely recommend this place for those who have not tried Chicago's deep dish pizza. I just got back from my small mini vacation and was already craving their pizza; and since I lived a few states away, I had to ship a pizza! Can't wait for it! Thank you Lou Malnati's for a great Chicago Deep Dish Pizza experience!

37.description: When I imagine heaven this is what I think of! I honestly have dreams about this pizza. I know when many people think of deep dish they think that its gonna be super think but this is not the case with Lou Malnati's. The pizza here has the perfect balance of crust, toppings and sauce! It's like they have developed their own secret algorithm for the perfect pizza.The service has been great both times I have been here and have been seated right away. The wait for freshly made goodness is also not long at all! If I lived in Chicago I'd be here all the time. Please open one up in Minneapolis!Whenever I come to Chicago this is my first stop no matter what!

0.description: If it's up to me, I can do pizza without the breading, except at Lou Malnati's.It's essential here, to support the layers and layers of cheese, toppings, and sauce.Moreover, the buttery crust is perfectly cooked to golden brown, like a pie crust.That said, Lou Malnati's pizza is my dream pizza!!!We visited Chicago on one of the coldest and craziest day with freezing rain and wind blowing so hard that the Willis tower had closed down.  We barely survived our 100ft walk to our Uber vechicle that brought us back to our hotel.Weather had ruined all our dinner plans but Lou Malnati's saved our day!Even in this crazy, insane weather they were delivering pizzas!!!They told us the wait could be long, up to 2 hours, which was completely understandable and worth it!  Even after the long wait time, our pie was delivered and it was still pipping hot!Thank you for delivering and catering to your customers!!!

38.description: If you are visiting Chicago and are looking for a great place to try authentic and delicious deep dish pizza consider Lou Malnati's over some of the other pizza restaurants.When I lived in Chicago this was my favorite deep dish pizza restaurant and I always come back when I visit.  There are several Lou Malnati's located throughout the city.  This location is close to State and Rush and just a short walk from the shopping on Michigan Avenue and the Division Street L stop.  This is good for parties of all sizes but expect to wait if you are coming on the weekend.  The good thing about the wait is that they let you order while you are waiting since the deep dish pizzas can take 45 minutes to cook.  If you are looking for something on the healther side try the Malnati Salad.  The dressing on the salad has got to be top 3 in my book of salad dressings ever tasted.  The best part about the pizza here that makes it better than the other pizza joints in Chicago is the crust.  It has this great flavor that is not crunchy but more pie like.  The sauce and cheese inside of it make it a great combination.  If you are just coming in for lunch they offer an awesome lunch menu for under $10 that gives you 2 choices such as a salad and a personal size deep dish pizza, amongst other items.  Expect your meal to last about 90 minutes if you are doing dinner with a group of 4 or more.  This is not a place to come to if you are in a hurry.

51.description: Pizza was good. Calamari is the best.

27.description: Karmar was super helpful on my order accommodating allergies for my family's order!! Give him a raise! :)

32.description: I'm not usually a fan of deep dish, but if it comes from Lou's I'd be down any day! The sauce really sets it apart from other pies in the city.

54.description: When you come to Chicago you HAVE to get deep dish pizza...so I was told.  The important question here though is where??? There are so many options.  I went the lazy route and chose the place right down the street from the place I was staying at which happened to be the famous Lou Malnati's Pizzeria.  I heard about the long wait, however I didn't have much time in Chicago so I ordered my personal size Sausage & Mushroom deep dish pizza over the phone for carry out.  Was I disappointed?  Hell no! It was oozing with cheese and the sausage had great flavor and texture.  The pizza was gone in seconds and I wasn't even that hungry.  Yup, I'm coming back to get the "Lou" next time

48.description: One of my favorite pizza places in the city. The thin crust Pizza is the best and the malnattis salad is awesome

44.description: People say to go here for the pizza... We say go here for the cheesy garlic bread... Seriously best we've ever had.  Even if the pizza wasn't awesome, which it was awesome, the bread was definitely worth the trip to Chicago!

24.description: I am not a fan of deep dish pizza, and even less so of chain restaurants.That said, the Malnati's on the 1200 block of N State St makes some of the best pizza I've had of any style. Hooked instantly. Substantial portions, great sauce, beautiful flaky crust. After five or so orders I have yet to be disappointed.Great value and fast delivery.

7.description: The deep dish pizza is awesome!! So delicious!! The best pizza in Chicago!!And the beer selection is great with good beers on tap. The staff is nice!!

49.description: Great pizza. Hostess was a little rude but the food made up for it. If you are a tourist check this place out!

40.description: Everyone says that this is a must try spot for pizza when in Chicago. I ordered some calamari which was surprisingly crisp and tasty, it would have been nice of the tomato sauce that came with it was warm though. I also ordered the Chicago Classic which is a deep dish that has a layer of sausage below the sauce and cheese. It was good but I didn't find their crust to be all that "buttery" as they described. I thought it was kind of dry actually. All in all it is pretty good pizza but I wouldn't consider this a must try restaurant if you are in town for a short amount of time. Our waiter was great and the food is reasonably priced.

53.description: I'm a huge pizza fan and I had to try out this place while I was in town, it was also around the corner from where I was staying. We arrived promptly at 11 when they opened and were helped right away. Me and my friend decided to split a small Malnati Chicago Classic! We were almost able to finish all of it, we probably could have if didn't eat the first piece so quick! The server, Aubrey was great and attentive. I really liked that she advised how long the wait would be for our food, which was about 30 minutes! I ended up ordering a Bloody Mary which was great, a bit on the spicy side, it came with a celery stalk, and a olive and pepperoni skewer, a few cheese cubes would have been great!

30.description: The place is a must for anyone looking for great deep dish pizza in Chicago. Even the salads and sides are good here. Location is in a bright and busy area in the city so it's a great place to bring a date or a relative visiting from out of town. The menu is good, great drink options, and the service is usually top notch.

46.description: Call ahead to get your pie started and blow by the tourists waiting in line to get your pizza to go. We did that last night and got a "Lou" and a classic Malnatti's and a salad. $51 total, fed 4 and there's half a pie still. Most of us agreed that this was the best deep dish, better than Gino's or Giordanno's, so you know that this is a great place to get your deep dish fill!

1.description: I am more of a Giordano's or Ricobene's fan, but Lou Malnati's definitely counts as good pizza.We had a late lunch here on Thursday.  The staff is super friendly and helpful.I really like the decor.  It feels nice yet comfortable. It certainly seems like a fancier place than a pizza parlor.The private rooms looked quite nice.  This would be a great place to have a party.The house salad was delicious.  I could have eaten tons more of that.  I actually debated about getting one to go.The garlic bread was fantastic.  It was a decent size too, but it should be for being $5.We ordered Spinach deep dish pizza (our norm anywhere).  The pizza was fine.  I'm not a huge fan of the crust, but I thought the ratio of crust/sauce/cheese was perfect.  I would have liked more spinach in it.  I actually liked the pizza more leftover cold the next day.  I wish I had more of it!All in all it was a very good lunch, but I think Lou's seems more expensive than Giordano's.  (Giordano's pizza is a lot thicker, and a lot more food per slice for about the same amount of money).

55.description: How? How does this place have a 4 star average? I know how: tourists. This pizza seems mediocre at best, and in a world class pizza town like Chicago, you really shouldn't settle for this. A fair metric for how well made a pizza can be is a combo of fresh ingredients and real ingredients. You can't convince me either applies to this "pizza". Do not even try to eat this cold the next day; the crust had become brittle and the "cheese" turns to plastic. Frankly, it's just shameful.

9.description: I must say seeing as I'm not a big deep dish pizza fans this was definitely the best I've ever had.

26.description: Came here during the holidays with a really big group. They were very accommodating, gave us our own room, and service was quick. Our waiter ended up dropping two pizzas which they comped and also gave us some free appetizers to compensate. Overall the pizza didn't disappoint and we didn't feel rushed out of the place which was nice with such a big group.

25.description: Gonna have to toss Lou Malnati's Pizzeria a 2 star rating, with extra salt. Expecations were high going here as there are other deep dish options that my group could have tried on our visit to Chicago, but Lou Malnati's ended up being our pick based on market research. Based on circumstances beyond our control, we had a limited amount of time to eat our Lou Malnati's pies before we had to depart to a latter time-sensitive engagement. Knowing this, we called Lou's at around 6:15pm to inform them, we'd likely be arriving around 7pm and it would be in our best interests if our pies were ready at that point, if possible, since we had an engagement at 8pm. If this was not possible, we would have moved on with our lives. Lou's said this was more than possible and that the pies would be ready. Getting them to go was an option, but the employee on the phone assured us that dine-in would be a smooth process in our time range. Arriving at 7pm, as stated, we informed them of our arrival, obviously, expecting a table. Long story short, we got a table at around 7:30pm and didn't get our first of two pizzas until 7:45pm. We had told them to just make them to go at that point but the first pizza didn't get the message. We ended up eating the entire first pizza in 5-7 minutes since we had to hustle to get to our 8pm destination.The servers were pretty annoyed at us since we asked about the ETA of our pizzas a few times and eventually got one of the pies to-go. Had to get up and walk around to find a new server after our old server started avoiding us. We were annoying customers that day and I understand the grind of server life but given the circumstances our group was heated. I don't even remember what the first pizza tasted like. I imagine it was good. The second pizza that we ate once we got home was quite good after being reheated in the oven. I'm sure Lou's is a great establishment, given its enduring popularity and other reviews, so maybe I'll give it another chance, but gotta call it like I see it.

12.description: This was our first stop on the Gold Coast & Old Town Food Tour so I got to try the famous Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. Since this was a part of the food tour, I did not get to really experience the dine-in or service experience, so this review is strictly on the food. We were first served a small Malnati salad, which was a mix of romaine lettuce, some small tomatoes, olives, and mushrooms. There was also a choice of salami bits and cheese that can be sprinkled over the salad. The salad was mixed with some balsamic vinaigrette dressing. It was actually really good. Then, we were served a slice of sausage deep dish pizza. Let's just say that their pizza... is absolutely amazing!! After eating here, I now understand why Chicago is known for their deep dish. Maybe not all Chicago deep dish, but definitely the deep dish here at Lou Malnati's! Their cheese is so good and the combination between the amount of cheese and sauce was literally the perfect ratio. Unlike other pizza, you really do get your meat in every bite. There was a layer of sausage beneath the cheese so that was just super delicious. Overall, I definitely recommend this place for those who have not tried Chicago's deep dish pizza. I just got back from my small mini vacation and was already craving their pizza; and since I lived a few states away, I had to ship a pizza! Can't wait for it! Thank you Lou Malnati's for a great Chicago Deep Dish Pizza experience!

59.description: The pizza was delicious as promised! We got the classic deep dish and were not disappointed with our first Chicago pizza experience. We returned later in the week for a second helping.Our server Deborah is the main reason I'm writing this review. She was friendly, sweet, and seemed genuinley excited to share the city experience with us. She made us feel so welcome and I am happy we met her. She really made Lou Malnati's stand out!

21.description: This is my first time having Chicago deep dish pizza and it was delicious. The server was very helpful, insightful, and friendly. I went on a Tuesday night so there wasn't any wait, however the pizza did take about 30minutes to come out. It was definitely worth it.

17.description: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria is a Chicago based pizza chain that specializes in deep dish pizza.  There are many places to go in Chicago for deep dish pizza, but I chose Lou Malnati's based on some fellow Yelper's recommendations (thanks Gem/Willis!) and lucky for me I experienced the best deep dish crust I'd ever eaten.My Overall Rating - 4  1/2 Stars (Atmosphere, Service, Food, Return)Atmosphere - The Lou Malnati's near downtown has a nice Broadway type sign directing you to it.  We sat outside in the open patio space and allowed the cool Chicago breeze to blow through while we people watched.  Honestly I never made it inside the actual restaurant but when the weather is beautiful the patio can't be beat.  1 Star.Service - Our service was good not great.  I hate playing the tourist card, but I like hearing about the history or background of a restaurant.  Our server really didn't go into much detail nor make any recommendations, so we just checked out the menu for ourselves.  Pizza can be a messy affair, and our tables did pile up some dishes.  But our servers were nice, attentive, & helped with any requests.  I just wish I could have gotten more insight.   1/2 Star.Food - If you're time is limited and you can only choose one deep dish pizza place to go to, make it Lou's.   My experience with deep dish pizza is limited, but if there is one thing I will never forget, it's the amazing crust.  The deep dish pizza crust is like a perfect, fresh-out-of-grandma's-oven pie crust.  It's light, flakey, buttery, and simply amazing.  I thought it would be hard, but instead I found this to be the BEST part of my pizza.  My favorite was Lou's Special - a deep dish pizza loaded with fresh vegetables that it really lets the flavors stand out and not be over powered by salty meats.  I'll be honest, I rarely eat my pizza crust at pizza restaurants, but at Lou's it was what made the pizza so amazing.  Skip the thin crust pizza (you're in Chicago!).  Salad appetizers were good too - but if you're here it's all about the crust.  2 Stars.Will I Return? - Yes.  Chicago is a big city, but any visit back to this great city will include a trip to Lou's.  If you're looking for the best deep dish crust in town, you'll find it here.  1 Star.My Yelp Rating Scale (Sum of all parts):1 Star - Atmosphere - Is it a cool dive?  Perhaps an upscale place?  No matter the type, atmosphere plays a big part and I'll give a star if I like it or thinks it has great charm.1 Star - Service - You can have a great meal with bad service.  But that's also what can make a five star joint drop to four.  It's important to the dining experience that service is great and on point.2 Stars - Food - I'll award up to two stars for the food, since this is the main reason we dine out.  Sometimes the extra star is given for value, but it's really all about the food.1 Star - Will I come back? - If I know for a fact I'll return, I'll give this a star. A place has to make an impression for me to return. Each Category can be given up to 1 star except food (2 stars) because I consider all these categories important to the overall dining experience.  I will sum them up to provide my final Yelp score.

10.description: When in Chicago, one must try their famous Deep Dish Pizza. I am a thin crust lover, but I was excited to try something new. This was my first time having Deep Dish and when we asked where to go everyone pointed at Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. Although its a chain, this place gets packed. We had to wait about 40min to get seated and since they make the pizzas to order (of course) and its deep dish style, it takes 40min for the food to come out.The "Lou" - Spinach mix, mushrooms and sliced roma tomatoes covered with blend of mozzarella, romano and cheddar cheese on garlic Buttercrust: I really enjoyed this one. I love veggie pizzas and this was really good. All the veggies were soft and juicy. Lots of cheese under the tomato sauce. The crust was oh so crispy and buttery.The Malnati Chicago Classic: Made with Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust. If you are a meat-lover, this is the one for you. Every bite you get tons of sausage. Overall, I think I still prefer the thin crust. I feel like Deep Dish Pizza's are way too heavy but I do love that they come with a ton of sauce and their crust is amazing. Service all night was excellent.

5.description: What can I not say about this place? Thin crust? Skip it. Not as flavorful as their deep dish. It's large enough to have your own private party. Good election of beers, tvs, and group fun. Not as cheesy as I thought it would be. The sauce was on the sweeter side as was the crust. We had the Chicago classic made spicy. Amazing. I find this place better for the ambiance than Giordano's.  The Carbs are strong with this one!

3.description: When I imagine heaven this is what I think of! I honestly have dreams about this pizza. I know when many people think of deep dish they think that its gonna be super think but this is not the case with Lou Malnati's. The pizza here has the perfect balance of crust, toppings and sauce! It's like they have developed their own secret algorithm for the perfect pizza.The service has been great both times I have been here and have been seated right away. The wait for freshly made goodness is also not long at all! If I lived in Chicago I'd be here all the time. Please open one up in Minneapolis!Whenever I come to Chicago this is my first stop no matter what!

35.description: Let me start off by saying: I don't even like pizza.Ever since I left Chicago, I've been wanting to go back just to eat here again.. My wife thinks I'm crazy because I normally don't enjoy pizza but after trying the deep dish here, I'm think I'm in love.We ended up here as a part of the chicago food tour (you should def do this too) and I'm super glad we did. I've actually heard about this restaurant from multiple people who have visited Chicago before and I've been told that this place will make you look at pizza differently! My wife and I ordered some wings, a salad, and their deep dish -- it was probably the most memorable meal we had in Chicago.. (And yes, we did go to all the recommended places like Purple Pig, Tengo Sur, etc)If you go to Chicago and don't eat here, you definitely are missing out!

19.description: BEST DEEP DISH EVER!!!! tasty and fresh ingredients! Crunchy buttery crust. We had the classic and added pepperoni and hot giardiniera (on the side). Soooooo goood!!  Great service and atmosphere.

28.description: Pros:1. Fresh and very flavorful ingredients. We had the special with sausage.2. Cool atmosphere3. Friendly staff4. Very affordable - my husband and I ate for about $20Cons:1. Somewhat crowded with big parties2. The staff is a bit overworked. Our waitress seemed to have her hands full and we found ourselves waiting a bit. Overall my favorite Chicago deep dish pizza so far!

45.description: Stopped in for a traditional Chicago deep dish pizza while visiting Chicago. The restaurant is quite nice inside, loved the decor. Appetizers (cheesy bread and calamari) came out very quick and were quite delicious. Cheesy bread was the best! Our pizza however came out very late. There was a mixup in the kitchen and it took over a hour for us to receive it. The manager came by and was more than generous! He took care of our entire check and sent us home with a dessert as well! It's that type of service that would make sure we return on our next visit.

33.description: Lou's is a long-term favorite of mine, always had been. I'd ordered for delivery, a few weeks back, but 2 hours later still no pizza. Pretty sure the delivery guy $%#@ -up, and it wasn't Lou's fault at all, but Frank the manager of this location owned-up to it big time. It's so different from all the places that often make excuses - so this guy really gets customer service. He handled it in the best way possible, and is part of the reason Lou's is so great !

43.description: Giordanos? NO. Pizza Uno or Dos? NO. Lou Malnati's? YES!  You have come to the right place, the clear winner in Chicago deep dish. This location is much better restaurant size-wise than the one on N. Wells.  Wait times may still be rough so try to MAKE a reservation if you can!Why is this the best in Chicago? The sauce on the pizza RUNS LAPS around the others....dough is fantastic...cheese is lovely....and the experience is great all around.  Pizza is about the sauce and the dough...toppings are what you make of it.  Lou takes home the Chicago crown...end of story.

2.description: I don't like pizza, however a friend said this was the best pizza he's tried in Chicago so we decided to try it.  We ordered the Chicago style pizza with their famous butter crust and have to say it was DELICIOUS!  It was unlike any other pizza I've ever had.  Tasty, crisp crust (we ordered it well done), mouthwatering cheese and topped with tomato sauce with actual chunks of tomato in it.  Vegetables were crisp.The wine list was excellent and had a hard time choosing one as there were so many tempting optionsCozy, comfy atmosphere (although some of the side dining room on the north side of the building was so bright you would need sunglasses to keep from squinting.Servers were friendly and attentive (I went back a few times by myself in the next couple of weeks).

18.description: As a new Chicago resident I have been getting my fair share of questions regarding the great "Giordano's vs Lou Malnati's" debate. I've had Giordano's twice at this point and Lou's once now. I can finally weigh in on my thoughts. First, because this location is on Rush street, I highly suggest either making a reservation or ordering online. I ordered online and my pie was ready right when I got there on time. It was incredibly busy on a Sunday afternoon. No empty chairs tables anywhere. People were eating in what looked to be a waiting room.I ordered a buttercrust deep dish with sausage, mushrooms, and garlic. The sausage was AMAZING. I have never tasted sausage like this before in my life. The mushrooms could have been sauteed longer, and the garlic I imagined would've been whole cloves or half cloves instead of minced. Lou is famed for its crust. Mine was a little burnt around the edges and it was super crunchy. I did not order my crust to be this crunchy so it was kind of a let down. Between Giordano's and Lou's, Lou's has the better sausage and tomato sauce, but Giordano's has the much better crust.

41.description: This is my 3rd time visiting Lou's and it just gets better every visit. We are normally go for thin crust... Yes I know whilst in Chicago we should go deep dish but it's thin all the way for me.The restaurant is always full with a vibrant friendly atmosphere and service is always quick and efficient.We've tried other pizza establishments in Chicago but for us this is the place to go.

52.description: Ok, ok, Chicago, you got me... deep dish is pretty effing amazing.  I never thought I'd think I'd love deep dish pizza as much as I did, thanks to good ole Lou.  Let's just be clear that deep dish pizza should not be compared to regular pizza bc they are two separate, but delicious beasts.I haven't had deep dish anywhere else since Lou Malnati was my first (so pure, I know), so I can't say who does it better, but I will say how surprisingly good this place does it.  The butter crust was not oily or greasy as I imagined it would be and the layers of toppings and flavors were truly delicious and very generous. Since it takes around 30 minutes for each pie to bake, I love that you can place your pizza order while you wait for a table, so that you don't have to eat your arm off by the time you finally get seated (if there's a wait).The caesar salad was no joke, FANTASTIC.  Not sure I've ever said that about a lame salad, but the dressing, tomatoes, and just everything about it was just so yum, I would've been completely happy and satisfied just eating a giant bowl to myself.The not so delicious moments include the calamari which came with a weird salsa type dipping sauce rather than a typical red sauce.... pass.  The lasagna looked pretty substantial, but after just a few bites, I wasn't impressed with the flavors and it seemed over complicated.  Whatever happened to the trusty, straightforward, simple, but tasty lasagna we all know and love?Overall, a really great meal and some hefty pizza gorging went down (more than any of us anticipated)... I'll need to find a way to scratch that deep dish itch in LA....

50.description: This was our first real Chicago pizza experience and a tasty one at that. The service was fast and friendly always attentive to our tables needs. As for the pizza it was think and flavor packed!!! We ordered a medium for three of us as the waiter recommended and she was right. It fed us till  we were stuffed to the gills only leaving a little sliver of pie. The taste was great but for me it just doesn't compare to NYC pizza... No that's not saying anything bad about this pizza!!! The taste was great and the sausage was truly amazing I'm just not a buttered crust kind of guy!!!

4.description: While visiting I had to try some authentic  chicago pizza and I knew I had to try it here.We got the butter crust with pepperoni onion and black olive  . It was delicious. exactly as I expectedWe started with the bruschetta which I didn't care for as the toppings were served too cold and the tomatoes were very dry.If avoid the appetizers and stick to the main show..the pies. Service was good. The atmosphere was fun and cozy.Leftover pizza was an added bonus the next morning!

6.description: Gonna have to toss Lou Malnati's Pizzeria a 2 star rating, with extra salt. Expecations were high going here as there are other deep dish options that my group could have tried on our visit to Chicago, but Lou Malnati's ended up being our pick based on market research. Based on circumstances beyond our control, we had a limited amount of time to eat our Lou Malnati's pies before we had to depart to a latter time-sensitive engagement. Knowing this, we called Lou's at around 6:15pm to inform them, we'd likely be arriving around 7pm and it would be in our best interests if our pies were ready at that point, if possible, since we had an engagement at 8pm. If this was not possible, we would have moved on with our lives. Lou's said this was more than possible and that the pies would be ready. Getting them to go was an option, but the employee on the phone assured us that dine-in would be a smooth process in our time range. Arriving at 7pm, as stated, we informed them of our arrival, obviously, expecting a table. Long story short, we got a table at around 7:30pm and didn't get our first of two pizzas until 7:45pm. We had told them to just make them to go at that point but the first pizza didn't get the message. We ended up eating the entire first pizza in 5-7 minutes since we had to hustle to get to our 8pm destination.The servers were pretty annoyed at us since we asked about the ETA of our pizzas a few times and eventually got one of the pies to-go. Had to get up and walk around to find a new server after our old server started avoiding us. We were annoying customers that day and I understand the grind of server life but given the circumstances our group was heated. I don't even remember what the first pizza tasted like. I imagine it was good. The second pizza that we ate once we got home was quite good after being reheated in the oven. I'm sure Lou's is a great establishment, given its enduring popularity and other reviews, so maybe I'll give it another chance, but gotta call it like I see it.

22.description: Never liked deep dish until I came here when I visited Chicago. Ah-mazing! I haven't had better deep dish. The wings were delicious too! I crave this place sometimes.

15.description: Let me start off by saying: I don't even like pizza.Ever since I left Chicago, I've been wanting to go back just to eat here again.. My wife thinks I'm crazy because I normally don't enjoy pizza but after trying the deep dish here, I'm think I'm in love.We ended up here as a part of the chicago food tour (you should def do this too) and I'm super glad we did. I've actually heard about this restaurant from multiple people who have visited Chicago before and I've been told that this place will make you look at pizza differently! My wife and I ordered some wings, a salad, and their deep dish -- it was probably the most memorable meal we had in Chicago.. (And yes, we did go to all the recommended places like Purple Pig, Tengo Sur, etc)If you go to Chicago and don't eat here, you definitely are missing out!

57.description: Lou Malnati's (attempt at a sly reference to the 'illuminati'?) is hardly illuminating.  Like several restaurants, Malnati's takes otherwise authentically powerful elements and turns them into something functional and institutional.  It's sort of like Saddam Hussein's sword sharpener: it gets the job done, but do you really want it to get the job done?  Malnati's has craft beer ("craft" = unimaginative but hey at least its not just Miller Lite, but you're going to pay nearly $6 for a pint), Chicago style pizza, and post-industrial architecture and smashes it into something that will appeal to some people but be completely lacking in soul.  The bruschetta was great but their supposed piece-de-resistance (Malnati's Chicago Classic = cheese, tomato sauce, and sausage) fell flat.  The sausage was nice. Who could screw up something with that much cheese?  The crust tasted like a stiff Bisquick Pancake.

20.description: This is a Chicago must! I've come here every time I've been to the city and will keep coming back! Excellent!

36.description: Simply the best deep dish and chicken club salad around. Get it with low fat cheese. Even between that way!

14.description: Want to experience authentic Chicago pizza?  This is your place.  This location is one of the larger than others in the area, however the wait list can still range from 30-45 minutes.  Don't bother with some thin crust..go for the gusto with the deep dish.  It's freshly made to order and you won't be disappointed.  The staff is friendly and catering to everything you need.  Hands down, it's one of the best pies in town. Parking: I got nothing... I use uber! If you're staying within the magnificent mile.. you can walk here.

58.description: I decide to try them out with a Groupon I saw. Glad I bought two!  Wow!  What a great experience. Gaby was great!  Full 90 minutes. She concentrated in problem areas we discussed before starting. It was a steal of a deal for a massage like that good downtown. Take advantage of the steam shower afterwards for sure!

56.description: My husband and I came here on Sunday for 90 minute massages.  They had a deal on their mailing list (join that, it's free and they have some great deals) for a 90 minute massage for $60.  The staff was very polite and friendly.  The place was really serene and not at all pretentious.When we arrive on Sunday they asked if we wanted to be in the same room and if we had a preference for a male or female masseuse.  Our room was very nice, and it was very quiet.  Our masseuses were very good.  We were both very pleased afterwards.  They were both great and professional.  Our massage lasted the full 90 minutes (I hate when places take 10 minutes off without telling you).Afterwards they led us towards the steam shower.  That shower is awesome!  I wish I had one at home.I was very impressed with this place.  It was a great value.  I plan to return.

29.description: soo glad to be back to Chicago. first stop is to get a 50 min massage after long week of work. Since this place is walking distance from where I live, I decided to give it a try and Lynn, my massage therapist did not disappoint. She asked me which part of my body would I like to be focused on, and which part I did not wanted to be massaged. Real professional. I enjoyed my steam shower after the massage. The only disappointment is the generic/bad shampoo and conditioner. For the price of $50 for 50 min, you really can't complain about the bad products I guess. My only gripe about this place is their cash only for tip policy.

42.description: I wasn't impressed with the heavenly massage in Morton grove so I decided to give this location a try. I had a gift card and was in desperate need of a massage.  My massage therapist, Martha, was really nice and the massage was amazing. She asked me a bunch of questions before we started on what I would like/not like. I definitely will come back again.

23.description: MOST PAINFUL MASSAGE EVER!!!!Bed ridden today with aches all over my back so tender to the touch that when my boyfriend puts his hand on my back I shriek with pain!!!Anyways, we had the 90 min groupon and I walked in there with no problem areas and walked out with little aches from all the weird elbowing she did into my back. We had Shela and Kristina I believe. As the day went on our pains started to get worse and I kept telling my boyfriend (it was his first massage) how sorry I am for trying to do something nice and it turned out to be completely horrible and painful for both of us. My back is a lot worse than his and It hurts to sit back, lay down, or even touch my back. When I expressed discomfort to my masseuse she kept whispering to just relax. I wish I read Mark D. And Anne M.'s reviews it seems like we all got effed over. STAY AWAY!!!!

47.description: We had a 90 minute couples massage this morning. We both left disappointed after what I'd describe as more of a rub down than a real massage. I don't know if they were brand new or untrained, but it was sub par. I could even hear my masseuse giggling several times. I'm not sure what was so humorous, but I definitely did not completely relax. The steam shower was the best part. I suggest avoiding this place.

8.description: I have been here multiple time for Swedish massages and plan to continue coming here in the future. Heavenly Massage is a clean and nice facility and has some extra touches that give it that Spa ambiance. The reception and spa staff are all friendly and do a great job. I recommend joining their e-mail club for special deals which can help make services more affordable.

31.description: I've had the most unpleasant experience here this evening. I went for a massage hoping to have a relaxing experience, as everyone does. I've had a very disrespectful treatment by the masseuse here. I am sure other therapists are professional and nice, but the therapist who got assigned to me, Lana, was very very rude. I asked her to adjust the pressure a couple times for a deep tissue and she just got impatient and angry with me. When I told her that she was ruining my experience there, she misunderstood and said that she had 15 years of experience. I clarified again that I wasn't doubting her experience, but I was just saying that she was making my experience there unpleasant by getting angry and impatient for no reason. She got extremely confrontational! I told her I couldn't have her work on me if she was going to emit angry, negative energy like that. She just stomped out. I was shocked cause in my experience of getting massages anywhere, therapists were gentle, as they should be. But this therapist, Lana, was oblivious and insensitive. As I said, I am sure other therapists here are fine, I haven't experienced them first hand, but to say that this experience was unpleasant, would be an understatement. It was very disrespectful! It was a waste of time and parking $ for me.  Heavenly massage should teach their therapists some courtesy as well as social skills and instill in them a pleasant nature. Thanks again for the worst massage experience ever.8/18/2014 - Update this morning. I have bruises on my upper back from my 15 minute experience with this therapist, Lana. And she got angry with me for asking to adjust. Coming to think of it, I am actually doubting her experience. Because once she had ushered me into the room, she did not bother asking me about my concerns, problem areas or level of pressure. Heavenly massage, please do not let any other of your customers have this kind of an experience.

34.description: Very professional and clean. I initially started going due to a Groupon for a massage I bought. I have since been back on a bi-weekly basis for mani-pedis and massages. The only thing I would suggest for improvement would be customer recognition for  frequent customers.

16.description: This was my first massage EVER and I'm so glad it was here! I'm actually visiting from LA and wanted a massage because I was so tense (in LA, we don't walk this much!) I found this place on GroupOn, and it was such a great deal! It was $60 for 1.5 hours, which is AMAZING. Normally it's $120.Gaby (Gabby?) was the one who gave me a massage and ah I loved it! She was also extremely friendly. So so glad she made my first experience so great and wanting to go back! The only reason I gave it 4 was because I've only came here once. Can't wait to get another massage and hopefully it'll be as good as this time!!

13.description: soo glad to be back to Chicago. first stop is to get a 50 min massage after long week of work. Since this place is walking distance from where I live, I decided to give it a try and Lynn, my massage therapist did not disappoint. She asked me which part of my body would I like to be focused on, and which part I did not wanted to be massaged. Real professional. I enjoyed my steam shower after the massage. The only disappointment is the generic/bad shampoo and conditioner. For the price of $50 for 50 min, you really can't complain about the bad products I guess. My only gripe about this place is their cash only for tip policy.

11.description: MOST PAINFUL MASSAGE EVER!!!!Bed ridden today with aches all over my back so tender to the touch that when my boyfriend puts his hand on my back I shriek with pain!!!Anyways, we had the 90 min groupon and I walked in there with no problem areas and walked out with little aches from all the weird elbowing she did into my back. We had Shela and Kristina I believe. As the day went on our pains started to get worse and I kept telling my boyfriend (it was his first massage) how sorry I am for trying to do something nice and it turned out to be completely horrible and painful for both of us. My back is a lot worse than his and It hurts to sit back, lay down, or even touch my back. When I expressed discomfort to my masseuse she kept whispering to just relax. I wish I read Mark D. And Anne M.'s reviews it seems like we all got effed over. STAY AWAY!!!!

39.description: I'll start by saying the place seemed really clean and the front desk staff were nice and offered me a drink as soon as I got there. My massage however, was horrible. Worst massage I have ever gotten. My massage therapist was nice but I was supposed to get a deep tissue massage and she used the lightest strokes possible. I pretty much got a gentle rub down with no massage, even after speaking up and asking for more pressure. The worst part was after rubbing down my back she would literally caress her fingertips back up to the top. Awful and creepy.

37.description: My 5 stars are for VICKA! I go there for mani/pedi only because she is there and she is  fantastic! Not only she is the best and my mani/pedi is always perfect, but she is also very friendly and kind and treat me VIP! HM is super lucky to have her!!!

0.description: Great location to have a great massage, I almost missed it since the hallway was narrow and had to walk up a flight of stairs. Once up there, I saw a little lobby area with pitchers of iced water to hydrate you before a session. The receptionist was very polite and before I can finish taking off my jacket, my room was ready. The massage therapist "Fanny" was very polite and asked how much pressure I wanted and in what areas. I went with hard which I later learned that hard was the "elbow" massage and mention to Fanny that "Medium" is preferred "Hand" massage. Towards the end, she asked me if I wanted a steam or hot towel, I choose the steam and was told to head to a steam shower. Overall I enjoyed my time with Heavenly Massage and will go there again.

38.description: I went to Heavenly Massage on North State for the first time today and was so pleasantly surprised. It is probably the nicest nail salon I've seen in Chicago. I haven't tried the really fancy ones in hotels and such, but just several of the nail salons scattered throughout the Gold Coast. Anyway, this place has wonderful massage chairs that all seem to work, unlike some other places. They seemed brand new! Not crowded. And for $20 first time pedicure, quite a bargain. Even the regular price of $33.00 is not expensive. Irina did my pedicure and I was totally satisfied. She was really nice, as was everyone there! Can't wait to return.

51.description: Okay so I come here to get a deep tissue massage and it was horrible. I was so upset that I just paid all this money for this terrible massage. I had never had a deep tissue massage before so I was a little nervous about it but the pressure she gave me was less then I get when I have done a regular massage. Secondly I understand its winter in Chicago and it gets cold but I shouldn't be so cold in the room that it is the only thing I could think about. When I said I was cold she left the room went and got a space heater and turned it on and it made the most annoying noise ever. There went my relaxation for the 90 min. I wish I could find a decent place in Chicago to get a massage that doesn't cost a fortune.

27.description: MUST READ!!!  My massage left me bed ridden for two days. And discomfort for over a week.  (This is not an exaggeration) Recently my girlfriend and I received a couples massage.  Although this location appeared nice and professional.  My masseuse insisted on working the same muscle on my back for over 25mins of a full body massage.  I had to insist that she finally move on already.  The next day I was unable to turn my head to the right and unable to stand up.  After two days of my inability to move without experiencing a great deal of pain, I visited a chiropractor that confirmed the significant strain and bruising.  Note that I am a 200lb grown man that is in decent shape and routinely get massages.  I tried to do the polite thing by bringing this to the attention of this location and not having to write this review.  I explained that I am not looking for a refund or free massage, but to just make them aware.  The lady with the accent that I had spoken with was very pompous.  Would not let me explain what happened without cutting me off three different times with comments like, "It happens"  Yes, that was her exact words!  My call was to inform them of the incident and to see if the masseuse recalls anything that went wrong.  I was told that someone would get back to me.  Of course no one did.  So at the end of the day, instead of paying $50 for a massage to help me relax.  It cost me roughly $200 and two days of missed work to feel pain for a full week.  There are plenty of spas to get massages in this city.  Take my advise and stay away from this one!

32.description: I always get nice, pleasant service in a clean environment. I get very good pedicures here. The people don't gossip, it's not an Asian chop shop for nails. It's clean, respectable and in a great location. I also get massages here, and think they are more than decent. If you haven't been, try them. Excellent deal for the price!

54.description: Ahhh-mazing!Loved it!I had a 90 min. deep tissue massage with Gema and it was really good. Most deep tissue massages hurt too much and I end up chickening out and staying with a swedish. But Gema is such a pro, she warmed up my muscles, asked me questions, checked in a few times, she was very professional and absolutely knew what she was doing. I was offered a robe and sandals at the end for a steam shower afterwards and it was lovely. No rush, plenty of useful amenities in the private shower rooms. Front desk was very friendly from start to end always offering me water. The space is really nice. I will definitely be back.

48.description: I was very pleasantly surprised by this place!  Although they seems to offer a lot of promotions and Groupons, the quality is still there.  The rooms are on the second floor, so you don't have to worry about street noise even though it is on a busy street.  My masseuse (Isa) made me feel at ease and asked if I had any problem areas, cuts, or aversion to her touching my face or neck.  She also told me to undress as much as I felt comfortable.  I thought that was a nice touch and showed how they care about making their patrons feel comfortable.  The massage was great- perfect pressure, length, and portions of my body covered.  When it was over, I was offered a steam shower or hot towels to remove the oil.  At their great prices, I would love to return. Also- I had no problems booking with my Groupon.  I was even able to reschedule without issues, although it was for a weekday.

44.description: Uh, do people here even have certifications to be a licensed masseuse? I won't name names but I was extremely disappointed in lack of professionalism.

24.description: Don't go here for a relaxing massage or if you want a good facial. I have never written a review before now but it was that bad. I had a manicure pedicure before my massage/facial. The massage therapist brought me back to the room before my nails were dry. When I said I needed more time he acted annoyed. The massage was awful and awkward. Opposite of relaxing. When I would move around he got annoyed and asked if it was him making me uncomfortable, which it wasn't till he said that and then yeah it was. He had no rhythm. It was bumpy and awkward and not the least bit relaxing. At the end he just sat with my head in his hands for 20 mins barely moving. Uncomfortable to say the least. After my massage I told him I had a facial as well. He didn't pick up the box they had me put my clothes in or escort me out. I had to carry the box out and then awkwardly stand there while figuring out where to go. Then I saw him after stumbling around and said where do I go. He replied "Uhhh back where you came from" - rude! He pointed me to a room where a girl greeted me. She wasn't much better. The facial felt like it was 30 mins and it was not great. She barely extracted my skin. I have had facials before and my skin normally feels replenished. I could have done what she did. There was absolutely no customer service. No one tried at all to make that a comforting experience. She abruptly ended the facial and just said - nice meeting you and walked away.DO NOT go here if you want a nice relaxing day. Plenty of other great spas in the city!
