Anywhere else they would be kicking and rushing you out! Not here. Even when my friend & I got up to leave they encouraged us to relax and assured us we did not have to leave.Not to mention my nails look amazing. I am always hesitant to get manicures because they normally last about 2-3 days.... but this, I have had it on for a day BUT I've been packing up my entire apartment, scrubbing the shower/entire bathroom with bleach with no gloves, and my manicure is perfectly intact.

0.description: Vickie's  was bought and the new owner emailed me and asked me to give them another chance so I did today.  It's not even the same place.  Everything is brand new, new nail techs and old ones.  The atmosphere was light and friendly, employees laughing and smiling.  I got a fill with no chip and a pedicure with no chip. Both were done professionally and look amazing.  The new owner was there and talked to me quite a bit.  I will definitely go back.

20.description: This place is quite reasonable ($35 for a mani-pedi) and the location is convenient.  It is clean  and spacious, and the woman who did my nails did a great job.  They could work on the customer service though--no one helped me with my shoes, or coat, or said good bye as I left.

19.description: Best customer service at a nail salon. I arrived for my appt and they were full.Instead of asking me to wait Kevin found me a spot to tend to meAnd prep for my nails.After I got to a both I realized it was taking longer than I thought,So another girl jumped in to help. 2 people working on MeBecause I was in a hurry. Wonderful. I  couldn't have felt betterTaken care of. Clean, kind, attentive. And did my nails exactly as I wished,And I'm a tough customer. thank you Kevin and all thatHelped, ill be back every time!

2.description: This is my new go to nail salon. The store has undergone a complete makeover since the new owner took over last fall. Mike (the owner) is always there to greet and chat with the customers. The staff is so attentive and friendly. Summer is my favorite tech but everyone is good (rare in a nail salon). The receptionist is really good with color selections and always offer bottled water or hot tea. This place is also BYOB. Win! I love this place!

18.description: The first time I went here, I just went for a pedicure and honestly for me you can't screw a pedi up unless something crazy happens, like they rip my toenail off or something. So I'm not picky when it comes to those. About a week later I took my mom back for a late mother's day get together and it was a pretty weird experience. I got a no-chip mani, and she got a pedi. She was picky about the flower they put on her toe, but it was actually cute. The girl who was doing her toes was like not all there, she barely understood English and didn't understand which pedi she actually wanted. I had my nails done by Summer, and the nail polish brand (Daisy) and color (Natural Blush) was bad. I don't know if the color itself was old, or if it was the brand but she kept putting more layers on to get rid of the bumps that kept forming and in the end I walked out with nails that looked fake.... which isn't necessarily a bad thing.We also waited a million years to pay because they didn't have enough people working? I woke up the next day and my thumb had started to peel away and the bumps were grossing me out, so I headed back over today and I was worried they wouldn't understand what I was telling them but it went really well. I showed them what happened and they took me right away and Ray re-did my nails. He did a really great job and I think when I do go back to this place I'll only be going to him from now on. Thanks for correcting the mistake guys!

13.description: Ray, is amazing, he is the only person I will let do my acrylics! Would highly suggest giving him a try.

4.description: I was in Chicago for the weekend and needed a manicure. Vickie's was closest to my hotel and had the highest ratings on Yelp. I was not disappointed! The salon is clean and everyone is so friendly. I loved my manicure. They have tons of gel colors and it's easy to pick a color. I teased Danny because Ray got all the good reviews. So, next when you come to Vickie's ask for Danny and tell him that Tamara from California sent you.

24.description: I purchased a youswoop for the No chip manicure here so that I could have a fun bonding experience with my sister while she was in town.  First thing, we get to the salon and aren't even seated next to each other when almost the entire salon is empty.  I specifically made the appointment for both of us together and said we wanted our manicures together.  Then, I'm told they messed up my appointment and will be with me in 15 minutes.  After which multiple people walk in and workers went to help them instead.  So after I was finally helped, this man RUSHED through my manicure, it literally took him 20 minutes to do a no chip manicure.  I turn around and see that my sister has not been helped at all in this 30+ minutes since we've been in the salon.  So finally they do her nails and it takes the woman who does her nails about 30 minutes.  Overall, not impressive, but her manicure was better than mine.  At least her entire nail was painted, I had parts of my nails that weren't even painted! Anyway, this all happened this past Thursday.  Flash forward to today, New Years Eve and what do you know? The nails that I expected to still look nice less than a week later have already peeled and look crappy for the expensive party i'm going to.WORST EXPERIENCE EVER.  I would never ever recommend this place to anyone.

6.description: Vickies always delivers! Their service is impeccable and their staff is friendly. Tammy had been doing my nails for the past year and she is the best. Definitely recommend!!

22.description: Vickie's Nails is wonderful!  I go once a week and they are awesome!  Ask for Brian, he does a fantastic job!  I will continue to be a repeat customer!

15.description: I love love love Vickie's! I had recently moved to Gold Coast and was looking for a reasonably priced nail salon, and that is exactly what this place is.

7.description: My favorite nail salon! Extremely reasonably priced for what they provide. Great service, my gel manis last for 3-4 weeks. They have a good range of colors as well.

8.description: Vickie's is amazing!  I have gone to several nail places in the Gold Coast area and up in Lakeview/Lincoln Park, and this is by far the best place! As soon as you walk in to the salon you feel welcome and comfortable.   The customer service is outstanding, and the new owner Mike cares so much about the customers and making sure they are happy.   They offered coffee/water while I was getting my pedicure, and they did a great job with my no chip manicure and pedicure.  They take their time and do a great job!  I will definitely go back!

30.description: While Vickie's Nails may not be the most high end spot for a mani/pedi, it is excellent value for cost, perfectly acceptable service, convenient and dependable. I have been going back to this little spot over and over for a decade when Vickie still worked there, even though I live in Edgewater, because I cannot find a better more reliable place that will almost always be able to book an appt. for you immediately as a walk-in! My 3 young girls also love going there :) There is another important reason to support Vickie's Nails. Vickie and her husband were victims of an unimaginable hate crime in Rogers Park while their 2 young children were in the car! Their murders have never been solved and while the manager/Vickie's brother may have his on/off days and burn the candle at both ends, he has been helping to raise her orphaned children with his mother and establish education funds ever since this family trauma with proceeds from the nail salon. Please check out Vickie's Nails and ignore the one minority negative review---seems like shanna d. was already having a bad day before she walked in...late.

3.description: Great salon with very friendly staff. The pedicure stations are amazing too - can't get enough of the updated massage chairs!!! I've been going to Danny & Tammy for almost 5 years and when they moved here- I didn't mind! Best salon in the Gold Coast! I live in NYC now, but when I come to Chicago- I always make an appointment :)

14.description: So I've been here a few times over the past couple years and can't remember and problems. However, yesterday I got a mani / pedi around 7pm. I really should have just taken the time at home and don't it myself. My toes aren't bad, but look mediocre. My fingers however, AWFUL! She cut way too deep on three fingers, and my thumb is still throbbing from the chunk of skin missing. I was actively bleeding for a few minutes, which hasn't happened before. I just paid the fee, tipped 20% and left, but I feel they should have offered me a discount. Probably won't go back.

29.description: While they were pretty late to the scheduled appointment, I was completely fine with it because they did an amazing job installing our TV above our fireplace. We live in a 100-year old home with plaster walls, but that didn't seem to phase them at all. They were even willing to do a site survey prior to the installation to discuss our options, considering the limitations of the space, and they were really easy to get in contact with.  When they installed the TV, the technicians were personable and capable, doing the job much quicker than I thought. Definitely go with these guys if you want a TV mounted!

42.description: This company offers what everyone wants: professional, quality work, a professional and friendly staff, and the best price in the city! We just had Besi and Mike W. out to install our new 46 inch Samsung LED and they did a fantastic job. They expertly installed the full motion mount that we purchased ourselves and were quick and efficient. We're very happy w their work. I highly recommend this company!

23.description: Greatest guys to work with! I had a change in my schedule the day of installation and they worked with me to coordinate a time that would work for me the same day. They came prepared with all of their needed equipment and anything they might have thought I didn't have (an extra mount should mine not work...longer HDMI or electric cables should mine not be long enough). They were extremely polite and walked me through exactly what they would be doing and cared about what my expectations were. They did an excellent job mounting the TV as well as cleaning up after themselves. They were very courteous. I was a little nervous working with someone on yelp but they exceeded my expectations and I am very happy I went with HDInstalls.

47.description: We just had these guys install/wall mount our 55" TV. They were professional, polite, clean, worked fast and the best price in the area.  I know next to nothing about mounting a TV so I let my boyfriend handle this task.  He called for installation and these guys came two days later.  They were very friendly when they arrived, arrived on time and were polite (asking if they could move furniture out of the way, asking if it was okay to throw away trash in our bin, bringing their own vacuum with them). The actual TV mounting is perfect.  They hid the cables so well and gave advice on non-TV related issues.  I would definitely recommend these guys to anyone!

8.description: Very professional. Quick, on time. Took them about 30 minutes start to finish. Looks great. Thank you!! Can't beat the service for the price.

31.description: I recently had Michael and team come out to mount a TV on a brick wall.  There were a few scheduling mishaps, but Michael went out of his way to reschedule, keep in contact and let me know what was going on.Sascha and his assistant Kyle got the job done in roughly 20 minutes, made sure everything was working and did a wonderful job cleaning up after.I wouldn't hesitate in recommending them to anyone else who needs similar work.

34.description: My fiance and I have been wanting to mount our 50in TV for a while now. We knew we were incapable of handling such a large project, so thankfully we found HD Installs on Yelp to get the job done! I called HD Installs on a Friday afternoon and they were able to schedule our installation that Saturday between 3-5pm. I called them at 3pm the next day to get a better estimate of when they would be arriving. Mike on the other line told me 4-4:30p. They arrived at 4:15 :) When the arrived they took off their shoes and paid some much needed attention to our dog and introduced themselves to us (they are very friendly). Then they got to work. Within an hour our TV was perfectly mounted to our wall and they had cleaned up whatever mess they made. It looks great and makes the whole room seem bigger now that we do not need a TV stand. It is perfectly centered on the wall at the perfect height! I wish we would have called them sooner. They were timely, polite and thorough with the job. I will be recommending these guys to friends and family in the future!

16.description: I had my 46 inch TV wall mounted on top of my fireplace and HDInstalls did a fantastic job. The price was very reasonable and they clearly explained how to add new cables through the wall as well. I will be going to them when I do my home theatre installation as well.

13.description: I shopped around for someone to mount my tv and do the wiring. First company cancelled on me after making me wait on them all day, thankfully, I found HDINSTALLS after a friend referred them to me. I called spoke with Mike, they were able to come same day. They quoted me over the phone and when they came they actually honored the quote they gave me over the phone. They did the job very efficiently and it looks amazing. I would definitely use them again if I ever need a tv mounted. Very happy with their work

11.description: These guys are great.  They were a little late but very busy...so that's a good thing, their services are in need.    We have an old home so we were told that plaster isn't a good material for mounting our new awesome curved UHD TV but after a moment to check it all out, they knew they could make it happen. And they did.  So we are now cozily watching the Bulls play the Rockets with great satisfaction!  Thanks guys!!    Totally professional and extremely courteous!

39.description: Very happy with their wall mount of my flat screen TV.  Their price was the best I could find looking around.  They had convenient times available for the installation, they were on time, and kept me informed in advance of their estimated time of arrival.  They were professional and friendly.  they did a great job with the installation both in terms of quality and timeliness , and there were no hidden fees.  Couldn't be happier with the service they provided.

37.description: I was so impressed with HDInstalls. My TV looks great and was mounted at half the price of most other places in the area. The guys were accommodating, professional and polite. In addition, they walked me through every part of the process. I highly recommend!

0.description: I had Charles and Mike come install my 70 in tv on the wall at my new place today. They were very accommodating as my movers were running a bit late. Not only did they do a fantastic job they also helped hide the cable wires and installed all the devices I wanted hooked up to my tv.I would suggest these guys to anyone

38.description: Fantastic, professional service.  Just mounted a 55" TV in a space above the fireplace that only had a few inches of space to spare.  The job was completed in under 5 minutes, and they made it look incredibly easy.  Not only that, they hid all of the wires behind the TV with velcro so it looks beautiful!  Can't recommend these guys enough, they can mount anything!

51.description: Did a great job mounting our TV over the fireplace for the price quoted on the phone. Very friendly and considerate of our place.  We were pleased.  Later we had problems with the TV taking a while to turn on.  We weren't sure if it was the power cord since it was behind the wall.  They came out to check, if it was something they did it was free, otherwise they'd find out what was wrong for $45.  It was definitely a problem with the TV - again very please with their service!

27.description: A+++!   Ask for Besi's team.  He was very friendly and did a great job.  He mounted our TV and sound bar above our fireplace.   It looks great!  They did a great job of hiding all the wires as well.  We are very pleased on how everything turned out.   We would definitely recommend to anyone and would use again in the future.

32.description: One word: AMAZING! Stefan and Aki (not sure spelling on both names) came by this past Friday to mount a 60 inch TV.  They were on-time, polite, took off their shoes before entering my home and quick and efficient.  They did a great job mounting my TV and I will recommend HDInstalls to all my family and friends.  When on Yelp, you'll notice a ton of different options for having your TV mounted, go with these guys, I comparison shopped before choosing them and am glad that I did - they are fairly priced and do a wonderful job.

54.description: I recently purchased a 60inch plasma tv...I was skeptical about the price on the installation and decided to search elsewhere..I searched on GOOGLE for HDINSTALLS.COM and called for a quote. Not only did they give me the most affordable price but they also included a FREE mount!! I went ahead and scheduled an appointment and these guys did an exceptional job!!! My expectations were definitely precise on how I wanted my install done! Thank you so much for the great job!! I highly recommend them and will definitely call again for my next service.

48.description: This is an unlicensed company, I asked the installer that was quoting me on a camera system for a PERC card and one was not held. This is a must in IL and it shows that they have had a criminal background check, know who is installing your security hire a Licensed Private Alarm Contractor.

44.description: Having seen these guys in action at my office and hearing about their great work at a co-worker's home, I couldn't wait to hire them for my home project. They arrived promptly in their appointment window ready to work and get the project done quickly.I had a 50" TV to hang above my fireplace and a 32" to float on the bedroom wall. Both required cords to run inside the walls for the TV, satellite boxes, Apple TV, & the Blu Ray. They allowed me to pick from a flush-mount, tilt, or full-motion bracket (I picked full motion) for each television and confirmed locations and height for hanging. After they finished, they vacuumed all drilling or wall dust from all surfaces.One family member was astounded how discreet the wiring is now, tucked away neatly and very professional up close and from the sofa or bed. I am not only pleased with the final product, but also with how courteous the workers are.In my opinion they have a standard and FAIR pricing model that includes a cost per 1. installed item, 2. needed hardware or mount brackets, and 3. needed cords (e.g. extra extension cord or HDMI if you don't have any on hand). The team even emailed my receipt within seconds. Anyone who wants to mount or update their entertainment systems should definitely call HD Installs.

24.description: Awesome job!!  Earlier today, Michael and Emil installed a 65" above our fireplace and 32" in the bedroom.  Both installs look amazing!  Stefan stopped by on Tuesday and gave me a quote for the job that was very reasonable vs. other estimates. Both TVs were installed on Friday of the same week.  These guys went above and beyond.  All wires are neat and concealed.  I had some extra speaker wires hanging from a wall outlet....no problem, they tucked them away and put a cover on it for me.  They clean up everything when finished.  Michael answered several electrical and electronic questions for me. There were no extra charges and I paid the quoted price.  If you need a flat screen mounted, call these guys!!

7.description: Awesome! They were super nice, cleaned up the mess from drilling into wall, and device at a price you can't beat!

49.description: I'm a do-it-yourself guy (most of the time)... But there are a few things in life I've learned you're better off calling in the Pros.1. Defending yourself in Court2. Tattooing3. Any kind of medical procedure4. Oral Surgery5. HD TV Installation (when you don't want any wires showing).I called them early in the morning... Voice mail was full, but I persisted and sent an email. My request was a little unrealistic, I wanted my brand new Samsung SmartTV hung that day, wall-mounted, and no cables showing. I figured at the very least, I would need to wait a few days to get placed on the calendar...Within a few hours, I had a phone call reply and a very professional, knowledgeable guy on the line. He asked a few questions, and promised to get the install done today, if I was okay having it done at 6PM.These guys are like Surgeons... they have every piece of installation equipment imaginable. They are meticulous in their work, super clean (concerned with any dust they may have caused) and even bring their own mini vacuum to the job site to make sure they leave no trace of their presence (that is, except for the flawlessly installed HD LED TV now hanging in my home).They even took care of things they had no need to do contractually:1. Move my Ethernet cable from the floor level jack, up to behind the TV (while staying inside the wall... "no problem they said"2. Add some screws to a loose shelf that sat above my TV... "no problem they said"3. Carry out the trash and take it all the way to the dumpster for me (even when I said I would do it later)... "we got it, don't worry"All the while, they worked quickly and professionally... these guys are goodhearted too... you can tell they've been working together a long time, and they enjoy it. Very personable, friendly, service with a smile (and an occasional joke thrown in for free)...I researched prices before choosing them and not only were they accommodating of my time needs, they were the best priced service! All the pricing is on their website - so there's no surprises or cheap sales tactics when they arrive to do the work.I would highly suggest going to them for all of your Home Theater or TV Installation needs. These are local guys with a local business who are trying to make ends meet! If you support local, SUPPORT THESE GUYS!

40.description: These guys made my dreams come true.  I recently bought my first condo and after scrimping and saving and squirreling money away for months, we finally got in our place and our first purchase was a 60in plasma for the living room.  But that thing needed to be mounted.  I'm a handy lady, but not THAT handy.  One call to these guys and I made the appointment for that same evening. It took them a little while to get to my place, but I made the appointment pretty last minute, so I cut them some slack.  When they arrived,  they had the TV up on the wall in 20 minutes with all of the cables and cords behind the drywall.  They even took the time to rerun the HDMI cable when they discovered that the one I gave them to use wasn't working. Great investment. Football season this year will be epic.

53.description: We recently used hdinstalls.com to wall mount 3 TVs in our new home, as well as to install new in-ceiling surround sound speakers.  We couldn't have been happier with the work that Stefan and Mike did, and definitely could not have found better pricing!  I would highly recommend hdinstalls.com to anyone.  They really know their business and take pride in making sure everything looks amazing and that their customers are truly happy with the end result.

30.description: These guys are great.  They were a little late but very busy...so that's a good thing, their services are in need.    We have an old home so we were told that plaster isn't a good material for mounting our new awesome curved UHD TV but after a moment to check it all out, they knew they could make it happen. And they did.  So we are now cozily watching the Bulls play the Rockets with great satisfaction!  Thanks guys!!    Totally professional and extremely courteous!

46.description: HD Installs did a great job mounting our 32 inch television in the master bedroom.  They were quick, clean, polite and helpful.We had a scheduling mishap that caused the install to be two days late, but Stefan was extremely apologetic, offered a discount for my trouble, and came out on Sunday to take care of the job.  This is the first TV I've had mounted in my home but I'm sure I'll have more in the future and will likely use HDInstalls again.

1.description: I found this place through searching yelp and chose them because of all of the reviews here - they lived up to them for sure.Michael and Stefan came to install a 60" LCD above our living room fireplace and a 32" LCD in our bedroom on 11/14.  They were on time and got the work done!  Bedroom was simple but the living room was a bit tricky due to difficulty in snaking so many wires through the wall.  They eventually were able to get it through and it came out beautifully!  Five stars for going above and beyond, including taking apart my bracket and customizing it to work with our setup.  Great job guys and thank you.

9.description: We hired HD Installs to mount 3 tvs for us. The installers were so professional and neat. They unpacked the tvs and then cleaned up after themselves. They were friendly and respectful. We would definitely hire them again. In fact, we are hiring them to install our 3-shelf shelving unit this week.,

26.description: I had a very pleasant free consultation with Besi, who discussed various options regarding my 60 inch TV.  He noted that given my walls (with aluminum studs) and the weight of my TV (120 lbs), there would be some extra work involved if I wanted a fully articulating mount..  However, I did not get the impression that Besi was trying to 'upsell' or anything like that;  instead, he was offering a candid assessment based on his expertise.  He also suggested some simpler alternatives that would be easier to complete.Besi was also familiar with all issues of home construction and I bounced some ideas off of him regarding enclosing my den, about which he was very knowledgeable and promised to follow-up with some good contacts.In short, I am very pleased that I came across HDInstalls.  Besi is a consummate professional and he inspires confidence that he will get the job done correctly.  I'm looking forward to completing projects with HDInstalls.  5 stars.

25.description: After some initial issues with scheduling, the technicians and office staff were helpful.  Technician worked through some issues with the wall I wanted to the tv mounted to and worked quickly and cleanly.

12.description: Great guys, know what they are doing.

21.description: The guys from HDInstalls saved me, several times! I am so grateful for their expertise and dedication in their line of work! Even though I only had a small project for them (installing a microphone system at a fitness studio) they came back three times to assist me with complications! I highly recommend HDInstalls for any electronic installation needs or issues you might have! They will not disappoint you!

17.description: I had a very pleasant free consultation with Besi, who discussed various options regarding my 60 inch TV.  He noted that given my walls (with aluminum studs) and the weight of my TV (120 lbs), there would be some extra work involved if I wanted a fully articulating mount..  However, I did not get the impression that Besi was trying to 'upsell' or anything like that;  instead, he was offering a candid assessment based on his expertise.  He also suggested some simpler alternatives that would be easier to complete.Besi was also familiar with all issues of home construction and I bounced some ideas off of him regarding enclosing my den, about which he was very knowledgeable and promised to follow-up with some good contacts.In short, I am very pleased that I came across HDInstalls.  Besi is a consummate professional and he inspires confidence that he will get the job done correctly.  I'm looking forward to completing projects with HDInstalls.  5 stars.

10.description: Michael is the best!! Made an appointment and within a day they were in front of my door ready to install my new tv. Their customer service is outstanding! Installation was quick and very professional. My TV looks great on my wall! I will be calling them again very soon.

5.description: Very happy with the installation of my new TV! HDInstalls were on time, professional, knowledgeable, and got the job done very quickly. The price was very reasonable.I would definitely recommend their services!

3.description: HD Install has great service !!! Charlie and Michael came to help on TV and sound bar wall mounting. They worked into detail to make sure TV was level correctly and connected to my 5.1 sound bar system. They also ran several tests on TV/ Subwoofer/ rear speakers to confirm everything was functioning. After that, they cleaned up all the dusts from my carpet. Thank you, Charlie and Mike !

35.description: These guys are awesome. I called after an "installer" I found from craigslist wanted to nickle and dime me for everything. I had to stop the previous guy and called HDinstalls if they could come through same day. And they did! They were very friendly and professional. They mounted my TV over the fireplace, hid the cables and installed plates on the wall where the cables were coming out. They cleaned up afterwards and made sure it was to my liking. I will use them again. Their prices are great and very upfront. No hidden charges.

19.description: Fantastic installers. Great attitude and workmanship. Remember to be prepared with the right length cables --- HDMI, optical, coaxial, whatever else is needed for your job --- and you won't be disappointed. I highly recommend these guys and would hire them again for future installations.

28.description: After posting my 2 star review of HDInstalls last week I received a call from the owner who was very concerned and apologized for the poor service I received, which I thought was very nice.He then proceeded to offer me $100 if I offered to take the review down. I told him I'd think about it and call him back. We really trust the reviews on Yelp, and we're also shareholders so I felt that while an extra $100 would be great, it would really undermine the benefits of Yelp which we constantly rely on. I opted not to call them back.Since then I've been contacted via SMS multiple times, again offering me money to remove the post and then most recently I was notified they'd be filing a defamation/libel lawsuit for $55k in damages. The image of our SMS conversation to-date can be found here: dl.dropboxusercontent.co…I don't doubt the owner truly cares about the reputation of his business, but paying or threatening people to take down a poor review is not a great sign.Like my original review said, if you feel like using these guys please just make sure you ask for your quote to include performing the installation up to code and ask them to be on time. And if you purchase RedMere HDMI cables for them to use you might just want to label which ends go to the TV and which one goes to your device just in case they don't know.

45.description: I just used these guys to mount my 42" TV above my fireplace.  They did a great job!  I made the appointment on Tuesday and they were able to come Thursday evening.  They even accommodated late hours as I had mentioned I don't get home from work until after 7pm.  They were polite, professional and even asked my opinion about positioning and placement and helped give recommendations.  Like the other reviews mentioned, they bring all of their own tools and even their own vacuum. They were definitely a lower price compared to the other places I had called.  The job was very well done and they were able to hide the cords behind the walls.  I would highly recommend these guys.

33.description: Michael was great, came in on time  for a speedy install, brought his own shop vac to clean up after, TV was leveled, what more can you ask? Highly recommended

43.description: They were an hour late, But it was done quickly and neat plus they had the best price. The two guys were friendly cracked some jokes while working. I had a 60in mounted with hidden wires and they connected my gaming consoles, cable box and blue-ray player even showed me the features on my tv. Happy with the finished product. Will call again for future installations.

2.description: I had Stefan and Michael in today to install a TV monitor in our office conference room. We ordered the service to be completed through Amazon Home Services and I am incredibly thankful that it turned out the way it did! These two guys came in, were friendly, quick, and professional. They made sure to ask where I wanted the monitor to be located ("is it important to be centered with the conference table or the credenza?), how high would we prefer it to be mounted, how do you want the cables set up, etc. They made quick work about the set up and actual install. The mounting job looks amazing and very much more professional than it did sitting on top of the credenza in its TV stand. Once their work was done, they asked if I wanted to inspect their work. Everything checked out. They even showed me how to use the "blue paws" to pop the TV out if we ever needed to. There couldn't have been two nicer, friendlier, more efficient gentleman that came to install our TV today. I'm so thankful that the Amazon Home Services worked out this well!!Shout out to the woman (I think her name is Monique?) who fielded my questions when I called her at HD Installs to reschedule our first scheduled appointment. They didn't know that we were a place of business, so when I let her know that an install after 5 PM on a weekday, nor would a weekend install be acceptable, she was very flexible and accommodating. She even called again this morning to confirm that the install was going to happen. She is the sweetest, seriously. Give these people your business. They're awesome!!!

18.description: After posting my 2 star review of HDInstalls last week I received a call from the owner who was very concerned and apologized for the poor service I received, which I thought was very nice.He then proceeded to offer me $100 if I offered to take the review down. I told him I'd think about it and call him back. We really trust the reviews on Yelp, and we're also shareholders so I felt that while an extra $100 would be great, it would really undermine the benefits of Yelp which we constantly rely on. I opted not to call them back.Since then I've been contacted via SMS multiple times, again offering me money to remove the post and then most recently I was notified they'd be filing a defamation/libel lawsuit for $55k in damages. The image of our SMS conversation to-date can be found here: dl.dropboxusercontent.co…I don't doubt the owner truly cares about the reputation of his business, but paying or threatening people to take down a poor review is not a great sign.Like my original review said, if you feel like using these guys please just make sure you ask for your quote to include performing the installation up to code and ask them to be on time. And if you purchase RedMere HDMI cables for them to use you might just want to label which ends go to the TV and which one goes to your device just in case they don't know.

41.description: Besi Adovich from HDInstall - Is the guy if you wanna wall mount your TV. He did an excellent job. Extremely smart and helpful. Knows his stuff very well. Thanks HDInstall you guys did a great.I recommend them to anyone. Again Thanks Guys for your helpDM

52.description: These guys are great.  They came in on short notice and installed 3 TV's.  Two above my fireplace and 1 in my bedroom.  The house was not wired for the TV's to hang up on the walls and they did an excellent job, cleaned up their mess and offered additional help after the cable company came out.  They ran 2 HDMI's on each of the 3 TV's and you would think the house was built this way.  The cable installer even commented when he came out what a great job they did!  Will use them in the future.  Highly Recommended.

50.description: Stephen and Mike did an amazing job. They were so professional and super friendly. They gave me a quote and the very next day they mounted my 60' TV in under an hour.  I was unsure if i wanted 1 or 2 HDMI cables hid behind the wall so they told me theyd come back if i ever changed my mind and wanted to add more free of charge. These guys are great, you'll be very pleased with their service!

4.description: I had to update my review because damit because I felt like it. I moved into a new condo and didn't even hesitate calling these guys! When i moved in and looked at my TV I called HDinstalls without hesitation! They flawlessly installed a 70" tv of mine last year, which btw I've received millions of great comments on!!!Again, they showed up on time and got the job done. These guys don't waste your time with stupid unnecessary small talk LOL they come in and literally get the job done right away. These guys have x-ray vision LOL they are human stud finders! My Tv looks amazing on my wall! Their prices are amazing and by me actually updating my review should let you know that they do quality work! I usually don't waste my time coming back and writing another review.If you want a flawless install of your TV call these guys! You will not be disappointed.

6.description: Theys guys are awsome, they were on time time proficient & did a outstanding job. Definitely would give them a 10 out of 10 & would highly recommend them

22.description: Before I call a business, I check Yelp!I called HD Installs and they returned my call less than 24 hours later.Someone came out to my office right away. The gentleman told me I should receive a few estimates by email within 48 hours. The next day I received 3 estimates. I choose the one that fit our needs and budget. We then scheduled a time for the install. That day arrived and the gentleman came around the time we agreed to. Two gentleman got to work right away. They were very friendly and answered all my questions. After the install they explained how to use the DVR and told us that if we needed anything we could call them. That was about a month ago. So far, so good. Now, I am going to call them for home. Thanks HD Installs!

15.description: Before I call a business, I check Yelp!I called HD Installs and they returned my call less than 24 hours later.Someone came out to my office right away. The gentleman told me I should receive a few estimates by email within 48 hours. The next day I received 3 estimates. I choose the one that fit our needs and budget. We then scheduled a time for the install. That day arrived and the gentleman came around the time we agreed to. Two gentleman got to work right away. They were very friendly and answered all my questions. After the install they explained how to use the DVR and told us that if we needed anything we could call them. That was about a month ago. So far, so good. Now, I am going to call them for home. Thanks HD Installs!

20.description: Fantastic installers. Great attitude and workmanship. Remember to be prepared with the right length cables --- HDMI, optical, coaxial, whatever else is needed for your job --- and you won't be disappointed. I highly recommend these guys and would hire them again for future installations.

36.description: Need a TV mounted? Don't hesitate in giving these guys a call!We had scheduled an appointment in about a day, unfortunately they were not able to make it the first night BUT they did make it the next day. They were in constant communication during the process as well. Both installation specialists used the equipment I had previously bought, and figured out the best method to mounting. Asked about our preference on height as well. They not only made a clean install but also cleaned up after they finished as well. Our living room is now complete, and it looks great! Well worth the price. They also will do wiring as well if you need that.

14.description: Alright, so now I kind of feel bad about my original review... not only did they contact me immediately after posting my initial review to see what they could do, they came out to make it right and were extremely nice about it.The TV looks great and the whole team at HD Installs took great care to make sure that the job was done right.. including several trips back to make sure the paint blended perfectly.We'll call my initial experience a fluke.. it happens to the best of us. I have great respect for companies that care enough about their product/service to make it right. And they did more than make it right.. they made it perfect. Thanks guys!

58.description: Rude WaitressCame in with my friends last night and got the BIGGEST attitude from the blonde waitress who was serving the front left section the the right of the host stand(didn't catch her name because she never gave it). She was prompt with the drink orders, but had the biggest attitude the entire time. She rolled her eyes when my friend ordered a second drink. Gave us shit when we needed to split the bill. Seriously, sweetheart, it's simple math and splitting a bill over more than one method of payment is not difficult. Don't take your anger about your shitty life choices to be a waitress out on those who are more successful than yourself.

56.description: Great place!  We were staying a the Waldorf and they recommended Luxbar for an early dinner with our kids.  Everything we ordered was delicious.  Our server was attentive and friendly.  They even made my 6 year old a grilled cheese and fries, which wasn't on the menu.  We'll definitely go back next time we're in Chicago.

29.description: So delicious! You have to get the truffle fries and Mac and cheese! We made a reservation and we didn't have to wait at all. Service was good and the wait time on food was not long at all.

42.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place.I had the gourmet burger (Havarti cheese, arugula, jalapeno relish, bourbon bacon jam) with truffle fries, and it's one of the best burgers I've had in recent memory. Perfectly cooked, lots of great toppings. A little messy, but that's how you know it's good. The truffle fries are divine and definitely worth the extra couple bucks.Our waiter was really nice and was making non-cheesy jokes and conversation. I do have a complaint about the patio though: there are way too many table and chairs in such a small area. It was hard to maneuver into our seats, and we constantly felt in the way of food runners and other patrons. That aside, I would definitely come back if I found myself in the neighborhood. Good people watching!

23.description: Upon entering this regal restaurant adorned in ceiling to floor polished wood; your greeted by a friendly hostess. Seats next to the window provide great people watching, however I arrived at 7:30 on a Monday night & by 8:30pm the place was packed. On weekends I can see how crowded this place can get. The noise level is high, talking drowns out the noise of soft lounge music. I ordered a cup of chicken noodle soup, it arrived piping hot with no shortage of chicken or veggies, packed, great tasting firm veggies with marinated chickenI ordered an entree salad with arugula, pine nuts, quinoa, light Brie cheese, tomatoes topped with filet mignon, which was perfectly seasoned, in three large chunks, close to 8oz, great price valueThe service is average at best, if your talking to friends or enjoying the games on the tv's you won't notice. Park in a lot, street parking is very limitedGreat marble bathrooms, huge floor to ceiling mirrors, pretty clean

47.description: Roasted bell and Evans chicken was delicious; and happened to be exactly what I wanted.  It was moist, cooked perfectly.  It came w an herb au jus that I could have drank by itself.My husband had the fried chicken and Mac n cheese - can you say food coma?  The Mac came w cheese crispies on top - did I say creamy, simple goodness?  The calamari was ok - little too much flavor for me; I like it a little simpler, but the squid was tender and fresh for sure.Crowd was a little bit too "posh" for our taste - really don't care if you have a Louie bag or not - I think everyone that walked in had one.Service was on que and our waiter was adorable.  Attentive, inquisitive and right on point.

8.description: Stopped in for dinner after work and were greeted by a more than friendly staff.  Started with a couple of Moscow Mules that proved to be AMAZEballs, followed by a spicy calamari that was great on the taste buds. Our dinner entrées were plentiful and the dessert was ginormous! Couldn't have had a better dining experience. LUX definitely brought out the LUXurios treatment!

34.description: Visited Luxbar for a work team dinner and was pleasantly surprised!  Service at the private bar was pretty quick even with 1 bartender and great selection of wine cocktails.Appetizers included fried calamari, bruschetta, quesadilla wraps, and hummus.  Calamari was delicious!  The other apps were ok, but nothing special.Ordered the filet for dinner and it was great!  Cooked perfectly and a large portion!  Mac & cheese on the side was by far the highlight of the day - I will definitely be coming back just to eat this! :)

16.description: This is my second time at LuxBar, and I feel this review is necessary to write, because the food and the service are both impeccable. Both times I've sat at the bar the same dude bartenders have been here. I believe Gunner and Gus are their names , are both are absolutely phenomenal! They are so attentive, I legit feel like a princess every time I'm there. Not only is the service amazing, so is the drinks and food. Highly recommend trying the Last Word 1921! It has Chartreuse in it, which is the dominant flavor of the cocktail, ridiculously tasty and strong! Got the crab cake and tuna poke. Both delish! I love everything about this place, and will be back!

13.description: I would say more like 3.5 stars, but I'll say 4 to be nice. It's pricey (gold coast, after all) but a nice atmosphere and everything I had was yummy. It's not somewhere I crave or am dying to return to often, but it's a place I would go if my friends wanted to....etc.

11.description: We went for late night drinks.  Scotch and Whiskey list is extensive.  Ask for the larger list if you want to open up your wallet for a generous 2.5 oz. pour of the finer scotches and whiskey's out there.  Their Moscow mule is probably one of the best out there.Atmosphere on a Saturday is great.  It is quite busy and the crowd is a mix of younger to middle age.  Servers are attentive and the manager seems to know his whiskey as well so that was helpful and encouraging.  Nothing worse than a place with a great top shelf and no one that knows it.  They did!Not sure about food as we did not have much but overall a fun and delightful experience.

39.description: Awesome cinnamon pecan pancakes.  My friend had the eggs bene and said they were great.  It was my first time in downtown Chicago and am glad my Chicago friend introduced me to this place.  Great neighborhood, quiet and quaint.

37.description: I have dined in and ordered food for take out at Lumbar and I have had nothing but positive experiences. The service, food and ambiance all make Lumbar worthy of 5 stars. The sweet chili fried calamari is a really good appetizer. The calamari pieces are really big and the sweet chili sauce is the perfect combination of sweet and spicy. The classic cobb salad is really good and the rotisserie chicken they use gives the salad a little twist from what I have usually thought of as a "classic" cobb. I may be partial to this salad because I love Cobb salads in general! The crab cake entree is really good, however it may not be enough food to warrant an entire, especially without an appetizer or added side. The dish consists of 1, very large and thick crab cake, with a slaw on the side. I aded saluted spinach as an additional side dish and between the two, I was full and satisfied. Clearly, I recommend trying lumbar! They also have a nice drink menu and would be a great place to just grab drinks and appetizers!

0.description: I do not know how to love a bar more than LuxBar!I first found LuxBar when I first moved to downtown Chicago for work, in August, 2009, and can be found at LuxBar between 3-7 times per week when I'm in town, at least sometime throughout the night, if not most of the night. LuxBar opened in September, 2005, in the historic Gold Coast region of downtown Chicago. LuxBar is yet another huge success by Steve Lombardo and Hugo Ralli, from Gibsons Steakhouse and Hugo's Frog Bar & Fish House fame. LuxBar was inspired by the work of Adolf Loos whose "American Bar" was designed and built in early 20th Century Vienna. The bar captured an elegance in simplicity; a style that greatly influenced the work of Frank Lloyd Wright and other American architects in the "prairie school." Stone, glass, brass and wood bathed in natural light, presence in the neighborhood is welcomed and profound. This is a special place by design.LuxBar is often referred to as a "neighborhood saloon" and is designed to convey that same simple elegance, just remember that the neighborhood is where you'll find the 40-something Neurosurgeons and Hedge Fund Managers mixed with the 30-something tourists and the 20-somethings lost from Division and Rush.The food is feel good fresh, natural and easily understood. Artisanal in style, the menu reflects what the partnership views as an accessible cornucopia of what you might eat on just any occasion. I feel like I've tried almost everything on the menu, and have always been extremely pleased. Some of my favorites are the filet mignon sliders, jumbo shrimp cocktail, and jumbo lump crab cake. Sometimes, they don't have what I want on the menu, and I'll have them make me something. My usual is a toned-down Caesar salad with light dressing and grilled chicken.The specialty cocktails are from natural, fresh ingredients: simple elegance. My favorite is starting with a glass or two of Champagne and from there, most of the bartenders mix me up my favorite fruity vodka drinks. Although, the "Drink Book" has a very impressive list of specialty cocktails, "Make Your Own Manhattan," wines, drafts, spirits, etc. For example, the bourbon list goes on for 2-3 pages, so you will definitely find anything you're looking for, and much, much more.The staff at LuxBar is trained in the customer care philosophy that has made Gibsons Steakhouse and Hugo's Frog Bar and Fish House famous for legendary service. I enjoy the pleasant mix between the staff knowing my order and chatting, but not getting too personally involved. I have always received impeccable service.Oh, and for all of you restroom obsessed Yelpers, like most quality bars and restaurants around Division and Rush, there is a restroom attendant who makes sure that not only the restroom stays spotless, that also there are plenty of beauty accoutrements for even the most picky, so make sure to bring some cash to tip accordingly. Of note...Parking is usually very difficult. The easiest for me, is to take a cab and get dropped off. Also, there is valet across the street for the hotel, which is always very accommodating, if I happen to drive.Private Dining and Party Hosting is Available EventsLuxBar often has seasonal events, so definitely frequently check their website.This Easter Sunday, there will be an appearance from the Easter Bunny from 11am-2pm.Mondays are "Industry Monday" with 50% off drinks and appetizers, in the bar only, from 11am-2am.Hours:Mon-Thurs: 11:00 am - 2:00 am Fri 8:00 am - 2:00 am Sat 8:00 am - 3:00 amSun 8:00 am - 2:00 amFor more information:luxbar.comI 5/5 highly recommend LuxBar!

38.description: Came per recommendation from the concierge, extremely busy, however got a table inside. It was a beautiful day in Chicago. Service was excellent the portions were large. I had the lux club, salmon eggs Benedict, veggie eggs Benedict. The food was very good. Well priced for the area. A bit noisy and the bathrooms are a flight high. It's a nice place to come and have breakfast or lunch, however there are other places with similar food. It's not a must have place. Still good.

51.description: Came here for a weekend brunch and was not disappointed.  We sat outside along the sidewalk and had a great overall experience.  The service was prompt and they were very accommodating of our group having three children ages 3-8.  The prices were reasonable given the location in Gold Coast.  I had the luxbar skillet which was okay, but not quite as good as I had hoped.  Others had the pancakes, an omelet, and the salmon dish.  All thought the food overall was good, just not the "oh my, we have to come back" type of good that can be found elsewhere in the city.  On a sunny day, the sidewalk seating is hard to beat though.

27.description: They make one large, delicious crab cake! Cole slaw could use some work though. Shared that plate and a bottle of Prosecco with a friend here recently and had a nice time.  We sat right by the open patio-facing windows which was great on a warm summer night. Service was good- quick and attentive. No complaints, but would need a complete dinner experience in order to bump the rating up or down. First visit was a success.

32.description: My wife and I held our wedding cocktail reception upstairs at Luxbar and we could not be happier. Here are a few highlights...1. The staff. Jaz, Kristin, Nicole & Liz = AWESOME. The team was so friendly, accommodating and patient. And the service staff the night of the event were so professional. ***I have to give a special call-out to Kristin (who walked us through the linens and the food and pretty much everything else prior to the event) and Liz (who was there to oversee our event that night). We couldn't have asked any more from both of them and we are very thankful. There was another guy who helped manage the event that night and I cannot remember his name, but he was fantastic, as well.2. The food. Our friends and family can't stop talking about the food. My personal faves were the filet sliders, beef wellington and the jumbo shrimp cocktail.3. The venue. When we walked in and saw what the staff had done to prepare for and set up the event my wife and I were blown away. We had something pictured in our minds and without really any specific direction from us the staff nearly executed it exactly how we had hoped! Within 5 minutes of working together the place was perfect and my wife and I had a chance to relax and have a drink prior to our guests arriving.4. The next day. My wife and I came in for brunch the next day since we had to pick up some of the items the staff had held onto for us (which was awesome that they did this so we didn't have to clean up and take everything away the night of the event). Every item we had given them ahead of time for the event was neatly packaged in the exact same packaging in the exact same manner as it was given to them. We were so taken back by the amount of care the staff took with our items. And as I loaded the car the manager brought my wife a complimentary glass of Veuve. ***Yes, guys, I loaded the car while my wife sipped champagne. Welcome to marriage :)Overall, our cocktail reception was awesome and we received so many compliments. My wife and I are both grateful to the staff at Luxbar that we have so many fantastic memories of that night!

54.description: Service is wonderful and the food was also great. We had the salmon and steak and both loved our meals.   Word of warning on the snicker bar dessert - it is huge and could easily be good for 4 people.   Enjoyed the meal and will definitely be back.

48.description: Great brunch spot. Burrito was HUGE but nicely done. Service was attentive.  Would go back.

44.description: Luxbar has the BEST Moscow Mules in Chicago.  A manager recently told me they served 18,000 mules last year, and I believe it.The menu is diverse and everything I've tried is well prepared.  They used to have more small plate options, but recently changed the menu (wish they'd bring that back).A good option if you're in the Gold Coast and looking for a casual restaurant with a diverse menu and fun bar.

24.description: Really enjoyed our experience. Sat at the bar. The beet salad was delicious, as was the popcorn shrimp. What made the night was Sean our bartender. Great recommendations on drinks, bartenders choice, and they all were delicious. I will definitely come back.

7.description: We considered LUXBAR for our wedding and found it to be satisfactory on every point.Communication with their event coordinator Jaz was professional and responsive. I emailed her with questions and she replied the same day with clear answers. I called her about an impromptu visit and she was available. She did not pressure us in any way, shape, or form.The event space was above the LUXBAR restaurant and was divided into two sections by a bar in the middle. There was a fireplace and tall windows that opened out to a small balcony. If we didn't like the furniture they would swap it with something else from another Gibson Group restaurant. They could comfortably accommodate 80 guests on each side of the space allowing us to have a ceremony on one side, switch to the other side for cocktails, then back again for a seated dinner, and move on to dancing.An open bar, passed hors d'oeuvres, and a seated two course dinner for 80 guests including tax and gratuity would cost us $12,500 on a summer Saturday evening. Our guests would have a choice of five entrees. The staff would take care of set up and clean up. If we had decorations they would arrange them for us also. We would have to bring our own dessert or pay more for theirs.We enjoyed dinner at LUXBAR in the restaurant to see if we liked the food. We had Steak Frites and a Birkshire Pork Chop (pictured). Both were seasoned and cook PERFECTLY. The meat could be easily chewed without being too soft. The sauces did not overpower the natural flavors of the meat. I am having a hard time recalling if I've ever had better cooked meat - especially without any direction to the chef. My props to Chef Michael!The fries with the steak were narrowly cut and fried crispy and seasoned. They reminded me of shoestring fries. Even though we were not impressed by the fries we couldn't stop eating them!We finished with a Seasonal Cherry Pie. We loved the crumbly crust and the locally sourced vanilla ice-cream. Beyond that, the pie was satisfying.We enjoyed two of the Build Your Own Manhattan and were delighted that they had high quality options including hand-cut ice. I also had an adult hot chocolate (Jalisco Hot Cocoa) sprinkled with paprika (delicious) followed by the Eventide. The Eventide was surprisingly ah-mazing. It mixed my favorite beer (Left Hand Milk Stout) with Few whiskey among other components. It was smooth, mature, delicately sweet, and creamy. I had two of them!Dinner, dessert, and all of our drinks cost about $150.The service at LUXBAR was incredibly professional. The servers wore black slacks, white shirts, and black ties (even the ladies). They are well accustomed to satisfying the demanding whims of wealthy local seniors and then switching to the unpredictability of tourists. They are smiling professionals who are able to deliver a consistent experience across the board.

49.description: I want to like this place. The food was good and the cocktails were nice too. But I just don't like the vibe. Try it for yourself.

40.description: Average food choices for brunch. I wasn't t impressed with the skillet. Corned beef is the only thing worth it. My order came out totally wrong but the server and manager  were very accommodating  and remade it.

53.description: Saturday night 8 pm. Table for 2. Place was packed. Hostess was nice, waiter was great. Food was good. Shrimp cocktail to start. We shared the Saturday night prime rib and order of mac n cheese. It was lots of foods for the 2 of us. Great setting, great people watching, nice staff and good wine and food, why would you not try it? We will be back. Not sure why some Yelpers are so critical.

30.description: You've got to go to this place for brunch. Eggs Benedict made to perfection. Staff very welcoming and friendly. Sit outside roadside under the arming for the perfect Chicago mid afternoon atmosphere. Ask for a cappuccino  made by Marena. She is very proud of her cappuccino !

46.description: I'm really upset about the experience I had here. I went on a Sunday for brunch. Unfortunately, the food was cold. We ordered the chicken club and the filet sliders. The truffle fries weren't good either. Everything was just sort of blah, nothing special. Your typical bar food. Thankfully we had a nice server that didn't make it uncomfortable for us when we barely touched our food and left. I've heard this place is super popular and fun so maybe it was a bad day? I'd prob go back only to get a drink but prob will pass on the food.

1.description: To start off I love LuxBar and I am a frequent diner. I came in with a group of 6 for brunch for the first time and I was not a fan of the food at all. Food:Eggs Benedict- eggs were a bit too over cooked for my taste and lacked flavor, but the breakfast hash brown/potato were delish!skillet- there were 3 orders and no one was really a fan. I would argue that it was a traditional skilled, very de-constructed. steak and eggs- the person who ordered it was not a fan of it all. but loved the mashed potatoes. beef carpaccio( off the regular menu) Yum!aside from the breakfast/brunch our server and management staff was absolutely amazing. I will continue to return for lunch and dinner but brunch may be a no go.Luxbar for lunch/dinner- 4-5 stars hands downBrunch- 2 starsservice- 4 stars!!!!!

55.description: Luxbar is a cool spot to have a few drinks.The nice setting and decor draw a young professional crowd.The service is attentive and the prices are fair.

9.description: The girlfriends and I came for our annual Christmas outing. Honestly, we came across the site on OpenTable and, unlike many restaurants in Chicago on a Monday, they were open. SOOO glad we chose them! The menu is simple, but what they do is great! We got there at 11 for an early lunch, and we were able to choose anyplace in the dining area. We sat by the fireplace, which on a Chicago winter afternoon, is a great place to hang out! The servers always made sure that our water glasses were full, which is always a sign of a great restaurant with great service!We started off with drinks, and I had the El Diabolo, a tequila based drink with ginger beer and cream de casis. It was definitely different...a little bitter but it was good! Between the four of our, we shared two appetizers. One friend and I had the tuna tartare, which really hit the spot! The tuna was very fresh, lightly mayoed and served with a good helping of fresh home chips. I really appreciated that there was more than enough chips for the amount of tartare that was there. The other two had the appetizer mac and cheese. Not the best mac and cheese I've had, but it was definitely good and tasty!Honestly, what drew me in when deciding on coming to the Luxbar was the filet and lobster sliders! It was even better that I found out when we arrived that they had a slider combo with two sliders and a side salad or soup! I also really wanted to try the King Crab bisque, so problem solved! The sliders were.....simply....to die for! The fillets were cooked to a perfect medium rare, which is pretty difficult for the size of the meat! There was also a very large piece of lobster tail on top of the two fillets. Just perfect! The bisque itself was also amazing! Very rich and creamy, however not huge pieces of crab. The flavor of crab within the soup, however, was amazing! Service was on par, with the waiter showing the perfect amount of attention and not hovering at all. We also never had to ask for a waiter when we needed it! I was a little nervous with the size of the table for four (on the small side), but they cleared plates away very quickly to make sure that everything fit on the table and that we didn't feel crowded.Since we came right when they opened, we had no problem getting a seat, but by the time we left, the restaurant was full, so I'd definitely suggest a reservation if you're planning ahead. Great service....great food....we'll definitely be back!!

26.description: Drinks and food were great. We ordered the white lady and 3 negronis, Courtney (our server) was super sweet. What else do you need for a five star review?

25.description: I just came here for their 10 for 10 anniversary deal. Although I really enjoyed the ambiance, the food here was mixed: The popcorn shrimp was pretty good, solid 3.5/4 stars (simple seasoning and not too greasy, additional seasoning and some lemon would have make this a solid 5 star dish), however my friend had the steak and potatoes (i tasted the potatoes, they were bland and tasted fake, though I'm not sure they were..it was weird) and the steak looked over cooked, and she said it was not very good. I would give it a go again, however maybe just for apps.

12.description: Went to Luxbar for brunch last Sunday.  It was crowded but we got a table in about 15 minutes.  Our server was very attentive and the food was great.  I got a burger and my friend got a chicken sandwich. Both were awesome.  I got the delux burger and it had some incredibly delicious bacon jam.  It was one of the best burgers I've had in a while. The homemade bun was fantastic. The only reason I'm giving 3 instead of 5 stars is the burger came slathered in mayo and this was absolutely not listed on the menu. Mayo is the ultimate dealbreaker for me and it makes me irrationally angry when restaurants don't list it and then put it on your food anyways. Why not either clearly list it on the menu or serve it on the side? I know I'm not the only person who doesn't like mayo.  Personal pet peeve, but it gets me very riled up. I had to send my burger back and wait on another.  A waste of food and everyone's time that could be avoided if the menu accurately described the dish's preparation.

59.description: This place has a great atmosphere, it's in a great location, and the prices were very reasonable. I'd definitely come back. This is a really cool area to get Sunday brunch in Chicago. I highly recommend it.

21.description: The service was phenomenal! The staff were friendly, food was great, and the food came out quickly. Also, the atmosphere was fun. Highly recommend!

17.description: My wife and I stumbled upon this place in Chicago while going to breakfast. Prices were reasonable, food was good and service was great.  Nice atmosphere with a fireplace and low noise volume. This has been added as a must go place when we visit Chicago.

10.description: Luxbar has the BEST Moscow Mules in Chicago.  A manager recently told me they served 18,000 mules last year, and I believe it.The menu is diverse and everything I've tried is well prepared.  They used to have more small plate options, but recently changed the menu (wish they'd bring that back).A good option if you're in the Gold Coast and looking for a casual restaurant with a diverse menu and fun bar.

5.description: We had an absolutely fantastic brunch at Luxbar. It's highly recommended you make a reservation for brunch cause it get's packed. Then again, everything on Rush street seems crowded regardless of time of the day. I opted for the eggs benedict, which was amazing. Others in the group got the hash, steak and eggs, and calamari. Bloody mary's and service were spot on.

3.description: Upon entering this regal restaurant adorned in ceiling to floor polished wood; your greeted by a friendly hostess. Seats next to the window provide great people watching, however I arrived at 7:30 on a Monday night & by 8:30pm the place was packed. On weekends I can see how crowded this place can get. The noise level is high, talking drowns out the noise of soft lounge music. I ordered a cup of chicken noodle soup, it arrived piping hot with no shortage of chicken or veggies, packed, great tasting firm veggies with marinated chickenI ordered an entree salad with arugula, pine nuts, quinoa, light Brie cheese, tomatoes topped with filet mignon, which was perfectly seasoned, in three large chunks, close to 8oz, great price valueThe service is average at best, if your talking to friends or enjoying the games on the tv's you won't notice. Park in a lot, street parking is very limitedGreat marble bathrooms, huge floor to ceiling mirrors, pretty clean

35.description: My girlfriends and I went for brunch yesterday and it was really good. The portions are not so crazy that we had a lot of food leftover but were more than enough for none of us to leave hungry. It was a great way to start our day in Chicago!

19.description: This is the upscale Cheers in the city of Chicago. Everyone knows everyone and it has a family vibe to the place. The drinks are fantastic and the pours are good. Food is very good, and easy to share!

28.description: Our server Jackie had great attention to detail. She is traveling on a trip to Italy. I think she's a great addition to the exceptional service at LUXBAR.

45.description: Everything was amazing about this place.  The atmosphere was speak-easy ish and the food was phenomenal as well as the service and drinks! 5 stars!

33.description: Great experience. Loved it. Highly recommend the Calamari. The meatloaf was okay and the salmon is solid. Hear the burger is their staple item so I hear.

43.description: We went for late night drinks.  Scotch and Whiskey list is extensive.  Ask for the larger list if you want to open up your wallet for a generous 2.5 oz. pour of the finer scotches and whiskey's out there.  Their Moscow mule is probably one of the best out there.Atmosphere on a Saturday is great.  It is quite busy and the crowd is a mix of younger to middle age.  Servers are attentive and the manager seems to know his whiskey as well so that was helpful and encouraging.  Nothing worse than a place with a great top shelf and no one that knows it.  They did!Not sure about food as we did not have much but overall a fun and delightful experience.

2.description: As a whiskey fiend who gets off from work two blocks away around midnight, Luxbar makes for a great spot to unwind before heading home. They boast one of the city's most comprehensive whiskey selections, as well as a respectable draft beer and wine-by-the-glass list, and for that they (would) get five stars. From the hummus to wedge salad to roasted salmon with celery root to meatloaf with mushroom gravy, food here is usually solid, although never exceptional or moan-inducing -- likely a symptom of being a part of the Gibsons family. I advise against the goopy, tasteless, heartburn-inducing steak and black bean chili, as well as the beef carpaccio, which suffers from a jumble of too many sharp flavors (pickled shallots, balsamic glaze, parmesan).Service, while efficient, rarely offers much in the way of warmth; a smile every now and then would be lovely. Maybe by the time I arrive, the staff has already had hours of putting up with corporate asshats and airheads. Shouldn't matter, though. Whatever. I come for the whiskey.For those of you complaining about the prices, you know what area of town you're in, right?

18.description: I was pleasantly surprised by this place.I had the gourmet burger (Havarti cheese, arugula, jalapeno relish, bourbon bacon jam) with truffle fries, and it's one of the best burgers I've had in recent memory. Perfectly cooked, lots of great toppings. A little messy, but that's how you know it's good. The truffle fries are divine and definitely worth the extra couple bucks.Our waiter was really nice and was making non-cheesy jokes and conversation. I do have a complaint about the patio though: there are way too many table and chairs in such a small area. It was hard to maneuver into our seats, and we constantly felt in the way of food runners and other patrons. That aside, I would definitely come back if I found myself in the neighborhood. Good people watching!

41.description: Favorite bar. Easy recommendation for my clients. Must try truffle fries and Moscow mule.

52.description: Very poor service will not return here. Person who took our reservations was rude and got my name wrong (was still wrong when I arrived). When I complained via twitter manager reached out once I had to call him back twice within a week before getting a hold of him. He promised to be present when we arrived and promised free apps or drinks due to the bad phone service. He never showed up. No one at the restaurant ever apologized. They definitely need some 101 in customer service

50.description: Wyatt. one of the best servers by far. He checks up on us from afar. Not too much or lil. Chill. Always on top of what we needed and more though we didnt ask. Amazing. Thank you.Food. CALAMARI IS A MUST. It was not the typical fried calamari and dippingsauces on the side. Good lord. Best calamari. now i cannot wait for the truffle fries and gourmet burger. They even split it in half for us when we didnt ask. My boyfriend would not stop about how good it is the whole time and he does not give burgers a good praise but this one did it.this place is a must.

4.description: A place with a well-made Moscow Mule has a piece of my heart. I went with the classic grilled cheese and tomato soup which was a perfect fit for a cold Chicago day. We were stuck in a corner table that was a bit squeezy, but we made it work. Our server was friendly and very attentive which led me to try the Moscow Mule which I will not forget. If I would go back I would try the Lux Club, a massive club sandwich + avocado and their homemade chips.

6.description: This is one of those well staffed...nice looking establishments that seems like they are trained to churn things out like clockwork getting people in and out. Ya know what I'm talking about you haven't even looked at your menu and your waitress comes over twice in 3 minutes while you are conversing and asks if you are ready to order.  Anyway with that said its a fine place in the neighborhood. Not so fitting of its name LUXbar... more like a family or everyday kind of place you go for a sandwich or a salad. Portions are large and quality is good. Nothing spectacular but defiantly worthy of a meal if your in the area.

22.description: Excellent food! We were here with a group event and the food was outstanding. Steaks, slider apps, lamb chop apps, staff was friendly and professional. Best steak I ever had. We are NY Mets fans and Watched game 1 of the series here. Very accommodating!

15.description: I just came here for their 10 for 10 anniversary deal. Although I really enjoyed the ambiance, the food here was mixed: The popcorn shrimp was pretty good, solid 3.5/4 stars (simple seasoning and not too greasy, additional seasoning and some lemon would have make this a solid 5 star dish), however my friend had the steak and potatoes (i tasted the potatoes, they were bland and tasted fake, though I'm not sure they were..it was weird) and the steak looked over cooked, and she said it was not very good. I would give it a go again, however maybe just for apps.

57.description: Went to lux bar for dinner with a group. We got seated about 30 minutes late but the manager was super apologetic and took care of a round of drinks. The food was delicious! Everyone's food came out how they wanted and it tastes great! The drinks were fabulous as always! We had a very friendly and wonderful waiter! Overall great dinner and experience!!

20.description: My husband and I loved this bar until I  was  interrogated by both the bartender and restaurant manager on the evening of Sunday, November 1st. We had left the Jethro Tull concert around 10:00pm. I went to the bar to order cocktails for my husband and I.  The bartender said he didn't feel comfortable serving me. He called the manager over and they both proceeded to interrogate me regarding how many cocktails I had had at the concert. TWO!!!! That is how many I had. I have never been so disturbed by the actions of both a bartender and manager at an establishment in Chicago. Specifically,  the group that Luxbar belongs to. My husband was coming into the bar after paying the cab driver. I was on my way out. Never again will we go to Luxbar.  We crossed the street and went to Hugo's. They gladly served us. We had some appetizers and enjoyed the end of our evening. I spoke to the manager at Hugo's.  Hopefully,  something will be done. Good riddance Luxbar!!!!!

36.description: We came here yesterday with my mom and aunts. The food was delicious, especially the white fish. We ordered a side of veggies, which was also delicious and enough to share among four people. Everything was fresh. But what seals the deal is the waitstaff : they were all incredibly kind, efficient, and accommodated every request in a timely manner. They give you a cute little postcard with your check. Overall wonderful experience.

14.description: I have dined in and ordered food for take out at Lumbar and I have had nothing but positive experiences. The service, food and ambiance all make Lumbar worthy of 5 stars. The sweet chili fried calamari is a really good appetizer. The calamari pieces are really big and the sweet chili sauce is the perfect combination of sweet and spicy. The classic cobb salad is really good and the rotisserie chicken they use gives the salad a little twist from what I have usually thought of as a "classic" cobb. I may be partial to this salad because I love Cobb salads in general! The crab cake entree is really good, however it may not be enough food to warrant an entire, especially without an appetizer or added side. The dish consists of 1, very large and thick crab cake, with a slaw on the side. I aded saluted spinach as an additional side dish and between the two, I was full and satisfied. Clearly, I recommend trying lumbar! They also have a nice drink menu and would be a great place to just grab drinks and appetizers!

29.description: I'm a huge fan of Mac products and went in yesterday looking to add four or five new eyeshadows to my collection.  There were three people working, and after a brief "hello" from one sales girl (who said this while dashing away from me), there was no other communication from any employees.  I knew exactly which shades I wanted so I basically just needed someone to pull the product for me.  Nope.  After about five minutes of being in this near empty store I got frustrated an just left.  Common, Mac... I've come to expect better service from the store and you let me down.
