42.description: I'm a recent MAC convert, and I started off w/ the store vs. a department store bc I knew it would have a bigger selection.  I called in to make an appointment.  They were a bit late, but not by too much.  I agree that it does take some greeting to get noticed (shouldn't it be the other way around).I am grateful that I got a consultant who was extremely helpful and answered all the questions I had.  She was patient and explained how to apply everything I bought and also told me about some great deals they currently have.While I would have loved to buy everything she suggested, I just couldn't.  The consultant was kind enough to write down the other products she used on me so I could refer to them later.Granted the prices are a bit higher than other brands, but I was immediately complemented on my appearance from others.  And I finally knew how to apply certain products correctly.My one gripe, when the store is busy; their space seems too small and almost claustrophobic.

23.description: I was so impressed with the service and products I got at Mac on Oak.  Pass up the mall makeup counters and go directly to Mac on Oak - well worth it.I went in on a Saturday for a wedding rehearsal dinner and was hoping to both buy some makeup and to have someone with more patience and talent to apply my makeup.  I bought way more than I should have (happily) and had a great application that resulted in many complements that night.  Then, I decided to come back on Sunday (wedding day) because I knew I couldn't do better.  The girls there were happy to see me and happily reapplied.  No delays (more than an occasional customer needing help) and more complements on Sunday.I will definitely return (maybe next weekend).

8.description: I'm a MAC Pro member and Pro discounts can only be used at freestanding stores. This store is my favorite of the two (the other is in Lincoln Park). Being a woman of color, I like to have another woman color's POV on different products. Emily, I believe is her name, is extremely helpful. I usually go in with my list, ready to go and I'm helped immediately. All the people I've experienced have been helpful and pleasant. I can say, however, when you know something about makeup, it's a little easier to talk to them and get past the sales pitch. Freestanding stores have a much larger variety of products than the counters in department stores. I just wish their hours were extended a little bit. Check it out... you could easily spend an hour or more in there.

31.description: I was SO happy when this store opened. No more dealing with the bitchy MAC girls at Macy's and Nordstrom? Yay!99% of the time when I walk into MAC I know exactly what I am there for, so I don't require a lot of customer service. But I am always greeted, asked what I need, and have it promptly delivered.However, just about every time I go to MAC I treat myself to a new eyeshadow in addition to whatever it is that I went in specifically for. The associates are always honest in their recommendations of what best compliments my skin/eye color and what exactly I can 'pull off.' My collection is getting a bit out of control; I may just have to start wearing a different color on each eye. I wonder if that trend would stick...The only products that I don't love here are their foundations and their brushes. Bobbi Brown's brushes are much nicer and about the same price.Great products, great service and a very diverse color palette to please the most conservative to the most outrageous makeup connoisseurs.

34.description: I love MAC !  this store is great if you are looking for everything MAC and don't mind rude, nonpro sales people treating you like youre a bum off the streets trying to use thier bathroom. I don't get, I am friendly, have my VISA ready and I'm NOT a bum. so why would a sales person stare at you for bit, pass you by twice and not even respond to you entering the store? I'd rather go  out of my way to the burbs were they atleast ask if they can help you. I'm sure sales would go up greatly if they would only train thier staff to practice common courtesy and social respect.

16.description: I am not a huge make-up person. I stick with neutrals for work stuff and my goal in life is to look put together with as little work as possible. That said, I get my make-up done for special events so I don't have to learn how to do it or buy the make-up required and keep it around for once-in-a-blue-moon.I usually go to the woman in the salon inside my building but on Saturdays she is often doing weddings so she recommended I go to MAC for make-up before a friend's wedding. In her defense, she did say to ask for a specific person, but I didn't because I figured....hey they all work here, right? OMG It was off-the-chain horrible. I'm actually ready to cry again just thinking about it. I had to coach her through the session so I could get home in enough time to wash it off and re-do it myself. I thought maybe I could salvage it if she didn't go crazy, but no. It took a week to get all of the glue out of my lashes from her ridiculous placement of the false lashes. I had to scrub my face twice after to get most of it off.   Further, they weren't very sympathetic...trying to get me to buy more stuff and spend extra time in the store to "fix" it.

13.description: I dislike the MAC counter at Macy's in Water Tower, it's always too crowded for me (which isn't their fault, it's prime location) and they are never nice to me. I'm glad that my co-worker recommended this free standing store, which is only 2 blocks from where we work! I went in to browse their Magnetic Nudes collection, which most of the colors I needed were sold out. But that's to be expected with most of their LE collections. However, a really nice sales girl recommended me other products that were similar/better for my complexion. She was also prompt and ringing me up and getting the products for me. I will definitely return to this store when I am in need of a MAC product.

11.description: I was in town for a wedding and came here to get my makeup done for the event. I made an appointment over the phone - I called on Weds for a Saturday and they were able to schedule me, but they were pretty booked, so I recommend booking early if you have a specific time you want to come in. I felt that the makeup artist took time to understand what kind of look I was going for and what types of colors I felt comfortable with. My makeup turned out amazing- dramatic and just what I wanted. The cost was $50 for studio makeup session (which includes a free mascara of your choice) + $16 for the lashes. I can see why some other people felt the staff is inattentive. This was not my experience, but the store was packed, and two of the four people on staff were busy with makeup appointments so weren't able to pay close attention to everyone in the store. So if you need some staff lovin', maybe don't come here during peak Saturday hours.I'd definitely recommend them for special event makeup and will be back if I ever have another black tie affair in Chicago!

39.description: I heard some mixed reviews about this store, but I had to go into the city for a job interview, so spent a little time visiting some places while there. I had some empty containers to return, and I return them for eye shadow, so this was the place.I was kind of floored, because the entire time I was there (30-45 minutes), I was either alone or there was a single other customer. The MA's were helpful, and though one of them could be taken as maybe a bit aloof or snobby, I didn't really have a problem with her.It was really, REALLY nice to be in a store with more than enough employees to help me, and when I was all alone. The place was clean and quiet. I'm sure I'll visit again, though as there's probably several counters closer to my apartment, it will be for returning empty containers or to buy palettes (or anything else that turns out to be available at stand-alone stores only).

37.description: I'm in love. A huge selection with employees who know what they are talking about and don't attack you with their commission in mind. The recommendations they make help to narrow down the amazing options available.

0.description: Oh MAC. You are awesome! I scheduled a private session here for a photo shoot I had the same day based on their long-standing reputation, and having gotten my makeup done wonderfully at another location in the northeast. I originally scheduled my appointment for 4:30 PM and called to reschedule for 4:00 PM. The woman on the other end sounded very rushed and I was skeptical she even changed the appointment. I was going to call back to confirm, but I said naaaah, I'm sure they got it. I should have followed my intuition though! It's a shame us women don't listen to it more often..anyways...When I arrived to the store, everyone was extremely friendly and welcoming! They greet you as soon as you enter. I told them I had an appointment for 4:00 PM, and what do you know!? My appointment was never changed! Tsk tsk tsk! Well, they went ahead and kept my appointment for 4:00 PM although I would have to be on the floor instead of in the private room (but still kept "private") . Ladies, the private room is worth it! If you're scheduling an appointment your two options are spend $50 on products and have your makeup done on the floor - with your artist helping other customers (interruptions), or have your makeup done in the private room for $50 and get a free mascara. I'd rather have no interruptions and be done in an hour, so I believe private is the way to go! The store didn't have too much traffic during that time on a weekday, but I hear weekends are pretty crowded. So are Wednesday evenings.The lady who did my makeup was wonderful! She asked me detailed questions to find out exactly what I needed done and her smokey eye application was A++. I highly recommend her! She also gave me dozens of free makeup tips, because I rarely RARELY wear the stuff. I left the store looking and feeling like a superstar and all ready for my close up!FYI: The lady who did my makeup has a short blond cut. She is WONDERFUL! I wish I remembered her name! Thank you so much!

38.description: I love this place!  Michael is the best - he did my makeup a couple months ago and he not only helped me find perfect colors of foundation, blush, and eyeshadow for me (not rock-n-roll at all, just what I wanted - a natural, easy, polished look) - he did such a fantastic job I've having him do my wedding makeup.  When I went in he seemed genuinely pleased that I enjoyed my experience so much and offered to do another consultation before the wedding appointment so we can "just play".  Yes, it's pricey, but worth it for the service and amazing selection.

27.description: I worked with make up artists for a while and know that MAC is what a professional make up artist would choose first. So for my wedding day, after having contacted several make-up artists who were all insanely expensive, I decided to give it a try and see what MAC make up artists would make of me.Now, getting married, as wonderful as it is, is a stressful experience and can turn the sweetest girl into a terrifying Bridezilla. Nothing but perfection is good enough. And at MAC OAK STREET, they give it to you! They charge $ 50 for a make-up, so even with a trial you're far below the average price asked by other professionals. You can take your time and re-adjust every detail until you're satisfied with the result. The make up artist available on the day of my wedding was not the one I had the trial with, which worried me a little. But after the trial they give you a drawing with all the products and shades they used, so the next person can replicate it. In fact I liked the second person even more, so bad that I don't remember her name! My make up turned out wonderfully and stayed on for 12 hours without any flaws. They also gave me some great advice on my bridesmaids make up. A great favorite!

32.description: Let me just say how much I LOVE all of the girls that work here! My BFF and I walked in looking for lipgloss and we walked out with makeovers and a ton of great recommendations for nightlight and restaurants! The girls are super friendly and talkative. They are incredibly honest and very sweet. One of the girls even invited us to her friend's Andy Warhol mod themed party the next night since the MAC girls were working on the makeup but we ended up being too pressed for time to go. So sweet! We're definitely coming back next summer to say hello to our new MAC friends!!

44.description: I hate to be so negative, but MAC really brought out my inner pessimism.  I have already had a previous unpleasant experience at the Oak Street make-up boutique, somewhat of a Pretty Woman "I have to go shopping" incident.  Decided to brush off any harsh feelings as I truly am a fan of their products. The product I needed in particular (their infamous eye shadow pallets) are only available at the Oak Street store, otherwise, I would have no doubt gone to a department store.  After impatiently pestering me to make a decision about which colors I was going to purchase, the sale attendant asked if he could see which color was currently in my pallet (brought my old one so I could match the color).  He drops it on the floor, the shadow cracks all over the place, and he hands me my empty container.  When he handed the empty container back to me, he didn't apologize, and then rudely asked me "what do you want me to do about it." I was absolutely speechless.  No remorse for breaking my shadow, no nothing.  I intend to call management and let them know about my experience, but of course I felt the need to share it with my fellow yelpers as well : )

24.description: Love love love this place! Their make-up artists are the best, and colors are great!

7.description: I could spend hours in this store getting tips and playing with new makeup.  In fact I did just that when I was in Chicago last.  My family had a recent garage/house fire in which destroyed most of my MAC makeup and brushes.  While I picked Aileen's brain on new products and her favorite brushes, she made my Danish exchange daughter feel like a goddess by doing her makeup.  Then she demonstrated some of her ideas on my own makeup.  When it came to contouring questions she told me about a recent wedding that she did the makeup for.  She recommended a brown paint stick from the Pro Store on Armitage.  I left armed with new information, great inspiration, an amazing experience, personalized shopping experience, and tons of new makeup/tools to try out.  I will be back.

40.description: I would give 4 stars because I enjoy their cosmetics, but I am not critiquing the line, i'm critiquing Mac on OAK STREET!  I give Mac on Oak 3 stars because I think you'd have to go either on a weeknight or be lucky to get waited on on a weekend......or patient!A few months back, I went and didn't get waited on.......I left in a huffy...If I'm not acknowledged in about 2-3 minutes, esp when I need assistance.....I'm out.  This past weekend, I went in and upon coming in, someone told me Abbey would be assisting me when she was finished ringing someone up.  Well, that's good.....because I would've had no qualms about pivoting like a did a few months back.  I just browsed the many hues in the glosses and lipliners!!  They really have a good array of colors.Anyways, Abbey helped me out.  She was pretty knowledgeable.  She applied some products on me.  I would have to say she was pretty patient and good w/ me.....as I have certain specifications for what I like.  I left w/ 4 products and have been very pleased w/ our selections.  I will be back to the Mac on Oak Street, expecting a good experience as I had this past weekend.

30.description: I've always had good experiences at MAC stores, and this one wasn't very different.  I was a little surprised, considering this one is located in one of the most pretentious 'hoods in Chicago.  Alas, we were greeted immediately by a very friendly sales girl.  Maggie R. and I were looking to pick up some foundation for a wedding.  I have never used foundation, and was somewhat confused.  The employees of MAC are trained professionals, and know exactly how to match what you are looking for with your skin tone.  She applied some foundation on my face, and quickly wiped it off, stating that it just wasn't right.  She grabbed another one, and applied it to my whole face...it looked great!  She also helped us pick out blush that would compliment our complexions.  It was a very good experience, and I will be returning.

46.description: Normally, I am a Stila girl, but sometimes a girl just has to go to the trusted Mac.  If you can find parking, this spot will have all of your make-up needs without having to brave the department store crowds or the tourists on Michigan Avenue.  I don't know about you, but when I need some powder the last thing I want to dodge is tourists.  The staff is very friendly and helpful too.

1.description: To be fair, I didn't need help for real when I came to this location. I had already received good service when I was out of town in VA but I ended up buying the wrong powder color. I just needed to make an exchange and I was helped promptly when I walked in. It wasn't as efficient as it could have been though and I'm not really sure why it took so long to make the switch when I had a receipt... but I realized I didn't have the box... they never said anything or made an issue of it so I really appreciated that! I think the lady helping me was relatively new and needed to get confirmation/approvals/something from a manager. It was fine because I wasn't in a rush, but in general it took a bit longer than perhaps it should have. I like MAC in general and I'm over the moon with my products! You can't tell me NOTHING when I have my lip gloss on!

9.description: Super helpful. Location is never extremely busy. Aileen is THEE best. Very personable and honest. I never feel pressured to buy or sold the wrong products. I'm never going to the Macys (Michigan) location again. Parking is easy as well.

26.description: Going into a MAC store is like trying to keep rock away from the crack head, it just won't happen.  I go into makeup frenzy if I'm even near a MAC counter.I've been a loyal customer for about ten years, and know their lines pretty well.  I also just dropped a money bomb for some new goodies.The people are pretty helpful, and it helps if you have a clear idea of what you want or at least where to start.I'm excited to take my new lipstick out for a spin!

25.description: Are you pale and pasty white?  Need a bit of bronzer but don't know where to start?  Are you missing eyebrows and need something to fill them in?  Or do you dream in Technicolor and get inspired by bright pretty colors?  If you said yes to any of the above, you must head on over to Mac on Oak Street.  MAC has the longest-lasting, richest shades of colors that last.  Forget Dior, Clinique, or any other froo-froo trendy brandy that just sprouted up.  MAC is gold.  And their makeup artists are so friendly and passionate about giving you the most polished look that enhances your features.I stopped by here the other day and had an awesome consultation with Laura -- she knows her colors and will show you actually how to apply the products and give you several options that you might never have thought to used.  I'm no Sasquatch but every so often, i love seeing all the new shades of colors and beauty products in the market.  Unlike many cosmetic stores, this Mac store has an aesthetically well-designed space that offers customers a bit more privacy without gaper's traffic (which you'd see in a department store).  The environment is more relaxing and less frenetic, clients here feel more comfortable and get a better overall shopping experience.In a high-end area of town where snootiness tends to run vampant, this place is a friendly boutique located on beautiful tree-lined Oak Street.  Female business travelers & tourists, if you forgot your makeup bag, don't bother with hte department stores, just go here and have your best face put on.

12.description: I love MAC cosmetics.  I will admit that most of my make-up kit is MAC.  I've only visited this location twice, and both times the ladies working have been less than stellar.  The first time it was kind of busy, so I'll give them that.  The most recent time, I visited on a Wednesday, mid-day, so it was not busy.  My friend and I were pretty much ignored.  A girl did help us when we could pull her away from her friend who was playing around with the lipsticks (I don't think she purchased anything, therefore not really customer in my book).  This same girl didn't offer to help us try on lipsticks or give us the proper tools (disposable lip wands) to do so.  She didn't even show us the alcohol so to disinfect the lipsticks beforehand --- I had to go looking for it at the end of the make-up counter.  Lastly, she was of no help when my friend wanted to put together a palette of eyeshadows.  Another salesperson ended up helping us when the first failed to.  It was only after dropping around $60 did the first salesgirl perk up and act somewhat nice.  Total disappointment.  I really hate to be hating on MAC.  I really do love the products and every other make-up artist I have encountered at their stores and counters has been fantastic.  Its just this store I guess.  Glad I only visit it a couple times of year, because I wouldn't be using as much MAC if I had to deal with this lackadaisical attitude from their staff.

21.description: Sandra! You goddess of make up! You always make me look beautiful!The whole staff here is amazing and charming and always remember me and my friends.I never mind spending money here which is prob why I come in once a week!

17.description: I am a total newbie with makeup. I've put on makeup once in my whole high school career (Prom. I looked like a pig, btw.), and never since graduation. I was getting along just fine until I got invited to a cocktail party. Eek.Panicking, I dropped in the first makeup store I saw, hoping for some pointers. Given my experience with makeup, I'm sure anyone who's ever touched a stick of lipstick in their lifetime would have been able to help me with the basics, so I can't say anything about the expertise here. However, the employees were super nice.I was helped quite promptly, but I did come in on an early weekday night. I was helped by Gary, who didn't pressure me to buy anything at all, even though I ended up trying on powder foundation, blush, eyeliner, and mascara. He answered all my questions and wasn't at all patronizing. I definitely came out of that store feeling a lot less anxious about makeup.Additionally, all the makeup for sampling were used in a sanitary way: a disposable brush for lip gloss and mascara, and the eyeliner pencil was sanitized, sharpened, then sanitized again.Now to see if I'm allergic to what I tried, haha.

10.description: Awesome and helpful staff.  I came with my makeup artist and the staff helped her show me products I never would have known to pick out.  I'm so pleased with my products and the looks they showed me.  Thanks to the MAC team at this store for being so great!

5.description: I somehow landed myself in Aileen's chair at Mac.  My problem had been color matching: I have a lot of olive in my skin and everyone kept applying warm colors that turned me pink, achem Laura Mercier MUA.  Until Aileen came into my life as the makeup angel that she is.  She gave me a flawless face that photographed beautifully, scheduled all my girls, and couldn't have made the experience any better.  I am forever in love.

3.description: i've never really had an experience here that really stuck out as great. most recently, i came in to purchase a fun, bold lipstick as a little #treatyoself gift on valentine's day. the woman who helped me was certainly knowledgeable on the products they have to offer, but when she asked what i was looking for and i told her a bold lip color, she asked me to select a few shades. when i pointed to one, she looked at me like i was incompetent and snickered, "you think THAT'S a bold color?" i mean, i'm sorry i'm not a color expert, but that's exactly why i chose to go straight to the experts instead of fending for myself, and i was made to feel dumb and embarrassed. i still left with a lip color and a lipliner, but only because i felt obligated for wasting that woman's time, and not before trying to be baited with a new blush to add-on to my purchase. the next time i want any mac products, i'm going to the counter at nordstrom, where the associates are knowledgeable, friendly, and not condescending.

35.description: I've transitioned from using predominantly drugstore makeup to the pricier brands from Sephora and Mac. But, I haven't completely abandoned some drugstore favorites - I think Maybelline mascara and some Neutragena products are excellent.But back to Mac, I've been lucky as I've always had good experiences at this location.  So I went there this weekend and literally as I opened the door I had a sales clerk ask if she could help me. I pulled out a list from my pocket with the name of some products I wanted to try and she immediately got them out and recommended the right shades for my complexion and asked some good questions such as what look I wanted, "matte", "dewy" etc. She patiently applied different items from foundation to concealer to eye liner, gave me tips on the best way to apply and was willing to do more if I wanted. The result was I ended up buying more than what I intended. So, I've had all good experiences, but perhaps, hitting it at a different day or time others may not get the attentive service.I also recommend checking out their current line of Fafi products. Fafi is a French graffiti artist whose whimsical, colorful, sassy, female centric designs are on everything from mass merchandise like LeSportsac to exclusive European art gallery shows.

19.description: My love for M.A.C runs strong & deep. I adore their eye shadows. The colors are so rich & vibrant and they have every shade under the rainbow. And don't get me started on their brushes. It literally changed my life when I got turned on to them. It's amazing the difference a brush can make. Blending, smudging, layering shades, my makeup took on a whole new life when I found the right brushes to apply with. But anyway, on to the store itself. I stop in here every couple of months because a salon I go to is across the street. The staff here is always on point. They are friendly & helpful but will leave you alone too if that's what you want. I once spent about a 1/2 hour with one girl trying to find just the right shade of red lipstick for me. Now that's service! And every once in awhile I'll just get my makeup done. I love the looks they come up with. It's always fun to have someone else do your makeup....even if you leave at 3 o'clock in the afternoon with bright aqua going out eyes!! My only caution is be prepared to drop some cash. Even when I'm on my best behavior I always manage to leave with at least one thing I didn't plan to buy. It's just so hard, all that pretty makeup just waiting, begging even, to be brought home! And I'm a sucker for it every time.

28.description: I have to do this in neanderthal speak.. MAC is just calling out for it. This is how my latest visit went down.. So here goes: Me need bronzer. Me also need blush!!!! Me run out!! Me like to contour face!!!. It make face look more feminine and sexy. OAK STREET!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You not as annoying as Michigan ave. You smaller but me like. I no have to go to Nordstrom and Saks unless me have to. No get me wrong.. Me love Nordstrom and Saks, me just get easily distracted. Like when little fly, fly around me. Me eye wander!!!!! It make me dizzy and forget where me going!! MAC bronzer the best bronzer ever. It look most realest!! Me also like MAC blush.. it go on better than others where me have to cake that shit on! Me not like to look like clown!   Me like to experiment with color. Me skin tone can handle it!! Sale people cool with experiment, they also know when to back the fuck up. ok whoops that was not cave man-ish of me at all.. anyway.. Me so happy to come here for me bronzer and blush. It cool place when you only want to buy MAC and go bye bye. Me like selection. Me end up buying some eye shadow! Me so bad!!!! Me need to stop spend money like water in MAC store! Me say Sephora suck it! Except when me need product from Nars and Urban Decay. Nars and Urban Decay.  Me dig you too.

45.description: The Mac store on Oak has a better selection than department stores since it has all the Mac colors available.  The quality is great and you have all the selections you could want.  The store is a little overwhelming since there is so much to look at, but the sales people are very helpful.  Beware though because they do like to try and sell you different types of color combinations that are a little on the wild side.  Even after I told the sales girl who was helping me that I'm really not into electric blue sparkly eyeshadow- she still kept pushing wild colors on me.

33.description: I love Mac. And I didn't start using it religiously until I had visited this store.Like someone else said, the staff is perfectly helpful and not at all pushy.I just came back from there stocked up with 3 of my favorite eyeshadows (Trax) and 4 of my favorite lip glosses (Amber Russe Lip Gelee).And I LOVE that they recycle their material. Seven tubes/pots for a free lip gloss or eyeshadow = rockin'!

43.description: I just LOVE the Mac Store on Oak. There are many things here that you can't get in department stores. The service might not be the best (I am very shocked at a few of the other reviews on here :*( ...). As for Mac makeup I am a total addict. I really recommend the pro palette and the eye shadows especially if you are a fan of very bright colors and very intense shadows! They just came out with some new liquid eyeliners that are a total dream. They are very pigmented, smooth, silky and they don't burn. I also recommend strobe cream, cream blush, paints and PIGMENTS! The Mac pigments are just so versatile and amazing. I wouldn't recommend their foundation; it is too thick and made me have a allergic reaction. If you would like to get a bargain on Mac and many other quality brands I would suggest checking out the Cosmetics company store in the Aurora, IL outlets.

2.description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE MAC.  As a woman of color, no other line comes close to having the range of colors that work for me.  The one star is due the fact that MAC's parent company has gone back to animal testing.  This is because they sell in China, and China requires animal testing.  Right now I'm managing between Tarte and Urban Decay.  But I'd love to be a MAC woman again.  BOO on animal testing!!

18.description: The artist that helped me got all of my celebrity references and helped me recreate the look I was going for flawlessly. And! You can return/exchange used product for any reason without getting strong-armed for an explanation.

41.description: go here if your mac store is out! they have everything!!!don't go here if you want a saleslady who is offering you the whole store and more. also i called to make a make-up appointment and asked about the application sessions. i couldn't hear her so i said "pardon me can you say that again?" and she repeated VERY LOUDLY and RUDELY "we only have one hour sessions in the _____ room" and replied "in the what room?" and she said it again. it was very unclear on what she had said, but gave up. i didn't want some stranger yelling at me anymore. it was also very uneccessary howe she was telling me what room its in. i just asked about the sessions- NOT THE ROOM. geeze.

4.description: Very helpful! Great selection! Love love love my new red lipstick.... Never thought I could wear such a bright color but my new CHILE matte red lipstick that the make-up artist helped picked out looks AMAZING!I came here with my mother and we had a really fun time. Also great selection of all the holiday pallets and gift sets, which other smaller stores sometimes sell out of quickly.

6.description: MAC, oh MAC. I *still* love thee!The ladies at this store are top notch. Always helpful, always encouraging experimentation with color, and getting out of one's comfort zone. I had the best time here recently with Emily. She was just great.I still say for the quality of the product and the price, AND the awesome Back2MAC program AND the Viva Glam line (all proceeds go to AIDS research), MAC is still my favorite "high end" makeup line, and the standalone stores are still far preferred to the department store counters.As a MAC devotee, I've visited standalones and pro stores all over the country and our little store on Oak Street is still tops with me.

22.description: My love for M.A.C runs strong & deep. I adore their eye shadows. The colors are so rich & vibrant and they have every shade under the rainbow. And don't get me started on their brushes. It literally changed my life when I got turned on to them. It's amazing the difference a brush can make. Blending, smudging, layering shades, my makeup took on a whole new life when I found the right brushes to apply with. But anyway, on to the store itself. I stop in here every couple of months because a salon I go to is across the street. The staff here is always on point. They are friendly & helpful but will leave you alone too if that's what you want. I once spent about a 1/2 hour with one girl trying to find just the right shade of red lipstick for me. Now that's service! And every once in awhile I'll just get my makeup done. I love the looks they come up with. It's always fun to have someone else do your makeup....even if you leave at 3 o'clock in the afternoon with bright aqua going out eyes!! My only caution is be prepared to drop some cash. Even when I'm on my best behavior I always manage to leave with at least one thing I didn't plan to buy. It's just so hard, all that pretty makeup just waiting, begging even, to be brought home! And I'm a sucker for it every time.

15.description: My God this is most stupid mac I have ever shopped at. Every time I go to buy something they're  out of it....then they always trying to sell u something similar. Damn just have my color or product. Macys and Nordstrom run their mac counter a thousand times better. U don't have to worry about me coming to shop here again. The Asian girl who works here is nice...everybody else and I mean this SUCKS!!!

20.description: I am not a huge make-up person. I stick with neutrals for work stuff and my goal in life is to look put together with as little work as possible. That said, I get my make-up done for special events so I don't have to learn how to do it or buy the make-up required and keep it around for once-in-a-blue-moon.I usually go to the woman in the salon inside my building but on Saturdays she is often doing weddings so she recommended I go to MAC for make-up before a friend's wedding. In her defense, she did say to ask for a specific person, but I didn't because I figured....hey they all work here, right? OMG It was off-the-chain horrible. I'm actually ready to cry again just thinking about it. I had to coach her through the session so I could get home in enough time to wash it off and re-do it myself. I thought maybe I could salvage it if she didn't go crazy, but no. It took a week to get all of the glue out of my lashes from her ridiculous placement of the false lashes. I had to scrub my face twice after to get most of it off.   Further, they weren't very sympathetic...trying to get me to buy more stuff and spend extra time in the store to "fix" it.

36.description: I truly like MAC cosmetics. I am a woman of a certain age, and I need all the help I can get!   That said, I also need salespeople who can keep me from looking like those crazy, old women who pluck their brows too much and wear green eyeshadow (circa 1970!). I also need someone who won't make me look like a Mary Kay reject and/or a Goth on crack!   That said, the staff at this particular MAC store has several people who are quite good at ensuring I look reasonably good...unfortunately, I am horrible at names!  Just ask for the girl from Indiana -- tall, dark hair, all-American face.  Or, the little blonde who dates the guy who lives in Texas.  See, I can't recall names...but can recall the details!?   Am not a big fan of the guy who works here...he tends to impose his own style on whomever he is working with....also found the older, Hispanic woman to be a tad 'off' when it came to selecting appropriate colors for an African American woman.  But, the aforementioned girls are quite good!

14.description: Sandra! You goddess of make up! You always make me look beautiful!The whole staff here is amazing and charming and always remember me and my friends.I never mind spending money here which is prob why I come in once a week!

1.description: This place is horribly managed. The pharmacy is constantly overwhelmed. I have tried to call them twice to ask a simple question. Both times I was placed on hold for over 10 minutes and then I had to hang up. Lines are constantly building up and the staff seems unmotivated and under-equipped to deal with the rush.

2.description: Maybe a little weird to review CVS... But that's okay.I've become a CVS junkie. I used to love my Walgreens on the corner, but I have to say, the CVS extra value card is so much more worth it! I've also noticed it's cleaner, and they have more stuff. And the staff is a LOT more friendly, at least at this location. Extracare card is pretty great. You get money back for how much you spend and sometimes even bonus dollars and things if you find the right items. It took me literally seconds to sign up for the card and I swear it has saved me a ton of money. You can use the dollars on anything you want, it's like a gift certificate. I've found that I'm in this place at least 3 times a week. I'm addicted :)

0.description: It's a CVS.  Great.  Well, this review is solely for the experience revolving around drinking in the Rush and Division area.If you need an ATM, go ahead and use the one in this CVS.  Why?  Because this place is never busy and is pretty clean.  You're generally in and out without being hassled by the dregs of society.  If you need a post-lube Powerade/Gatorade/whatever, then go to this CVS and lube up.  Always drink a pint or two of something non-alcoholic post-lube to attempt to avoid the hangover.  If you need drunken grub, then don't go to this CVS because the selection is paltry.  You're better off going to the Walgreen's over on Dearborn.  Regardless, do try to eat something after all the drinking you do on Division to help avoid the hangover.  Feel free to print out this review and carry it with you as a cheat sheet should you go out drinking on Division.  You're welcome.Three stars.

12.description: I am VERY particular about who I go to for waxing when it comes to my eyebrows... Not only have I gone to Marta since I moved to Chicago 3 years ago, I followed her from her old place of business @ Nail Bar to her new place City Waxing! Marta is an artist and she does my eyebrows perfectly each time. I have also gone to her for Brazilian waxes, which are very painful and uncomfortable, but she makes them almost pain free and she does the fastest job possible! Honestly I have been in and out of there in 7 minutes flat two different times before vacations. She gets the job done fast so you aren't sitting there in pain and uncomfortable all night & I really appreciate that. Excellent service!!! I will not go anywhere else for eyebrows in Chicago!!

7.description: Marta was great! She was quick and painless! She is also very sweet. Glad I went and will definitely go back again. Highly recommend her.

3.description: these ladies do an excellent job!  Marta is sweet, quick and a perfectionist.  She asks what works for your skin and body and makes hard / soft waxing adjustments as needed.I refuse to go anywhere else!

1.description: Well deserved 5 stars! Marta is so nice,  professional and her space is very clean and organized.  She is located half a block away from where I work so it's also extremely convenient and I'm so glad she is close by.  I'll be a regular here! Thanks Marta!

2.description: Marta is amazing! She makes the process as painless as possible - from start to finish! The space is super clean, efficient and organized. When I was struggling through my session, she acted like a coach trying to get me through the last few tough ones. Definitely recommend!

9.description: Marta was amazing!! Her speed, accuracy and patience was amazing!! First time going and will definitely be back!

10.description: Love this place! It is right in river north and they are open late. Marta is very nice and professional. Salon is very clean and modern. Great job!

13.description: Martha was great! Purchased a groupon and this was my first time getting a wax in "that" area. She was so sweet and definitely made the process as easy as possible Will be coming back!

16.description: I discovered The City Waxing through Groupon and I am so happy that I finally found a great place to get waxing done in my neighborhood.  Marta is great, and her services are both well done and reasonably priced!

17.description: Summary: if you haven't found a great bikini wax in Chicago, this is it!! -- I started going to Marta about 6 years ago for waxing. Work and grad school have taken me to a different state, and every time I visit Chicago I schedule a visit to see her. She is SO quick and completely thorough. Her new location is ideal, right off of north Michigan ave, very easy to get to by red line or bus.  Very reasonably priced, clean, friendly.  Marta is the BEST.

15.description: I followed Marta from her previous salon when she left to open her own. She is fantastic! She max a Brazilian wax virtually painless and so fast!

0.description: Marta does such a fantastic job- both in terms of being thorough and catering to her client's individual needs! I have a low pain tolerance and don't get regular waxes so I was nervous going in. However, she made me feel at ease immediately. It was one of the most positive bikini waxing experiences I've had! I'll definitely be going back.

5.description: This place was awesome! I really hate bikini waxes because I have a super low pain tolerance (I know I know!) She was super fast and for a "basic" bikini did a lot. Most places only do the sides for the same price. It was super clean too. I'll definitely be back in four weeks for a repeat appointment.

11.description: I found this on groupon. Marta was awesome and has a super interesting life story. She was so nice and it was quick and easy. Would def go again!

8.description: Can't remember the name of my technician (a very sweet Polish lady) but just went there for a bikini waxing and I am very happy. Nice conversation, very clean room, painless waxing and reasonable price (she was even nice enough to charge me less because I didn't have a lot. Talk about being very honest! ). Will definitely go back.

4.description: Amazing! I had my first Brazilian wax and Marta made me feel so comfortable and at ease. She was quick which was much appreciated. I also had my eyebrows and lashes tinted and she did an amazing job! I will definitely be going back!

14.description: Marta is amazing. I've been going for about a year and she has never disappointed! Always gets everything done super fast and it looks perfect!!!

6.description: I actually look forward to my waxing appointments! :) Marta is so sweet, professional and makes you feel very comfortable. The space is clean and Marta makes everything as quick and painless as possible! She is extremely knowledgeable and talented, plus the prices are great. Definitely recommend!

58.description: Have you ever felt confident that the next generation of emerging minds in this country will help lead us to the America we all dreamed of..? Well I know that is a weird thought to have but this beach will definitely change your mind. Stupid, drunk, college kids from the suburbs... If that's your thing.. Then this is a place for you. Think of this beach as the Midwest Jersey Shore but shittier.. The water here seems to always be dirtier than the other beaches because it's sort of a cove..I think stuff just washes up here and gets stuck..  I would avoid this beach and just go up to North Avenue where there are even more shenanigans going on but at least the water and sand is cleaner.

56.description: their dos equis shandy is THE shit.  THE.  SHIT.

29.description: This place has awful food and drinks. The food came out in about 3 minutes which is great but means that everything is obviously pre made. Drinks were a sugary mess. $12 for something so sweet I literally could bear to finish. The servers were very nice and the beer was still beer so the experience could have been worse but when my bill for lunch for two is $100 and I don't want to eat it and only finish half of my drinks, you deserve 1 star. You can't survive one a nice venue forever. And security was a little bossy but that didn't have a ton to do with the negative review.

42.description: This place is the anti-yelp. You might as well give them a "I don't  give a shit what yelpers think" sticker. They're current at 1.5 stars as I'm writing this review and they can care less. OSBF+D don't care. This place will be packed every sunny weekend for the rest of the summer and probably most sunny weekdays as well. Their drinks and food are overpriced but no one seems to care. It's the price you pay for a nice location on the beach.

23.description: The best part about our experience here, on our first day in Chicago was feeding the birds the crumbs. We waited over 20 minutes for service and had actually stood up to leave when the server arrived to take our order.  Once the order was placed, the nachos and drinks arrived promptly.  However the drinks were horrid and we shoulda had a beer from a can.  The mango margarita tasted and looked like frozen lemonade concentrate.  Then we waited over 30 minutes for our ticket.  I just wanted to get out of the sun and get a drink of water to wash the taste from my mouth!  Next time I visit Chicago we will take a picnic to the beach and drink at the hotel.

47.description: Pathetic food,music in dining area grossly loud with terrible sound, a chair rail that blocks view of wonderful beachfront, poor service and a total disappointment.  Bring back beachstro!!!!!!!!

8.description: Drinks are strong and expensive ($12 for a cocktail).Food I'd a bit pricey but very decent.A DJ plays and keeps the ace lively.You know what your in for...

31.description: Although the view is very nice, the food was a tragedy. I ordered the chicken tacos which arrived cold and bland. They give you 6 shells but you can really only full 2 with the amount of food they provide. Regarding the drinks; I paid $8 for a beer on tap that they sold for $6 in the bottle (which both were approximately 16oz after the head faded away). The onlyPositive was the staff. They were quick to help and noticed when your beer was low. When they asked about the tacos and I responded "they are not anything special" they were willing to rectify it by getting me something else. Overall:Drinks - overpricedFood - terribleService - great

34.description: A lot of pretty poor reviews for here...  Not sure why.This is a great place to come on a sunny summer Saturday or Sunday afternoon and have a couple ice cold beers, people watch, and if you have the nerve, take a swim in Lake Michigan.  Great views of the lake and beach and everything associated with that.We had a medium sized group and had a very good time.

16.description: If you like paying 12 bucks for a drink, this is the place for you! Don't get me wrong, the drinks were good, and I was definitely a little red after one, but I'm sure they take the ambiance into consideration when pricing these drinks.  It's got a great view of the lake and there's a DJ playing music too.

13.description: Awesome spot to be, and nice service, but they really need to improve the food. We got ours served on the top half only of a plastic to-go container.

11.description: What the hell happened to this place? I remember coming here a few years ago and having delicious margaritas served in nice glasses and decent food. The palm trees were neat and gave the restaurant a nice ambiance. You felt as though you were at a beach side cafe in Florida. Now it's more like a Jersey Shore wannabe party scene with cheap plastic furniture, Solo cups, overpriced frozen "food" and crappy B96 music.I don't mind paying $12 for a good drink, but my frozen marg was way too sour, they don't have salt for it and it's in a big ol classy plastic cup. It gave me heartburn! wtf. A Summer Shandy or Heineken will set you back $8! It's expensive, but a somewhat better deal than the gross pre-mixed drinks. The food is abysmal and overpriced for what you get. My Cheez Wiz laden Tostito nachos weren't anything special and the portion was tiny for $8.50! Service wasn't as bad as I thought at least. My favorite part was waiting 45 minutes for a table when there were TONS of empty ones! This place has a lot of potential, but the owners don't seem to give a crap. It's nothing more than a glorified concession stand.

39.description: So cute and beachy.... Great food

37.description: I have no problem dropping $10-$15 for a great cocktail at Publican, Maude's, Wood, etc., but $12 for a sickeningly sweet margarita is a little over the top, even for me.  Of course, since there are no other options available, they can charge whatever they like.The only saving grace?  Beautiful day and great company (gratis)!

0.description: Situated on Oak Street Beach this is a wonderful place to watch the Chicago Air Show! I was lucky enough to share a table with some really cool ladies. Tables are hard to get on the day of the air show, so you almost have to share if your party does not take up the whole table.  It was an extremely hot day in August when the air show took place so I was a little desperate for shade. I was on the outside of the fence for the restaurant, and saw a table of ladies and asked them how to get a table. They told me I could just come join them because they had seats open. I jumped on their offer and told them my gal pal was on her way to join me so we were going to need two seats. No problem! I was talking with them and watching the air show, but soon after I sat they left. My friend arrived shortly after, so we had the table to ourselves for a little while. We ordered drinks, and watched more of the air show.  A little while later a couple asked if they could sit with us, and they were so cool! The four of us had drinks and we got a bit of food. I had a Chicago style hot dog which was really good! Our waiter was really amazing as well! It was unbelievably packed that day, but he took great care of our table.All in all it was an awesome day, the company was great and the air show was amazing especially from the comfort of shade and chairs to relax in. I'd want to come back to Oak Street Beach food & drink to watch the air show again! If I was in the area I'd also come back for an evening on the beach because this is a cool spot to hang out.

38.description: I know people give this place very bad reviews because of the food and the service or whatever, but it's a great place for a beach bar!I think the food's good, pretty much what you should expect from fast grilled food cooked on a beach. The tacos are awesome! It's in a great location and it's nice to just come in here after tanning for a while to enjoy food and drinks. The service is okay as well. I definitely stop by every time I visit the beach.

51.description: Nice looking place and on the beach but that is all. The food is overpriced and marginal at best. $6 for a kids' PBJ, an orange and rotting veggies. A very dry chicken sandwich with no mayo; skipped the slaw in order to avoid food poisoning.

27.description: This is a great place to visit if you're on the beach and need to grab a quick bite to eat or would simply like to people watch along the water on a summer day.  The food is not that great, think glorified carnival food (chips, over-processed guac, hot dogs, burgers, and boring salads) at a higher price.  The drinks are decent, although expensive.  The service was pretty good, but it took a while for the server to notice that we needed a clean table and wanted to place an order.  That's likely due to the fact that many patrons just like to walk up to the main window and order food on their own, so it may not have been clear that we needed service at the table.  I'd go back here for a good cocktail on the beach, but that's about it.

32.description: I wish I knew about this place earlier this summer.   Nice spot, with amazing views.Nice crowd and the bathrooms were actually clean, unlike Castaways.I wish they had better music.Will def be back before summer is over.

54.description: Their website says, "Thirsty Thursdays - $5 frozen drinks!", so my friends & I went after work. We were charged $10 per drink, and when we mentioned the website, the barteneder simply replied, "That's $10 per drink. Thanks." so aside from false advertising, the bartender was cluesless & rude. I live in the neighborhood & thought this would be a nice after work visit to the beach, but don't waste your time going here. They're not even equipped for tourists.

48.description: Sure the location is great.  Fantastic view of the waterfront and the skyline, however you can get all that for free from the public beach.The Oak Street Beach Restaurant is way overpriced and  seriously deficient in quality.  I wouldn't mind paying a bit extra for the location/views but I would at least expect the food to be mediocre.  Instead it was barely even edible. To give you an idea of the prices, they charge $4 for a 20 oz bottle of water, $4.50 for a 20 oz bottle of soda and $7.50 for a Miller Lite.  Don't waste a dime here.I used to think the old Oak Street Beachsto (same location) was mediocre but this is much worse.  How could this happen?  Don't waste even a nickel on this place.(I would also like to point out that not one of the Yelp reviews from 2012 gave it more than two stars.  With any luck in 2013 maybe someone will take over that knows how to make this a decent destination.)

44.description: The service at this restaurant is absolutely terrible. We came for burgers at lunchtime and it took the servers 20 min + just to come to our table to greet us and take our order. Then we waited another 20-25 minutes for our drinks and another 40 minutes for our sub-par, cold food. They refuse to serve tap water, you have to buy a bottle if you want any water. I recommend others to stay away from this place!

24.description: On a beautiful day, this place can't be beat in terms of location. With the city skyline on one side and the waves on the other, it's pretty spectacular. I came here for lunch and had a great chicago style hot dog. The drinks are a little overpriced, but I think you're paying for the location, which, did I mention, is really good. Compared to the other beach dining options in chicago ::side eye to Caffe Oliva:: this place is a no brainer. Oak street beach itself is clean and lively, and the sprawling patio with cheerful yellow umbrellas is a great place to unwind.

7.description: On a beautiful day, this place can't be beat in terms of location. With the city skyline on one side and the waves on the other, it's pretty spectacular. I came here for lunch and had a great chicago style hot dog. The drinks are a little overpriced, but I think you're paying for the location, which, did I mention, is really good. Compared to the other beach dining options in chicago ::side eye to Caffe Oliva:: this place is a no brainer. Oak street beach itself is clean and lively, and the sprawling patio with cheerful yellow umbrellas is a great place to unwind.

49.description: The bartender was nice, service was good, food tasted fine but was mediocre at best.  If you go here, know that you are only paying for location and that's it.  We enjoyed sitting near the edge and watching/listening to the waves, but this place should only be visited by those spending all day at the beach and who don't want to leave to get nourishment.   This isn't worth it for the working-person's lunch or dinner.

40.description: My fiancé and I and another couple planned a dinner at the Oak Street Beach Café last night, Sunday July7th. We knew the menu would be limited and not cheap, but the good location and atmosphere would outweigh the negatives; so we thought.  Just a slice of the evening: -Waited 15 minutes for a server to come to our table-The bar ran out of water-Ran out of Burgers-Ran out of Fish tacos-Ran out of French fries-Pretty expensive for "concession stand" food-Terrible service- we waited 15 minutes for her to just come over to our table, she spilled a margarita on one of our friends, she walked away after taking 3 out of 4 of our orders (literally, my fiancé had to grab her and ask her to take my dinner order), forgot to put our appetizer order in, then told us we were still getting our appetizer- after our dinner was on the table, and we were obviously being charged, and then the appetizer she brought was wrong, never asked if we needed anything  for food or new drinks, and at the end of the meal and the $100.00 check came, she stood next to our table, waiting for it to be filled out so she could take it. We tipped her, however we tipped her lower than what we would have normally tipped. Since she was standing at the table waiting for the check, she immediately looked at it and gave us one of the dirtiest looks I've ever seen! It was fairly unbelievable. I understand it's a small little beach bar that employs local young people for the summer months, and I also understand its not Morton's Steak House and to expect the service to be somewhat different, obviously. But the level of service that we received was really terrible, and the food or ambiance of the location did not really come close to making up for it. I wish I could say that I would consider trying this place again, but I know that is a lie.  Not a return customer here, nor will I ever recommend this place to anyone I know!

53.description: Nice staff buuut.... Way overpriced food and drinks. You could be about to pass out and all they can do is give you a $4.00 bottle of water. Smh. I'll be at north ave until this changes into a laid back FUN place. Can someone tell them to try playing relaxing beach music instead of 80's!? Duh

30.description: The first problem was that, as a 68 year old man, I was "carded" by two big burly club type bouncers.  Now get this.  I had forgotten my wallet and was with my wife and another friend both 67 with i.d.  The bouncer would NOT let me in b/c I had no i.d. Duhhhh!   Hello common sense!  I breathed deeply, restrained my temper and politely asked to see the Manager who came to the entrance.  I explained that as a 68 year old I didn't think I should be carded--he agreed and "allowed me" to go in to the restaurant tables.The food was OK and we had an excellent server.  Fortunately the sun was out, the waves were gentle, the beach was like Fort Lauderdale--a wonderful experience AFTER one was admitted.Sooo...remember to bring your i.d. even if you are 86 years old in a wheel chair!  Go and enjoy the sunshine!

46.description: Not surprised that the drinks were over-priced because of the location, but was very surprised that their drinks were so terrible.  Blueberry mojito was awful and my wife couldn't even get halfway thru her drink.  If you go there, stick to beer.  If you are going to charge big boy prices, then hire some real bartenders.

1.description: Here's the run down.  There is a beach.  This beach is next to Gold Coast.  This beach has a bar/restaurant on it.  This place probably pays a lot of money to be there.  This place in turn charges people a lot of money for very OK drinks.We didn't care.  We came to enjoy the nice day, watch people running around, and enjoy time with friends.  This place made that happen.  I can't comment on the food or waitstaff, but the booze was fine and you know what you are getting when you walk up.  There aren't any other options either.

55.description: Fun idea, poorly executed.  Drinks took forever and it was empty!  Didn't try the food tho. Only bright spot is free yoga on thursdays next to the bar.  Afterwards Oak Street Beach gives you a deal on drinks.  $5.  Though my Rum Runner was gross.

9.description: This is a beautiful place to sit and have a drink on the beach. The problem? Poor service. The servers were far too busy with each other to wait on me. I had to request service to order, I was never asked if I wanted anything else to drink or eat, and I had to go all the way to the bar to get my check where my server was dancing. These young people need some supervision.

26.description: This place gave me a raw grilled chicken sandwich and didn't even offer to compensate me for anything. They just gave me a new entree that I had to pay for. The chicken was pink and raw and I noticed it after I ate part of the sandwich.Does the chef know how to cook a chicken?So disgusted. I do not recommend this place. And beware if you order the chicken.

25.description: We ordered a chicken sandwich and a burger.  These were the two worst sandwiches I have ever eaten.  I refused to finish mine and when my husband offered to switch, wouldnt finish his either.   Both of us found it disgusting.  The hamburger meat was so cheap it tasted like a bad hot dog.   For the record... I am NOT a picky eater and dont expect gourmet food at a beachside snackbar but this was uncommonly awful.  These people should not be serving food.  Both the chicken and the burger were also cold calling into question food safety.  Go here for drinks but steer CLEAR on the food.

12.description: A lot of pretty poor reviews for here...  Not sure why.This is a great place to come on a sunny summer Saturday or Sunday afternoon and have a couple ice cold beers, people watch, and if you have the nerve, take a swim in Lake Michigan.  Great views of the lake and beach and everything associated with that.We had a medium sized group and had a very good time.

59.description: I had not eaten at the restaurant since the Levy group took over last year.  The food is mediocre at best.  The setting is lovely by Lake Michigan and the beach.  This evening is the last nice evening for the next week.  That still does not make up for the poor quality of the food.  The veggie burger with cheese tasted like it was recooked with a stale bun.  The cheese fries with mystery meat was not any better.  They tasted like food that had sat all day. There were not many dinners this evening but that is no excuse for the poor quality of food.  Maybe every knew about the food except us.  (I did not check yelp before we went)  Fortuanley we drank beer.  Not much could go wrong there.  It was cold.  We are locals and we will not be back.

21.description: The ONLY compliments I have about this place are: 1) Its location on the lakefront beach (likely the only reason it's still around), 2) the porter potties (this was my first time in one so luxurious), and 3) the DJ (who spun some funky Chicago house music).  Now to what I did not like... For $12-$14, I EXPECT a customed-made, well-balanced drink, NOT something pre-mixed, which mine clearly was.  I'm glad the server was willing to take back my drink, but what he replaced it with was only a marginal improvement.  Hell, they couldn't even mix a proper Sex on the Beach or Piña Colada.  Seriously?!  How in the world do you screw THAT up?!  Meh.

17.description: I never really give bad reviews and i've been here a few times but my last experience was horrible.  First of all ordered 2 drinks from the beach bar-horrible disgusting, watered down and over priced.  Decide to go over to the bar area to get a drink the staff was clearly hung over or just complete idiots.  Stood there trying to get someone attention for over 10 mins, it wasnt even packed.  Its like the bartender was ignoring us intentionally and only serving new people that were walking up to the bar.  The person sitting next to us saw this and even tried to help get their attention.  RIDICULOUS! like I said before, It was not even that packed.  SERVICE SUCKS.  The only reason i am giving this place 2 stars is because the first time I came ordered a burger and a couple drinks had ok service.  The food sucks tho, ive had bar food better than this.

10.description: $9/3oz guac with week old chips. $12 vodka lems and service with a smile. A beach bar with no Malibu. Smells like toilet.

5.description: Excellent cocktails and service when we sat at the Bar. I had the peach margarita which was tangy and not overly sweet, and my cousin had the Pina Colada which was a tad dense but still enjoyable. We also had the guacamole and cheesy waffle fries (if you're on the fence add chicken because I wish we did) the guacamole was slightly spicy and refreshing and the fries were seasoned like curly fries with a (not so) healthy serving of  cheese sauce but that's what you're ordering it for! If I was here for longer I would go back!

3.description: This place is a great chill location on weekday nights - we come usually around 7 - Good friendly service, decent music and yummy frozen margaritas!  The crowd is easy going and a total mix of everything.  Bathrooms are clean and kept tidy.  The menu has a good selection of each food:)

35.description: I have been here a couple of times, I prefer the prior Oak Street Beachstro. While it is in a great location on the beach, the prices are high for drink/food/service that cannot even reach the mediocre mark

19.description: This is a great place to visit if you're on the beach and need to grab a quick bite to eat or would simply like to people watch along the water on a summer day.  The food is not that great, think glorified carnival food (chips, over-processed guac, hot dogs, burgers, and boring salads) at a higher price.  The drinks are decent, although expensive.  The service was pretty good, but it took a while for the server to notice that we needed a clean table and wanted to place an order.  That's likely due to the fact that many patrons just like to walk up to the main window and order food on their own, so it may not have been clear that we needed service at the table.  I'd go back here for a good cocktail on the beach, but that's about it.

28.description: The atmosphere was pretty good...but the food was overpriced and subpar. Avoid the nachos. The bouncers at the front make it seem very unwelcoming for children. If you're an adult and want to pay $12 for a beer, go for it. I'd rather enjoy the beach and eat/drink elsewhere.

45.description: You you would think that this place owuld have it all, great location on the lakefront, open just 6 months, give or take a year...the service was below the norm, not a waitress to be found the day before the airshow.  I would recommend this place only for the fact that is one of two or three places on the lakefront that offers food and beverage on the beach.  The beers were overpriced, I pay the same amount when I go to a stadium to watch a sports team.

33.description: What the hell happened to this place? I remember coming here a few years ago and having delicious margaritas served in nice glasses and decent food. The palm trees were neat and gave the restaurant a nice ambiance. You felt as though you were at a beach side cafe in Florida. Now it's more like a Jersey Shore wannabe party scene with cheap plastic furniture, Solo cups, overpriced frozen "food" and crappy B96 music.I don't mind paying $12 for a good drink, but my frozen marg was way too sour, they don't have salt for it and it's in a big ol classy plastic cup. It gave me heartburn! wtf. A Summer Shandy or Heineken will set you back $8! It's expensive, but a somewhat better deal than the gross pre-mixed drinks. The food is abysmal and overpriced for what you get. My Cheez Wiz laden Tostito nachos weren't anything special and the portion was tiny for $8.50! Service wasn't as bad as I thought at least. My favorite part was waiting 45 minutes for a table when there were TONS of empty ones! This place has a lot of potential, but the owners don't seem to give a crap. It's nothing more than a glorified concession stand.

43.description: Oak Street Beach Food and Drink- what a phenomenally original name, is worse than the most generic Wrigleyville sports bar. From the lousy tacos to the ugly chairs and tables to the lack of any charm to the absolutely dismal bartenders, Oak Street Beach Food and Drink fails on so many levels. During this year's first and last visit, the bartenders deliberately ignored me and three other female customers in favor of coddling groups of bare chested males. The other girls gave up and left. A gentleman sitting next to me who appeared well taken care of offered me some ordering assistance.  Is this what I would have to resort to  in 2013?:)    Other than bad service , the decor is primitive and almost  an insult to the lake setting. Could Levy &Co not find it in their hearts to invest a few thousand bucks more for some decent parasols and a more appealing aesthetic? The steep drink prices ($10 for cheap white wine) and the incompetent or rude bartenders won't make up for the empty tables, but will hopefully contribute to this place changing owners again..

2.description: This is a nice little beach spot. Drinks are a little pricier, but hey, it's on the beach! I came over here for a get together with friends. The girl who originally organized the event sadly couldn't make it, so we were kind of flying blind. We didn't know if she had made an reservation or anything, but a manager was able to help us out and set us up with some tables.The waitress/service was...alright? I'm not really sure how to describe it. She seemed annoyed that we were such a large group, but she was attentive. The drinks were kind of slow thought, which was not her fault. Most of us ordered the premixed frozen drinks, so I don't know how those could take longer than a couple minutes. One girl ordered "She's a Peach", which needed to actually be mixed by a bartender and that took a ridiculous amount of time (like 10+ minutes). It's not like it was super busy or anything, so I wasn't sure why things were taking so long.The atmosphere for the most part was nice. There were games and a lot of places to sit. We were seated close to the bathroom/trash area though, so it kind of smelled. If I were to go back, I'd probably want to sit somewhere else.Oh, there were some really stupid people here though (once again, not their fault). There were people who kept trying to smoke within the area, even though smoking is prohibited. There was also this idiot group of guys who kept taking our chairs! Without asking! They were super rude and there was one guy who decided to swing his nasty, sand covered socks everywhere. He ended up getting sock sand all over us and in our DRINKS. He then barely said out an apology, and left. Good riddance. Anyway, other than that dummy, it was a nice time because it was a beautiful day. The drinks were good, but overall everything was just alright. If you're here and you want a drink, you might as well just go for it.

18.description: Worst worst worst worst service I have ever had. Bar is next to open port-a-lets: smelled like sewage . What a great spot and location . Seriously almost like they want to go out of business .

41.description: The location of the bar was great and the glorified port-a-potty was relatively clean but that's about it.  The service wasn't horrible.  The menu is limited and very "greasy".  They could do so much with it if someone tried.  The drinks were mehhhhh.  We had Mai Tai's that weren't bad but nothing to rave about.  I thought they were expensive for Friday happy hour.  I then switched to a margarita.  After drinking one, I started feeling horrible.  Not because of the alcohol but because of the margarita mix.  Needless to say, there is room for improvement.  The best part is the views and people watching.

52.description: This place has really gone downhill in the last year. It used to be an amazing oasis in the middle of the city. They had table service a nice sized section of lounge chairs, waitresses, a decent set of bags, they even had a couple decent beers (White Rascal) for like $6 a pop. One day I was there they even had an all inclusive pig roast party that was amazing. Every time I would come here it was really hard to leave to say the least.That was last year... Now they have replaced the lounge chairs with more tables and chairs that are completely unnecessary because the place is never packed. They built a huge bar that seriously makes probably some of the worst drinks I've ever had. Their beer selection is terrible and way overpriced. Food is mediocre at best with no table service that I noticed. The bags they have set up are of the lowest quality imaginable. Throw a bag the board falls over every time. You'd think after the remodel they could at least invest a little money in a decent set. Nope... On top of all this they have some weird wrap around the entire place making it difficult to even see the water when sitting upright in a chair trying to relax.I understand there is new ownership but it actually amazes me how someone could royally screw up something that would be so easy to make great and that was so great before. Maybe I would give it an extra star because it's on the beach if I had never been here in the past, but knowing what it was before and what it could be I just can't bring myself to do it.

50.description: Fun! Great location right on Lake Michigan. Really delicious steak tacos.

4.description: Gross!!!!!! It smells so bad here from the bathrooms and the food is awful.  Soggy quesadilla and a salad with old vegetables, served on some kind of plate that looks like a lid.  Awful. Won't eat ere again... The smell is unbelievable and makes gross food even grosser. Understaffed as well.  Poor servers.

6.description: If I were Spider-Man I'd be among kin.Spider apocalypse 2015. No.. But really this place was coated in spiders and smelled like the underside of a filthy port o john. Nevah will return!

22.description: Drinks are strong and expensive ($12 for a cocktail).Food I'd a bit pricey but very decent.A DJ plays and keeps the ace lively.You know what your in for...

15.description: I love the beach feel while at Oak Street Beach. I feel like I am on vacation! It is much cleaner than Castaways, a beach bar just down the beach. The quality of service and the quality of people are much better overall at this location. I enjoy the cocktails that are served, especially the frozen ones! The game bags is available to play, and the actual beach is right next door. Sometimes there are DJs that play. I am looking forward to summer already!

57.description: This place is horrible now.  It used to be good, food and drink were reasonable, they even bought in palm trees and flowers to make it feel like you were on vacation but not any more.  Now it's all about making money, ridiculously overpriced and cheap looking.  The bartender even told my husband they didn't have any water when he asked for a cup with our drinks, only because he wanted us to buy an extremely overprice bottle, how's that for customer service!  The new owners LEVY have taken all the 'nice' out of this place.  Please don't go!

20.description: Went to beach to watch the Air and Water show, which was delayed and eventually cancelled...during the 1st delay, my kids explained how hungry they were , so i took them over to see if we could get some grubA gigantic line for an order up window, which would have been fine, but i have a toddler so would like to sit down so he could grab his food. I wait through most of the line, then ask the bouncer if we can go in and sit down, in which he refers me to a second bouncer who starts explaining the minimum amount required to sit at each table down in this area was $140...i have two kids both under 5 , can someone not recognize I am not there to spend over $140??? Eventually after i slipped him $5 he showed me the table area that was free...So we sat down and waited for a while, no server, i asked my buddy the bouncer whats up, he says servers don't visit this area, ( even though i see servers in the area serving booze to ogling drunks) He explains I would have to stand back into that gigantic line (which then i would lose my table)  I slipped him some more dough to let me cut line near the front and smooth it over with the third bouncer i hadn't tipped, but I still had a 20 min wait , and had to tip him extra to watch my kids while i stood in line$42 got me a hot dog , 2 cheeseburgers, 2 sodas and a beer. Hot dog was a large vienna sausage, cheeseburger buns were stale, beer was cold though and needed for this fiasco$50 total in food and tips for barely edible fare, had the air show not cancelled the view would have been perfect,  and music was really good,  but be warned its  not a place to take little kids no matter how hungry, its expensive and be prepared to tip everyone for everything...jump a cab and eat someplace else

36.description: The location of this bar is great and the fact that its not Castaways makes it even better. Its kind of a sh*t show though trying to get seated, getting orders taken, etc. You put your name in at the host stand and then you literally have to stand there for an hour while you wait. If you're not there when they call your name - they move on to the next party. I felt kind of bad for the tables towards the front because everyone was hovering over them while they ate. We were finally seated and put in an order of the corn dogs and nachos. They were out of the corn dogs. So disappointing. The portions are on the smaller side and the food is average. It definitely hits the spot if you're starving and tipsy, though! They were also out of frozen drinks - it was 85 degrees how is that possible? They seem to have kinks they still need to work out. Our waiter was great, and seemed apologetic every time he had to come to our table to tell us something we had ordered was no longer available. I definitely wont come rushing back as this is not my scene. Im sure its much more chill during the week.

14.description: Beach watching, waitstaff, bar tenders , drinks are sexy & great.Food is below grade school cafeteria taste & appeal.   Avoid the sandwich menu,  low quality meats soaking on a steam tray for hours.  Yuk

3.description: Okay, so this is a very convenient spot, where you can always go in case of groceries emergency. Only for this I would add a second star.But be aware that for using a credit card they charge you 44 cents each time, even if you buy something small. Today my husband paid in cash there and was confused by a small amount of change he got. The lady at the register showed him the change in his receipt and stated it was correct. However, at home we noticed that the receipt shows that we paid 4 dollars in cash - though we gave her a five dollar bill.
