Now I wonder what was in all those receipts the cashiers never gave me during my previous visits. Besides, many products don't have any price tag at all.

1.description: Very convenient location. They have all the basics as well as a small deli. They are open pretty late as well. They are a bit over priced but I guess that's to compensate for the location

2.description: 4 stars on the food!   Service  2 stars... The VERY unfriendly- and apparently untrained in customer service- tiny woman behind the deli counter practically had to be begged by me to help me. She acted as though my presence was an inconvenience to her-- which led me to write this review. In short GREAT FOOD but poor help.  You would think in this day and age people would be more appreciative of their jobs and want to keep them.  Perhaps she has been there long enough that she feels she doesn't have to put on the smile for the public anymore...not too sure!!

5.description: a little hidden gem in the historical gold coast...in the bottom of the 1350 N LSD apartment building with the entrance on Banks Street.  Store has superb hours and amazing staff.  Their products will shock you! They have the finest products to the most general ones and everything in between.   The employees will learn your names and make you feel like you are at home.   The deli is fresh and tasty! Try their egg salad is homemade and memorable! SUPERIOR wine selection.  I would come here and pay the convenience fee before going to Jewel for the quality and service.   Fresh gourmet coffee is available every morning.  They even have an ATM.  Their frozen food department is phenomenal and if you every want something ask...they will make it happen! With the Jewel on Division closing soon remember this place! Its the BEST!!!

6.description: I love the commissary! The staff is so friendly and helpful. They carry so much for such a small space. I've gone there looking for something specific and when they didn't have it, they listened to my requests and had it in the store the next week! It's so convenient, I love having them in the neighborhood. My friends and I are obsessed with the deli meats too, sooo good! We get sandwiches all the time. Delicious! Amazing service! Definitely recommend anyone and everyone to stop in and give them a try.

7.description: Have tried the deli well over 10 times. Have the best egg salad in the city. All the workers are chill and some of them pretty much know what I'm getting as soon as i walk in. (2 egg salad sandwiches)

8.description: This market is all about hospitality and convenience. I live right by this market and truly love coming here. The staff make it a point to remember your name and greet you and discuss what's new. They also know where every single product is located, be it spices or nails. The chicken salad is amazing and the wine selection is quite expansive for a small shop. If you're lucky they're even doing tastings every once in a while. I'd recommend checking this out for a great neighborhood experience and groceries on the go.

0.description: Lots of stuff in this small space. Good staff. Maria is helpful. Fresh donuts every morning. Fresh sandwiches everyday and hot fresh food monday - Friday. Beefs, Sloppy joe, Hot dogs, polish and soup and chili.Frozen pizzas and full stock of liquor beer and wine.8am - 11pm.Credit card accepted. ATM inside.

4.description: Sans a$$hole cashier-guy:Wonderfully convenient if you live in either 1350-1360, especially in the winter! Pricing is normal and their fruit/veggies are always fresh. Agreed that they could offer some more gluten-free selections...With a$$hole cashier-guy:Now, this isn't to say that everyone here is mean--I've met some very nice people who work here.  But there is one, one man who has ruined my experience and I will only go back when I loot the damn place during an icy zombie apocalypse.The a$$hole cashier-guy is a white guy in his mid-40s.  He is the only one in that sex/demographic that works there.  You can't mistake him.  I would call out his name, but he's never greeted me in the two years I've lived here (even though I've introduced myself more than once).It's a chore for him to do anything.  If you ask for some batteries (hanging in the back)--glare, scowl, huff, throw the batteries onto the table.  If you ask for some chapstick (behind him)--cringe, glare, twitch, thermo-nuclear explosion of passive-aggression.Hi, how is your day?  --Blank stare--(Well, f*ck you too.)Over the course of two years, I've been worn down.  He makes everyone who comes in feel uncomfortable, and unwelcome.  And one day I want to repay him.Finis.
